=== [[Talk:Fatima#rfc_059168C|Talk:Fatima]] expired 2018-01-01 23:01 ===
* Id: 059168C
* User: Sangdeboeuf
* Date: 2017-12-02 22:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|813698233|LANG 813698233}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|813774350|HIST 813774350}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|814638595|BIO 814638595}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|814638608|RELI 814638608}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|818156921|BIO 818156921}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|818156927|LANG 818156927}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|818156925|HIST 818156925}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|818156940|RELI 818156940}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Trying for a more centralized discussion to resolve the ambiguity of having pages titled {{xt|[[Fatima]]}} and {{xt|[[Fatimah]]}}, both of which names can refer to {{xt|[[Fatimah]]}}, the daughter of Muhammad, as romanized versions of the same name in Arabic (فَاطِمَة). A proposal at {{xt|[[Talk:Fatimah#Requested move 23 November 2017|Talk:Fatimah]]}} to disambiguate the title of {{xt|[[Fatimah]]}} found no consensus, with several users saying that {{xt|[[Fatima]]}} should redirect to {{xt|[[Fatimah]]}} as [[WP:PRIMARYREDIRECT|the primary topic]]. Meanwhile a proposal at {{xt|[[Talk:Fatima#Requested move 22 November 2017|Talk:Fatima]]}} to do just that and rename {{xt|[[Fatima]]}} as {{xt|{{no redirect|Fatima (disambiguation)}}}} was rejected. Please indicate which of the options below, if any, would clear up the confusion of names:

* Make {{xt|[[Fatimah]]}} the primary topic and rename {{xt|[[Fatima]]}} as {{xt|{{no redirect|Fatima (disambiguation)}}}};
* Keep the disambiguation page at {{xt|[[Fatima]]}} and make the title of {{xt|[[Fatimah]]}} less ambiguous (for example as {{xt|{{no redirect|Fatimah bint Muhammad}}}});
* Do nothing; leave the existing titles in place.

—[[User:Sangdeboeuf|Sangdeboeuf]] ([[User talk:Sangdeboeuf|talk]]) 22:56, 2 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Demisexuality#rfc_9BA2F63|Talk:Demisexuality]] expired 2018-01-03 02:01 ===
* Id: 9BA2F63
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2017-12-04 01:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|813558015|MEDIA 813558015}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|813558085|SOC 813558085}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|818354107|MEDIA 818354107}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|818354110|SOC 818354110}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
One argument is that [[demisexuality]] is a form of gray asexuality and is sufficiently covered at the [[Gray asexuality]] article, which is small. It is argued that per [[WP:Spinout]], [[WP:No page]] and [[WP:No split]], there is no need for "demisexuality" to be its own article. The other argument is that "many of the recent sources about demisexuality do not discuss it in the context of asexuality." 

If viewing this from the RfC page or a notification on your talk page, see [[Talk:Demisexuality#Attempted recreation of this page|the small discussion]] higher up on the talk page for more detail. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 01:32, 4 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Hair's breadth#rfc_4B91EC1|Talk:Hair's breadth]] expired 2018-01-03 21:01 ===
* Id: 4B91EC1
* User: The Land
* Date: 2017-12-04 20:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|813719032|LANG 813719032}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|813719037|SOC 813719037}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|818484319|LANG 818484319}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|818484326|SOC 818484326}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
So there is a dispute about what prominence the phrase "red cunt hair" should have in this article. The main reason to retain it is that it's legitimate sourced content and that [[wp:censor|Wikipedia is not censored]]. The reason to remove some, most or all mentions of it are that it gives [[wp:undue|undue weight]] to a relatively unusual phrase which appears to be from US military slang, in a way which just so happens to make an innocent article substantially focused on female genitalia. From the page history it appears that this material started off as a whole article on [[Red cunt hair]] that was then AfD'd and merged onto this page. Whether that is germane to what we do now, I'm not sure. In my personal view, the [[principle of least astonishment]] is also relevant to this situation. 

In the last few days there have been several versions:
#[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hair%27s_breadth&oldid=813682199 the most full-on version]
#[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hair%27s_breadth&oldid=813399366 retaining all of the material but with lower prominence]
#[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hair%27s_breadth&oldid=813384657 retaining mention of the subject but with less material and reduced prominence]
#[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hair%27s_breadth&oldid=813254402 removing "red cunt hair" entirely]

Which of these version should we adopt for the future development of the article? Regards, [[User:The Land|The Land]] ([[User talk:The Land|talk]]) 20:30, 4 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Templates#rfc_1A9F7B2|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Templates]] expired 2018-01-04 07:01 ===
* Id: 1A9F7B2
* User: TonyTheTiger
* Date: 2017-12-05 03:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|813774352|POLICY 813774352}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|818560203|POLICY 818560203}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
After repeated discussions at [[WP:BIDIRECTIONAL]] and [[WP:PERFNAV]], there has been no consensus to establish a policy to remove historical figures from navboxes. {{u|Woodensuperman}} (formerly known as User:RobSinden) is the main proponent of this proposed policy. Most recently this topic is at issue due to contentious editing at both {{tl|The Crucible}} ([[John Proctor (convicted witch)|John Proctor]], [[Abigail Williams (Salem witch trials)|Abigail Williams]], [[Thomas Danforth|Judge Thomas Danforth]], [[Elizabeth Proctor]], [[Samuel Parris|Reverend Samuel Parris]], [[John Hale (Beverly minister)|Reverend John Hale]], [[Thomas Putnam]], amd [[Giles Corey]]) and {{tl|Macbeth}} ([[Macbeth, King of Scotland]], [[Gruoch of Scotland]], [[Duncan I of Scotland]], [[Malcolm III of Scotland]], [[Donald III of Scotland]], [[Siward, Earl of Northumbria]], amd [[James VI and I|King James VI and I]]). Should we remove historical figures from navboxes of multimedia franchises?--[[User:TonyTheTiger|TonyTheTiger]] <small>([[User talk:TonyTheTiger|T]] / [[Special:Contributions/TonyTheTiger|C]] / [[WP:FOUR]] / [[WP:CHICAGO]] / [[WP:WAWARD]])</small> 03:40, 5 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Monopoly (game)#rfc_28AAF92|Talk:Monopoly (game)]] expired 2018-01-04 16:01 ===
* Id: 28AAF92
* User: Strawberry4Ever
* Date: 2017-12-05 15:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|813871054|STYLE 813871054}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|818616088|STYLE 818616088}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'm requesting comments on the proposed edits discussed above in the "Singular they" section. Currently the article includes these two sentences:
{{blockquote|When a player lands on Free Parking, they may take the money. Another rule is that if a player lands directly on Go, they collect double the amount, or $400, instead of $200.}}
The proposal is to change this to:
{{blockquote|When players land on Free Parking, they may take the money. Another rule is that if players land directly on Go, they collect double the amount, or $400, instead of $200.}}
As I said in the previous section, I think the use of "singular they" should be avoided if possible by rewriting sentences, where this can be done in a way that is [[WP:Gender-neutral language|gender-neutral]] and isn't awkward. [[User:Strawberry4Ever|Strawberry4Ever]] ([[User talk:Strawberry4Ever|talk]]) 15:44, 5 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Canada#rfc_13DC51D|Talk:Canada]] expired 2018-01-05 02:01 ===
* Id: 13DC51D
* User: Bokmanrocks01
* Date: 2017-12-06 01:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|813951326|POL 813951326}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|813973438|POL 813973438}}
* RFC Text:

{{Infobox country
|native_name = Canada
|government_type = [[Federalism|Federal]] [[parliamentary system|parliamentary]] [[constitutional monarchy]]}}
I propose we use the terms in the infobox I included, because the term "democracy" is too subjective, especially in the context of modern rhetoric where "Democracy" is held to be the greatest ideal. I think using "democracy" causes bias where a supposedly neutral encyclopedia article is effectively calling a certain country a "good" country, which in that case you might as well officially define the United States as a free country in its article, or using opinionated terms like "evil" in Nazi Germany's article. My point is, Wikipedia should be neutral, and even if you agree that Canada is a democracy, or the US is a free country, or Nazi Germany was evil, which many people including me do, it is not up to Wikipedia, which its only role is to provide objective facts. 

I also want to note that pretty much all of what would be seen as free democratic constitutional monarchies also don't use "representative democracy" in its infobox including [[:United Kingdom]], [[:Spain]], [[:Belgium]], [[:Norway]], [[:Netherlands]], [[:Sweden]], [[:Denmark]], or [[:Luxembourg]]. Neither do other commonwealth countries with Elizabeth II as its head of state such as [[:New Zealand]], [[:Jamaica]], [[:Papua New Guinea]], [[:Belize]], [[:The Bahamas]] and others. Australia also uses "democracy" but I'm willing to bet its the same person who added it to Canada. I'm told its irrelevant what other articles do, but I think a hint of consistency is also good sometimes. - [[User:Bokmanrocks01|Bokmanrocks01]] ([[User talk:Bokmanrocks01|talk]]) 01:18, 6 December 2017 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|816339383|MEDIA 816339383}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|816339386|SOC 816339386}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|818719191|MEDIA 818719191}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|818719194|SOC 818719194}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
One view is that an Audience (fan) response section is unencyclopedic and/or [[WP:Undue]] in this case because the backlash to the film is mainly reflected in polls that can be easily manipulated and those who have issue with the film are a significant minority. The other view is that, per [[MOS:FILM#Audience response]], an Audience (fan) response section can be encyclopedic and that it is [[WP:Due]] to include fan response in this case because various reliable sources have noted that there is significant discontent with the film among fans, which goes beyond polling, and that this discontent clashes with what professional critics are stating.        

Thoughts? If seeing this from the RfC page or from an alert on your talk page about RfC participation, see previous discussions on the article talk page, including [[Talk:Star Wars: The Last Jedi#Fan reaction]], for more detail. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 18:13, 20 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:National Rifle Association#rfc_97AF57A|Talk:National Rifle Association]] expired 2018-01-05 05:01 ===
* Id: 97AF57A
* User: Snooganssnoogans
* Date: 2017-12-06 04:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|813973438|POL 813973438}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|818719192|POL 818719192}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following text be added to a subsection entitled "Lack of advocacy for black gun owners" in the "Criticism" section:

<blockquote>The NRA has come under criticism for insufficiently defending gun rights for African-Americans.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/articles/2016-07-08/dallas-shootings-underscore-nra-hypocrisy-critics-say|title=Dallas Shootings Underscore NRA Hypocrisy, Critics Say|last=|first=|date=|website=usnews.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name=":6">{{Cite news|url=http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/jul/10/philando-castile-killing-nra-racial-divide|title=Philando Castile's killing puts NRA's gun rights mission at a crossroads|last=Beckett|first=Lois|date=2016-07-10|work=The Guardian|access-date=2017-12-06|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref name=":7">{{Cite news|url=http://www.myajc.com/news/why-african-americans-are-gun-shy-about-the-nra/8vkZEnxpS76Ag4TjaobMGP/|title=Why African-Americans are gun-shy about the NRA|work=myajc|access-date=2017-12-06|language=en}}</ref> Critics say that the NRA is typically quick to defend gun rights when the rights of white gun owners appear to have been violated but has stayed silent or offered muted and delayed responses in cases involving gun rights and black gun owners.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2017/06/30/politics/nra-philando-castile/index.html|title=Activists accuse NRA of racism for silence over Philando Castile|last=CNN|first=Deena Zaru,|work=CNN|access-date=2017-12-03}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2017/10/gun-control-racist-present-171006135904199.html|title=Gun control's racist past and present|last=Newton|first=Creede|website=www.aljazeera.com|access-date=2017-12-03}}</ref><ref name=":5">{{Cite news|url=https://www.politico.com/story/2016/07/nra-philando-castile-response-225310|title=NRA offers tepid comment on police shooting of Minnesota man|work=POLITICO|access-date=2017-12-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/crime/article89859017.html|title=For black gun owners, bearing arms is a civil rights issue|work=mcclatchydc|access-date=2017-12-06|language=en}}</ref><ref name=":7" /><ref>{{Citation|title=After the Castile Verdict, Some Ask: Where is The NRA?|url=http://www.wnyc.org/story/what-castile-verdict-means-african-american-gunholders/|language=en|accessdate=2017-12-06}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/robert-slayton/the-nra-is-racist_b_10927268.html|title=The NRA Is Racist|last=Slayton|first=Robert|date=2016-07-12|website=Huffington Post|language=en-US|access-date=2017-12-05}}</ref> The NRA rejects the accusations of racial bias.<ref name=":1" /> Others have argued that the NRA's inaction in prominent gun rights cases involving black gun owners, such as the case of Philando Castile, is not due to racial bias but is instead likely due to overly zealous support for law enforcement.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-watch/wp/2017/07/11/how-the-nras-allegiance-to-cops-undermines-its-credibility-on-gun-rights/|title=Opinion {{!}} How the NRA’s allegiance to cops undermines its credibility on gun rights|last=|first=|date=|website=Washington Post|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-12-06}}</ref><ref name=":6" /> </blockquote><blockquote>The NRA came under criticism from some of its own members and other gun rights advocates in June 2017 for its silence on the [[shooting of Philando Castile]] by a police officer at a traffic stop.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-nation/wp/2017/06/18/some-gun-owners-are-disturbed-by-the-philando-castile-verdict-the-nra-is-silent/|title=Some gun owners are disturbed by the Philando Castile verdict. The NRA is silent.|work=The Washington Post|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/opinion/commentary/ct-nra-washington-gun-lobby-20170619-story.html|title=How the NRA conquered Washington and abandoned gun owners like me|last=Valentine|first=Matt|work=chicagotribune.com|access-date=2017-06-21|language=en-US}}</ref> Castile had a valid firearm permit, informed the police officer about his gun, and was subsequently fatally shot by the police officer when he was allegedly attempting to retrieve his wallet.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-nation/wp/2017/06/21/what-the-police-officer-who-shot-philando-castile-said-about-the-shooting/|title=What the police officer who shot Philando Castile said about the shooting|last=|first=|date=|work=The Washington Post|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-07-31}}</ref> According to ''The Washington Post'', the NRA has typically "been quick to defend other gun owners who made national news", but stayed silent on the Castile shooting.<ref name=":0" /> Some critics attributed the NRA's silence to the fact that Castile was black.<ref name=":3" /><ref name=":4" /><ref name=":5" />&nbsp;On July 9, an NRA spokeswoman commented on the incident, saying it was "a tragedy" that "could have been avoided". Further comments were made by NRA spokeswoman, [[Dana Loesch]], who stated "He was also in possession of a controlled substance (marijuana) and a firearm simultaneously, which is illegal."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://reason.com/blog/2017/07/10/nra-breaks-silence-on-philando-castile-s|title=NRA Breaks Its Silence on Philando Castile Shooting|author=Jacob Sullum|date=July 10, 2017|work=Reason|access-date=July 10, 2017}}</ref><ref>http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/dana-loesch-explains-why-the-nra-didnt-defend-philando-castile/article/2631154</ref></blockquote><blockquote>[[Adam Winkler]], professor of constitutional law at the UCLA School of Law, noted that the NRA promoted gun control legislation in the 1920s and 1930s with the intent to reduce gun ownership by racial minorities.<ref name=":8">{{Cite news|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/112322/gun-control-racist|title=Gun Control Is “Racist”?|work=New Republic|access-date=2017-12-06|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2011/09/the-secret-history-of-guns/308608/|title=The Secret History of Guns|last=Winkler|first=Adam|work=The Atlantic|access-date=2017-12-06|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":9">{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/posteverything/wp/2016/07/15/the-right-to-bear-arms-has-mostly-been-reserved-for-whites/|title=The right to bear arms has mostly been for white people|last=Winkler|first=Adam|date=2016-07-15|work=Washington Post|access-date=2017-12-06|language=en-US|issn=0190-8286}}</ref> Winkler added that it was under this legislation that [[Martin Luther King Jr.]] had an application for a concealed carry license turned down in 1956 when he applied for one after his house was firebombed.<ref name=":8" /><ref name=":9" /> Winkler also argues that the Gun Control Act of 1968, which the NRA took credit for, was motivated out of a fear of black radicals and race riots.<ref name=":8" /> According to Robert Slayton, Professor of History at Chapman University, there is a precedence to NRA silence on gun-rights cases involving African-Americans.<ref name=":2" /> Slayton mentioned as an example the case of Earl D. Brown, an African-American security guard who carried a licensed weapon and was shot by police after Brown raised his hands and said "I'm security"; the NRA did not comment on the case.<ref name=":2" /> The widow of Brown criticized the NRA for its silence, "Honestly, I hear the N.R.A. talking about the right to bear arms. He had the right to bear his that night; they just never told us he wouldn’t have the right to life. It seems like white men and police officers are the only ones who have the right to bear arms in this country."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/09/us/black-gun-owners-police-shootings.html|title=Police Shootings Highlight Unease Among Black Gun Owners|last=Eligon|first=John|date=2016-07-08|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-12-05|last2=Robles|first2=Frances|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> Critics of the NRA also noted the organization's lack of a response and failure to offer condolences after [[Shooting of Alton Sterling|Alton Sterling]] was killed by police while legally carrying a firearm.<ref name=":1" /></blockquote>

[[User:Snooganssnoogans|Snooganssnoogans]] ([[User talk:Snooganssnoogans|talk]]) 04:26, 6 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jerusalem#rfc_D576723|Talk:Jerusalem]] expired 2018-01-05 16:01 ===
* Id: D576723
* Date: 2017-12-06 15:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|814042772|POL 814042772}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|818788742|POL 818788742}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Because of an ARBCOM decision that states any modification to the lead requires an RFC, here we are. Once Trump officially recognizes Jerusalem as Israel's capital, several parts of the lead needs to be rewritten. Below are the places I found that needs to be modified. Because this RFC is not a simple Yes/No, I think people should propose modifications and we can discuss those modifications.

----""Israelis and Palestinians both claim Jerusalem as their capital, as the State of Israel maintains its primary governmental institutions there while the State of Palestine ultimately foresees the city as its seat of power; however, neither claim is widely recognized internationally." 
The ending of this sentence needs modification, along with the NOTE3 that it references.


----"The international community does not recognize Jerusalem as Israel's capital, and the city hosts no foreign embassies. "
I propose "Most of the international community does.... (or OTher than the US, most of the international community.....)...." 15:30, 6 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Arrowverse#rfc_7CE176B|Talk:Arrowverse]] expired 2018-01-06 16:01 ===
* Id: 7CE176B
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2017-12-07 15:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|814249317|MEDIA 814249317}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|814249401|SOC 814249401}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|818958399|MEDIA 818958399}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|818958402|SOC 818958402}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
One view is that the ''[[Supergirl (TV series)|Supergirl]]'' television series '''should be''' mentioned as being a part of [[Arrowverse]] because a number of reliable sources state or imply that the show is a part of Arrowverse and because the show has been a part of Arrowverse crossovers. The other view is that ''Supergirl'' '''should not be''' mentioned as being a part of Arrowverse because the creators/showrunners have not identified it as being a part of Arrowverse. Thoughts? 

For those viewing this discussion from the RfC page or an alert on their talk page, see the [[Talk:Arrowverse#Supergirl]] discussion for more detail. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 15:13, 7 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Istvaeonic languages#rfc_A565064|Talk:Istvaeonic languages]] expired 2018-01-07 09:01 ===
* Id: A565064
* User: Andrew Lancaster
* Date: 2017-12-08 08:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|814362254|HIST 814362254}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|814362256|LANG 814362256}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|819081761|HIST 819081761}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|819081763|LANG 819081763}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We now have a template added to this article saying there is a proposal to merge this article, to [[Istvaeones]] and [[Weser-Rhine Germanic]]. This was [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Istvaeonic_languages&diff=814254734&oldid=814174320 added] by [[User:AKAKIOS]]. There is a complicated background I will try to explain:
*Actually ''there were no such articles'' when the "merge proposal" template was added, so this is not a normal merge proposal. These are effectively new articles (whatever their past) which were started by copying this article. And this was in fact done by the editor proposing, at the same time, that this article should be merged to the new articles. Talk page discussion has not been perfect, but probably the editor involved is actually proposing a split of this article?
*Currently we have all aspects of the term Istvaeones covered in this one article called [[Istvaeonic languages]]. There are at least 3 aspects: 1. classical ethnography (the original use of the term by Tacitus and Pliny, arguably the primary use); 2. Linguistics (but Istvaeones is not a common term in that field) and the conventional subject is currently mainly handled under other articles such as [[Frankish]] and [[Low Franconian languages]]. 3. Archaeological, but the more common term for this aspect seems to be "Rhine-Weser Germanic"? Currently this subject is not really being discuss much on English Wikipedia, except a tiny bit on talk pages.
*The one article approach is not new, but previously the material in this article was in the more generally titled [[Istvaeones]]. This was recently turned into a redirect and the material changed a lot and then moved to here, in a series of edits which initiated the current round of edits and discussions. (And then now this action has effectively been partly reversed with the original article receiving a modified copy of material from this new article.)
'''My proposals (feedback please):'''
1. First '''procedural''', while this discussion is proceeding, turn the 2 new articles, which are effectively [[WP:POVFORKS|POV forks]] now, back into redirects to this one article. Move all discussion to here also.
2. My proposal for this "merge" discussion is that, if there is agreement, we stick to a '''one article approach, but move back to [[Istvaeones]]'''.
3. Make the one article primarily about the history of the term, and therefore primarily about the classical ethnography texts.
4. The conventional linguistic aspect, where the term is occasionally used, is mainly handled elsewhere on Wikipedia, and only needs to be mentioned briefly in this Istvaeones article.
5. It seems to me so far that no one has yet written any material for Wikipedia about the supposed archaeological aspect. Until someone writes something significant it deserves no new article. For now it can still be mentioned in the Istvaeonic article, if sourceable, as yet another field where the term has occasionally been mentioned. 
6. FWIW I think that "Rhine-Weser" is a known term, but not "Weser-Rhine". I am not confident about how completely it overlaps with any meaning of Istvaeonic.--[[User:Andrew Lancaster|Andrew Lancaster]] ([[User talk:Andrew Lancaster|talk]]) 08:04, 8 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Be bold#rfc_C58131D|Wikipedia talk:Be bold]] expired 2018-01-07 20:01 ===
* Id: C58131D
* User: Staszek Lem
* Date: 2017-12-08 19:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|814448075|POLICY 814448075}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|819156283|POLICY 819156283}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Therefore I would like to suggest two additions: The first one says how not to use WP:BB, the second one says that instead slapping someone with WP:BB, with possible subsequent further bickering, you better boldly edit yourself.

:(shortcut: [[WP:NOTBOLD]]) '''Being bold [[WP:NOTCOMPULSORY|is not compulsory]]:''' People may have valid reasons for not being bold: one may have not enough time or expertise, one may be unsure in their criticism and wanting more feedback, etc. Therefore a reference to this guideline should not be used as a reprimand for something not done.
::[author's comment: I suppressed my urge to dwell more on the last statement: possible exceptions (e.g. when validly discussing someone's (mis)behavior) or consequences, such as hurt feelings of the criticized.]
:(shortcut: [[WP:BOLDBACK]]) '''Being bold works both ways:''' If you meet with a non-boldness, just fix the article yourself, and readers will see a better article much sooner. After that you may write in the talk page something like: "Thank you for pointing the issue out. I fixed it. Next time please [[WP:BB|be bold]] and don't hesitate to fix the problem yourself".
::[author's comment: I did this quite a few times as a follow-up when IP readers report in talk page some weirdness in an article.]

Since this is a non-trivial addition, I am askin for extra opinions. [[User:Staszek Lem|Staszek Lem]] ([[User talk:Staszek Lem|talk]]) 19:31, 8 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Classical music#rfc_F3C83EB|Talk:Classical music]] expired 2018-01-08 03:01 ===
* Id: F3C83EB
* User: 135.23.202.24
* Date: 2017-12-09 01:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|809600311|MEDIA 809600311}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|809600314|SOC 809600314}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|819212954|MEDIA 819212954}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|819212958|SOC 819212958}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
So, nobody seems to agree on how this should be dealt with. The current version (actually: the one that was there before page protection) is, arguably, not satisfactory: why those 20 composers? is this really the best picture we can have to represent classical music? why composers?

In the above section ([[Talk:Classical music#Gallery of composers]]), "No such user" argues that having an arbitrary gallery goes against the result of some RfC from February last year. While I personally disagree with that interpretation (which seems to have been aimed at something completely different in the first place), it remains true that a gallery of composers might not be the best option.

As I see it, the following options present themselves:

:'''Option A''' Reinstate the removed version ([[:File:Classical music composers montage.JPG]])

:'''Option B''' Change/remove some composers (make a new version)

:'''Option C''' Put something other than composers (''example'' <small> only for demonstration purposes </small> [[:File:Cesare Gennari Orfeo.jpg]])

:'''Option D''' Remove the image completely (and do not replace)

What is your opinion, and more importantly, why? [[Special:Contributions/135.23.202.24|135.23.202.24]] ([[User talk:135.23.202.24|talk]]) 01:23, 9 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Useful idiot#rfc_73275A0|Talk:Useful idiot]] expired 2018-01-09 01:01 ===
* Id: 73275A0
* User: Jack Upland
* Date: 2017-12-10 00:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|814638600|HIST 814638600}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|814638602|LANG 814638602}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|814638606|POL 814638606}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|819374751|HIST 819374751}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|819374753|LANG 819374753}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|819374754|POL 819374754}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is the [[Oxford English Dictionary]] a reliable source? Specifically, should we cite what it says about "useful idiot", that "The phrase does not seem to reflect any expression used within the Soviet Union"?--[[User:Jack Upland|Jack Upland]] ([[User talk:Jack Upland|talk]]) 00:58, 10 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Greek royal family#rfc_55FDAD2|Talk:Greek royal family]] expired 2018-01-11 16:01 ===
* Id: 55FDAD2
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|819261658|HIST 819261658}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|819261697|POL 819261697}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|819844068|HIST 819844068}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|819844074|POL 819844074}}
=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Royalty and Nobility#rfc_BA694B8|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Royalty and Nobility]] expired 2018-01-11 16:01 ===
* Id: BA694B8
* User: The Gnome
* Date: 2018-01-09 08:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|819432488|HIST 819432488}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|819432492|POL 819432492}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|819665554|BIO 819665554}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|819665641|SOC 819665641}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|819665642|STYLE 819665642}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|823110034|BIO 823110034}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|823110035|HIST 823110035}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|823110039|POL 823110039}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|823121342|SOC 823121342}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|823121344|STYLE 823121344}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Background''' The typical practice in Wikipedia so far is to have families that ''currently rule'' as monarchs over a nation denoted as "royal families" of the respective nation. Examples: [[British royal family]] for the [[United Kingdom]]; [[Swedish royal family]] for [[Sweden]]; [[Norwegian royal family]] for [[Norway]]; [[Spanish royal family]] for [[Spain]]; and so on. (Note that Wikipedia recognizes the House of Bourbon-Anjou as the Spanish royal family, since that is the royal family currently on the throne of Spain, despite the significant existence of [[Carlism|supporters]] of a separate line of the Bourbon dynasty.) 

On  the other hand, families which have ''historically ruled'' as monarchs over a nation in the past are denoted in Wikipedia as "houses of [family name]", or similar notations, avoiding the term "royal." Examples: [[House of Savoy]], for [[Italy]]; [[House of Romanov]] for [[Russia]]; the [[House of Habsburg]] for [[Austria]]; and so on. 

'''Proposal''' We should translate the current practice into a universally applied rule (in words to that effect) : 
:Only families whose members are actually, currently ruling as monarchs (in any regime, from [[constitutional monarchy]] to [[absolute monarchy]]) should be denoted as "royal families" in the title of their respective Wikipedia articles. Articles on all other families, irrespective of how long or recently these families have ruled as monarchs, should have in their title the appropriate surname of the family only, denoted as "house of" or similar.
-[[User:The Gnome|The Gnome]] ([[User talk:The Gnome|talk]]) 08:41, 9 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Categorizing redirects#rfc_4077D94|Wikipedia talk:Categorizing redirects]] expired 2018-01-13 16:01 ===
* Id: 4077D94
* User: Paine Ellsworth
* Date: 2017-12-14 15:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|815394926|TECH 815394926}}

* RFC Text:

=== [[Talk:More Life#rfc_448AFA5|Talk:More Life]] expired 2018-01-13 19:02 ===
* Id: 448AFA5
* User: TheAmazingPeanuts
* Date: 2017-12-14 17:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|815464264|MEDIA 815464264}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|820219618|MEDIA 820219618}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There have been several editors argue "playlist" should be added in the infobox, because Drake himself called it a playlist and was supported by reliable sources [http://www.npr.org/sections/allsongs/2016/10/24/499149582/drake-shares-three-new-songs-announces-more-life] [http://pitchfork.com/news/71152-drake-says-sade-chose-jay-z-over-him-gives-more-life-update-in-new-interview/], but playlist is not a valid album type for the infobox, you can see it right [[Template:Infobox album|here]]. I think it should be called mixtape in the infobox because some publications have referred to it as a mixtape, including Metacritic [http://www.metacritic.com/music/more-life-mixtape/drake] [https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2017/03/19/drakes-more-life-review-best-tracks/99364836/] [https://www.theverge.com/2017/3/18/14958456/drake-more-life-mixtape-playlist-release]. [[User:TheAmazingPeanuts|TheAmazingPeanuts]] ([[User talk:TheAmazingPeanuts|talk]]) 17:23, 14 December 2017 (UTC)}}

There was concern from many editors regarding the addition of allegations against the subject of the article. Mainly with unreliable or bad sources (such as blogs) that contained potentially libellous information. I changed [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Max_Landis&type=revision&diff=818717679&oldid=818692506  this] to [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Max_Landis&type=revision&diff=818717679&oldid=818692506 this], with opinionated wording & bad sources all taken out & a reliable source '''[[The Daily Beast]]''' added. So the question is ''what should be done with the subsection '''Sexual Misconduct Allegations'''?'' -- [[User:R9tgokunks|Wilner]] <small>([[User talk:R9tgokunks|Speak to me]])</small> 05:31, 5 January 2018 (UTC)}}

Should the  'Damage to public property' section in the article include the following materials:

{{tq|According to [[Mehr News Agency]], video captured by closed circuit cameras at a [[fire station]] in [[Dorud]], on 31 December 2017, showed rioters entering the station, attacking the staff and damaging fire trucks.<ref>{{cite news|title=Closed circuit camera videos of rioters attacking a fire station|url=https://www.mehrnews.com/news/4188572|accessdate=2 January 2018|work=Mehr News|date=1 January 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180102125033/https://www.mehrnews.com/news/4188572/%D8%AA%D8%B5%D8%A7%D9%88%DB%8C%D8%B1-%D8%AF%D9%88%D8%B1%D8%A8%DB%8C%D9%86-%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C-%D9%85%D8%AF%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A8%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%87-%D8%A7%D8%B2-%D8%AD%D9%85%D9%84%D9%87-%D8%A7%D8%BA%D8%AA%D8%B4%D8%A7%D8%B4%DA%AF%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%A8%D9%87-%D8%A2%D8%AA%D8%B4-%D9%86%D8%B4%D8%A7%D9%86%DB%8C-%D8%AF%D9%88%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%AF|archivedate=2 January 2017|language=fa}}</ref> In another incident, also in Dorud, rioters hijacked an on service fire truck which they abandoned; the truck then collided with a car killing a father and son on board, according to the state broadcaster.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dewan|first1=Angela|last2=McKirdy|first2=Euan|title=Supreme Leader blames Iran's 'enemies' for deadly protests|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2018/01/02/middleeast/iran-protests/index.html|accessdate=6 January 2018|work=CNN|date=2 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=The murderer of Dorudi cititzens were captured|url=https://www.mehrnews.com/news/4189815|accessdate=6 January 2018|work=Mehr News|language=fa}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Sanchez|first1=Raf|title=Iranian protester shoots dead police officer, government says|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/01/01/iranian-protester-shoots-dead-police-officer-government-says/|accessdate=7 January 2018|work=The Telegraph|agency=Reuters News Agency|date=2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Policeman killed amid crackdown on Iran protests|url=https://www.nst.com.my/world/2018/01/320522/policeman-killed-amid-crackdown-iran-protests|accessdate=7 January 2018|work=NST Online|date=2 January 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Charlton|first1=Corey|title=Trump declares its 'time for change' in Iran as 12 are killed over protests|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/5245111/12-killed-in-iran-protests-trump-change/|accessdate=7 January 2018|work=The Sun|date=1 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Ten dead in Iran unrest as Rouhani strikes defiant note|url=https://www.pri.org/stories/2018-01-01/ten-dead-iran-unrest-rouhani-strikes-defiant-note#|accessdate=7 January 2018|work=Public Radio International|agency=Agence France-Presse}}</ref>}}

=== [[Talk:Slobodan Praljak#rfc_0A20F14|Talk:Slobodan Praljak]] expired 2018-01-14 21:01 ===
* Id: 0A20F14
* User: Taribuk
* Date: 2017-12-15 20:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|815621830|BIO 815621830}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|820453632|BIO 820453632}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
----
#'''(fix)'''Section ''Reaction'': The sentence "Former US Ambassador for War Crimes Issues Stephen Rapp compared Praljak's suicide by poisoning to that of another war crimes convict, Hermann Göring, ..." shall be replaced by '''Praljak, a convicted war criminal staged publicly his suicide. Like Göring, he drank a cyanide capsule''' due to the fact that the same type of statement belong to many (>50) around the globe, not just to former US Ambassador, and shall be the first sentence in this section.
#'''(fix)'''I've tried to fix ''In 2008, [[Ministry of Culture (Croatia)|Croatian Ministry of Culture]] deemed that 18 of his works about Croatian War of Independence, Bosnian War, and relations between Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina were not books but brochures of schund literature,'' by changing ''were not books but brochures of schund literature'' to '''were not books but works categorised and taxed as pap, trash and pornography'''. The fix was directly supported by the reference<br><br>Krešimir Žabec (4 July 2012). "Ministarstvo generalu Praljku: Vaše knjige o ratu spadaju u šund i pornografiju, platit ćete 628.726 kuna poreza!" Translation: Your books  belong to šund (pap, trash) and pornography, you shall pay tax in the amount of 628.726 kuna<br><br>Further in the text: "Odnosno, ocijenjeno je da Praljkova djela spadaju u šund i pornografiju, na što se mora platiti PDV." Translation: ''Therefore, the Praljak works were appraised as šund (pap, trash) and pornography for which he had to pay VAT (value added tax)''<br><br>In addition the ''schund literature'' phrase is semanically wrong. The ''schund'' is a German word and it's opposite to the literature; therefore saying ''schund literature'' is equally meaningless as ''heiß (hot) ice''. The current phrase "wortless literature" equally makes no sense in English language.
#'''(remove)'''Out of context, not a main point: However, ICTY agreed that the bridge was a legitimate military target.[10] In addition to the responsibility and whether it was a legitimate military target, ICTY also examined whether the earlier siege by JNA and Bosnian Serb forces contributed to the bridge's collapse. - these claims are just the Court responses to the Praljak's defense<br><br>'''(remove)'''False statement: He was acquitted of some charges related to the destruction of Stari Most.[3][6] <br><br>The verdict details are [https://books.google.rs/books?id=f2KrCwAAQBAJ&pg=PA315&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q&f=false here]
#Section ''Regional reaction''. <br>'''(fix)'''False statement: "All the party caucuses of the Croatian Parliament except the SDP and GLAS issued a joint statement ..." It was about a Croatian Parliament session statement which SDSS, GLAS and SDP members did not attend. Only one IDS MP was present but no information whether he supported the statement<br>'''(add and update)'''Missing reactions:<br>a. After publicly displeased disagreement coming from the diplomatic corps in Zagreb and Brussels, both Kitarovic (the president) and Plenkovic (prime minister) relativized their statements ([https://www.rferl.org/a/croatia-bosnian-croat-war-criminal-praljak-honored/28910360.html the details are here], [http://www.nacional.hr/interview-ivan-jakovcic-plenkovic-je-pod-pritiskom-eu-a-povukao-izjave-o-nepravednoj-presudi-generalu-praljku-u-haagu/ and here]) <br>b. The action of praising Praljak as an innocent man and hero was orchestrated by the far right. <br>c. Journalists(Štefica Galić, for example) and some politicians (Mesic, former president, Pusic, former state secretary) received death threats for not honoring this war criminal as a hero. <br>d. Actually a small number of Croats attended public commemoration of the Praljak suicide ([http://www.telegram.hr/politika-kriminal/komemoracija-za-praljka-je-zapravo-pokazala-da-vecina-hrvata-naprosto-ne-zeli-imati-nista-s-herceg-bosnom/ the details are here]).<br>e. Also, there were Croatians who commemorated the victims of the group of war criminals Praljak belonged to.--[[User:Taribuk|Taribuk]] ([[User talk:Taribuk|talk]]) 20:09, 15 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:George Pell#rfc_7672883|Talk:George Pell]] expired 2018-01-15 15:01 ===
* Id: 7672883
* User: Taribuk

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I think that this section is completely unnecessary. Pell is not a world-renown intellectual nor thinker, he is just one of bureaucrats inside the Catholic clergy hierarchy. He became exposed to the public limelight for being the highest ranked official of the RCC accused for sexual abuse coverup and for sexually abusing the children. In the current version we have six pages dedicated to his views and only four dedicated for the abuse coverup and the sexual abuse itself.

I do not see any significance of his views. My proposal is completely eliminate the Views section or reduce it to no more than a half of the page.--[[User:Taribuk|Taribuk]] ([[User talk:Taribuk|talk]]) 14:51, 16 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:International System of Units#rfc_B84C3BE|Talk:International System of Units]] expired 2018-01-18 01:01 ===
* Id: B84C3BE
* User: Sbalfour
* Date: 2017-12-19 00:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|816076368|SCI 816076368}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|821031781|SCI 821031781}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
These articles, both GA and of significant merit, have substantially duplicate content, titles and focus.  While [[Metric system]] is not quite synonymous with [[International System of Units]], surely, with a paragraph or section to detail one from the other, the articles are the same.  A lot of hard working editors have a stake in each article, and their contributions should not be lost.  But I think it irrational that the information should not be one place, and be the best article quality that we can produce.  These could be a combined Featured Article. [[User:Sbalfour|Sbalfour]] ([[User talk:Sbalfour|talk]]) 00:34, 19 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Professional wrestling/Sources#rfc_47910B1|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Professional wrestling/Sources]] expired 2018-01-18 12:01 ===
* Id: 47910B1
* Date: 2018-01-18 03:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|821053576|UNSORTED 821053576}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|821104713|UNSORTED 821104713}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [http://www.diva-dirt.com/ Diva-Dirt.com] be considered a [[WP:RS|reliable source]] for professional wrestling articles. [[User:Nikki311|<b style="color: Teal;">Nikki</b>]]<b style="color: Salmon;">♥</b>[[User Talk:Nikki311|<b style="color: Purple;">311</b>]] 03:50, 18 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view/Noticeboard#rfc_B4D7C68|Wikipedia:Neutral point of view/Noticeboard]] expired 2018-01-19 00:01 ===
* Id: B4D7C68
* User: Immunmotbluescreen
* Date: 2018-01-18 22:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|821189762|ECON 821189762}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|821197030|ECON 821197030}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The question being discussed here is really a question of the economics of crime and correct scientific inference. We don't seem to reach a consensus whether the argument Sarnecki propose here is correct, or if the objections of Sanandaji are valid. Sarnecki argues that immigration has not caused an increase in crime because the crime hasn't risen and immigrant are no longer over represented if you adjust for socioeconomic factors. Sanandaji's objection is that Sarnecki have not proved that immigration hasn't affected the level of crime since he only use aggregated data and not look at the crime level of born citizens which could have decreased. He also objects to the adjustment for socioeconomic factors as they are not relevant for studying the impact. Maybe there are more experts on RfC?--[[User:Immunmotbluescreen|Immunmotbluescreen]] ([[User talk:Immunmotbluescreen|talk]]) 22:48, 18 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bitcoin scalability problem#rfc_157F293|Talk:Bitcoin scalability problem]] expired 2018-01-19 23:01 ===
* Id: 157F293
* User: Jtbobwaysf
* Date: 2018-01-04 12:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|818598695|ECON 818598695}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|818598700|SCI 818598700}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|818598767|STYLE 818598767}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|821351819|ECON 821351819}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|821351821|SCI 821351821}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|821351829|STYLE 821351829}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article is currently named Bitcoin scalability problem. I believe the use of the word problem is a [[WP:NPOV]] issue as there is widespread debate if bitcoin has a scaling problem, and what are solutions to it (such as already deployed scaling solutions [[Bitcoin Cash]], [[SegWit]], and [[Lightning Network]] which are discussed in the content of this very article). I propose the article be changed to "*Bitcoin <s>S</s>scaling", thus dropping the word problem. [[User:Jtbobwaysf|Jtbobwaysf]] ([[User talk:Jtbobwaysf|talk]]) 12:44, 4 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Administrators#rfc_7C7CB5A|Wikipedia talk:Administrators]] expired 2018-01-19 23:01 ===
* Id: 7C7CB5A
* User: Mz7
* Date: 2018-01-03 19:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|818829130|PROP 818829130}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|819776002|POLICY 819776002}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|823688381|POLICY 823688381}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|823688386|PROP 823688386}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A good number of people above have expressed support for the alternative solution of requiring an administrator to resign their tools before standing at RfA again, so I thought it would be best to formally propose that in this section here.
{{talkquote|All candidates at RfA should not currently hold administrator tools, and current administrators should resign before filing a new RFA. If a former administrator decides to file an RfA again, they would lose whatever right they had to have their tools automatically restored at the [[WP:BN|bureaucrats' noticeboard]] if the new RfA does not succeed (e.g. via withdrawal or lack of consensus at the new RfA).}}
Should the above text be added either to [[Wikipedia:Requests for adminship#About RfA and its process]] or perhaps to [[Wikipedia:Administrators#Becoming an administrator]]? Feel free to tweak the wording as necessary. [[User:Mz7|Mz7]] ([[User talk:Mz7|talk]]) 19:54, 3 January 2018 (UTC)}}

Based on [[#Conflict of interest proposal|the above proposal]] and leaving out point number 2.  Should we do the following?

Under "Becoming an administrator" after the 2nd paragraph as a separate paragraph include:

"'''Administrator candidates must disclose in their RfA whether they have ever edited for pay'''."

And under "Misuse of administrative tools" as the 3rd sentence in the 1st paragraph, include

"'''Administrators may never use administrative tools as part of any paid editing activity, except when they are acting as a Wikipedian-in-Residence, or the payment is made by the Wikimedia Foundation or an affiliate of the WMF'''."

=== [[Talk:Apple Maggot Quarantine Area#rfc_D706B81|Talk:Apple Maggot Quarantine Area]] expired 2018-01-20 06:01 ===
* Id: D706B81
* User: Chetsford
* Date: 2017-12-21 05:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|816419001|ECON 816419001}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|821395770|ECON 821395770}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The original version, written by me and reviewed by [[User:Dr.K.|Dr.K.]] at DYK [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Did_you_know_nominations/Apple_Maggot_Quarantine_Area], is thus: 
:1.''The Apple Maggot Quarantine Area is an area of the world which has been placed under a permanent quarantine by the United States state of Washington.'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Apple_Maggot_Quarantine_Area&oldid=813689048]
This was changed by [[User:SounderBruce|SounderBruce]] to this, with the edit summary "{{xt|rewriting lead sentence: "of the world" is a bit much}}": 
:2. ''The Apple Maggot Quarantine Area is a permanent quarantine area in the U.S. state of Washington.'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Apple_Maggot_Quarantine_Area&oldid=816247642]
That was, in turn, changed by me to this, with the edit summary "{{xt|doesn't make sense - the article itself states the quarantine includes Oregon, California, Idaho so incorrect to say it is "in the state of Washington"}}":
:3. ''The Apple Maggot Quarantine Area is a permanent quarantine area.'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Apple_Maggot_Quarantine_Area&oldid=816314279]
SounderBruce further revised it to the following with the edit summary "{{xt|at least include the country}}":
:4. ''The Apple Maggot Quarantine Area is a permanent quarantine area in the United States.'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Apple_Maggot_Quarantine_Area&oldid=816371282]
I undid that change, reverting it to version 3, with the edit summary "{{xt|edit makes lede inconsistent with article which states "All "foreign countries where apple maggot is established" have also ..."}}" - resulting in this:
:5. ''The Apple Maggot Quarantine Area is a permanent quarantine area.'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Apple_Maggot_Quarantine_Area&oldid=816398846]
SounderBruce further amended this with the edit summary "{{Xt|Should be clear that the quarantine only applies within Washington state}}":
:6. ''The Apple Maggot Quarantine Area is a permanent quarantine area in effect within the U.S. state of Washington.'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Apple_Maggot_Quarantine_Area&oldid=816399293]
Any further edits will run afoul of 3RR, however, (with deference and respect to SB's GF efforts to improve the article) I'm not satisfied with version #6 and would like to solicit feedback as to which version of the lede is more correct to the body of the article: 1, 2, 3/5, 4, 6, or none of those? Thanks. [[User:Chetsford|Chetsford]] ([[User talk:Chetsford|talk]]) 05:44, 21 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_EA8D99F|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2018-01-20 22:01 ===
* Id: EA8D99F
* User: Martinp
* Date: 2018-01-20 16:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|821463720|POLICY 821463720}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|821503811|POLICY 821503811}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
</nowiki> after sorting out the details.

# '''Speedy-delete'''. Create a CSD to allow speedy-deleting such articles, under some sort of stringent conditions, e.g. tagged for ["major"?] cleanup and no substantive edits for [3+?] years, no or woefully inadequate sources provided.
# '''Discuss-delete'''. Don't allow CSD, but change deletion policy to explicitly allow deleting such articles, with reasonably stringent guidelines as above to prevent abuse or false urgency/brinksmanship. Hope that at least some of the time, someone in the AFD discussion will instead jump in to improve the article.
# '''Blank'''. Don't delete such articles, but replace them with a template like "A Wikipedia article with this title was started, but was abandoned before a usable article was developed. If you feel this topic is notable, we encourage you to create an article using reliable sources. Previous partial content is available in this page's history if useful."  Remove from generic cleanup categories. This blanking action could either be allowed as a matter of editorial discretion ('''Editorial-Blank'''), again with some guidelines to avoid overuse, or only as a ''soft-delete'' outcome of an AFD discussion ('''AFD-Blank''').
# '''Flag'''. As Blank, but keep the existing article content, just preface it with an editnotice, something like "This Wikipedia article has been abandoned in a state which may be of limited usefulness. Wikipedia is a collaborative encyclopedia; if this topic is of interest, we strongly encourage you to dive in and improve it, using reliable sources."
# And of course, '''Status quo'''. There's no problem, leave such articles as-is in the hope someone will improve them, and continue to ''Keep'' them if someone nominates them AFD, etc, provided the subject is notable and sources appear to exist, etc.

The Speedy-delete option would of course the swiftest at removing embarrassing, useless stuff, but essentially gives up on the tiny ray of hope someone will improve things. It would require the most stringent, bright-line conditions on where it could be applied to be developed. Discuss-delete would harness multiple pairs of eyes to verify, and perhaps productively force a discussion of "OK, are we going to fix this or not?". The remaining two options keep the so-called content available, caveat it for readers, yet encourage someone to sometime jump in, and reclassify the cleanup backlog to segregate out articles where realistically normal cleanup isn't going to be sufficient or even happen.

Thoughts? {{Hidden ping|TenPoundHammer|Andy Dingley|Reyk|Annmccaff|Black Kite|Mendaliv|Xxanthippe|JzG|Iridescent|Carrite|DGG}}I will mention this at the ANI thread and am pinging ~10 top commenters there of this discussion (but let's keep user conduct out of it!). [[User:Martinp|Martinp]] ([[User talk:Martinp|talk]]) 16:55, 20 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Woody Allen sexual assault allegation#rfc_B0EEA1E|Talk:Woody Allen sexual assault allegation]] expired 2018-01-22 02:01 ===
* Id: B0EEA1E
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|821656800|BIO 821656800}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|821664759|BIO 821664759}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|821664763|POL 821664763}}

=== [[Talk:Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark#rfc_F76E362|Talk:Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark]] expired 2018-01-22 03:01 ===
* Id: F76E362
* User: Woovee
* Date: 2017-12-23 02:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|816706813|MEDIA 816706813}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|821700722|MEDIA 821700722}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the "impact on other artists" section, there were several reliable sources promoting OMD that all contained the same sentence, asserting that certain groups "the XX and the Killers, have cited OMD as an inspiration/influence" without quoting any musician/act. We know that sometimes if one journalist first said in a RS "band A have cited band B as an influence", other articles would reproduce the same assertion, believing the assertion of the previous journalist and without doing any fact checking themselves. There have been many assertions in the press advancing that "Pet Shop Boys have cited Soft Cell as an influence" whereas Pet Shop Boys strongly denied it in interviews saying they didn't listen to Soft Cell.

So do you agree to only mention bands when strong reliable sources mentioning quotes of musicians, are available ?  The "impact on other artists" section only includes at the moment names of the musicians that have actually hailed OMD in interviews or covered a song, that being supported by RS.---[[User:Woovee|Woovee]] ([[User talk:Woovee|talk]]) 02:16, 23 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Knights of Columbus#rfc_895232A|Talk:Knights of Columbus]] expired 2018-01-22 15:01 ===

Steeletrap wants to mention that they were a major participant in the election over gay marriage in California, and that they support other issues "generally associated with the religious right."  I believe that it is enough to say in the lead that they support Catholic positions on public policy issues, and then spell out the details in the body. --[[User:Briancua|BrianCUA]] ([[User talk:Briancua|talk]]) 01:14, 10 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability (organizations and companies)#rfc_9C07152|Wikipedia talk:Notability (organizations and companies)]] expired 2018-01-22 18:01 ===
* Id: 9C07152
* User: Jytdog
* Date: 2018-01-21 02:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|821538339|POLICY 821538339}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|821796743|POLICY 821796743}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following on the extensive discussion [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia_talk:Notability_(organizations_and_companies)&oldid=821534097#NCORP_standards,_continued above] which in turn continued the discussion started last July [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:Notability_(organizations_and_companies)/Archive_17 here], after many people have said "we need to raise NCORP standards" in many places, here is an RfC to do that. 

The goal here is to '''raise notability standards for companies.'''

There is a main proposal and an additional one. Please make sure you !vote about each one. 

;Main proposal (#1 if you like)
<blockquote>A for-profit company is considered "notable" in Wikipedia if it satisfies the GNG criteria and, in addition, any of the following criteria are met:
# It is a publicly traded company with at least a $1B market capitalization
# It is a private company that has raised more than $100M and has been in business for at least 5 years 
# It has been listed as a member of the [[Fortune 1000]], [[Forbes Global 2000]], or an equivalently regarded business ranking.
# It is considered by multiple independent reliable sources to have made a culturally significant impact. This is distinct from passing local controversies, local patronage (custom), getting good reviews, or the like.
# It is regarded by multiple independent reliable sources as having significant impact in its industry, including technical breakthroughs in marketed products. This is distinct from mundane [[product differentiation]]-type claims; every company is "unique". 
# It has been involved in fraud, antitrust, or another activity that receives enough ongoing coverage to meet [[WP:NCRIME]].</blockquote>

;Additional criterion (#2 if you like)
* It employs at least 1,500 people

-- [[User:Jytdog|Jytdog]] ([[User talk:Jytdog|talk]]) 02:25, 21 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:The Satanic Temple#rfc_EE3E5C1|Talk:The Satanic Temple]] expired 2018-01-22 22:01 ===
* Id: EE3E5C1
* Date: 2018-01-10 23:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|819731600|MEDIA 819731600}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|819731604|RELI 819731604}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|819923842|POL 819923842}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|821831913|MEDIA 821831913}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|821831987|POL 821831987}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|821831989|RELI 821831989}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should The Satanic Temple be labeled by the lead sentence?

A) "The Satanic Temple is a political activist group..."

B) "The Satanic Temple is a political activist and religious group..."

C) "The Satanic Temple is a political activist and self-described religious group..."

D) Other, please specify. (23:36, 10 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Ships#rfc_CA8BD68|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Ships]] expired 2018-01-24 01:01 ===
* Id: CA8BD68
* User: Coffee Atoms#top
* Date: 2018-01-23 07:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|821998080|SCI 821998080}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|822034095|SCI 822034095}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recent corrections to update vessel designations have been repeatedly reverted to incorrect and outdated names.  To ensure accuracy and reliability, articles should have the current and correct designation used throughout encyclopedia.  The [[United States Secretary of the Navy]] is the authority for designations and maintains the [[Naval Vessel Register]] which is the official inventory of ships of the United States Navy.  

For example, the [[USS Lewis B. Puller (ESB-3)]] is a type of vessel operated by [[Military Sealift Command]].  They were official re-designated by the [[United States Secretary of the Navy]] in 2015 to Expeditionary Sea Base (ESB), having previously been called Mobile Landing Platform and Afloat Forward Staging Base.  Corrections to articles to reflect the correct designation of the vessels have repeatedly reverted to outdated monikers.  Is there preference for using older information instead of correct designations per current and official U.S. Navy policy?  

* The Naval Register, the official record of U.S. Navy ships:  http://www.nvr.navy.mil/5030.8C.pdf cleary states in Enclosure 1, page 3 that they vessels are known as "Expeditionary Sea Base (ESB)."
* The Naval Register, the official record of U.S. Navy ships, referring to ESB-3 as an Expeditionary Sea Base:  http://www.nvr.navy.mil/SHIPDETAILS/SHIPSDETAIL_ESB_3_5415.HTML
* The Naval Register, the official record of U.S. Navy ships, referring to ESB-4 as an Expeditionary Sea Base:  http://www.nvr.navy.mil/SHIPDETAILS/SHIPSDETAIL_ESB_4_5422.HTML
* The Naval Register, the official record of U.S. Navy ships, referring to ESB-5 as an Expeditionary Sea Base:  http://www.nvr.navy.mil/SHIPDETAILS/SHIPSDETAIL_ESB_5_5741.HTML
* Naval Sea System Command announcement regarding the Expeditionary Sea Base as "Expeditionary Sea Bas":  http://www.navsea.navy.mil/Home/Team-Ships/PEO-Ships/Exp-Transfer-Dock-ESD-Exp-Sea-Base-ESB/
* Navy press release christening the an Expeditionary Sea Base:  http://www.navy.mil/submit/display.asp?story_id=102930
* Navy press release announcing the newest Expeditionary Sea Base:  http://www.navy.mil/submit/display.asp?story_id=103200 <small class="autosigned">—&nbsp;Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Coffee Atoms|Coffee Atoms]] ([[User talk:Coffee Atoms#top|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Coffee Atoms|contribs]]) 07:16, 23 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Edit filter#rfc_6E08F17|Wikipedia talk:Edit filter]] expired 2018-01-24 02:01 ===
* Id: 6E08F17
* User: 66.31.81.200
* Date: 2018-01-07 00:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|819034439|TECH 819034439}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|822042475|TECH 822042475}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Why has the <code>$1</code> variable been excluded from the message? This variable displays the public title of the filter that has been tripped when the action is disallowed. I think that the variable should be added so that inexperienced but good-faith users who may not know how to check their filter hits log will know why their edit was blocked. [[Special:Contributions/66.31.81.200|66.31.81.200]] ([[User talk:66.31.81.200|talk]]) 00:31, 7 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Battle of Mosul (2016–2017)#rfc_06620BE|Talk:Battle of Mosul (2016–2017)]] expired 2018-01-24 05:01 ===
* Id: 06620BE
* User: MonsterHunter32
* Date: 2017-12-25 02:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|816978716|HIST 816978716}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|822062866|HIST 822062866}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I have prepared a plan to shorten the article to great extent. I hope you can agree. I also welcome suggestions.:

* The well-written articles often don't cover all the minute details. My suggestion is to eliminate unimportant things that aren't notable beyond one or two sources or don't make a real impact on the battle.
**This includes elimination of all non-notable killings, or areas captured. For example, x number of terrorists killed or building captured on this day reported by only one or two minor sources and do not have any real impact.
* Separate articles for those offensives of the battle that deserve it like [[Western Nineveh offensive (2017)]]. Only events of these offensive having major impact on the battle should be included in the main article, for example supply lines was cut after x town was captured.
* I suggest creating a separate article for violations of laws of war incl. killings of civilians. The main article should only have a short summary on the subject.
** I also suggest that the very notable killings during the battle like the [[2017 Mosul airstrike]], the other killings should be relegated to the violation of laws of war.

[[User:MonsterHunter32|MonsterHunter32]] ([[User talk:MonsterHunter32|talk]]) 02:21, 25 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Deletion policy#rfc_978B7B5|Wikipedia talk:Deletion policy]] expired 2018-01-24 12:01 ===
* Id: 978B7B5
* User: Simiprof
* Date: 2018-01-16 21:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|820865177|POLICY 820865177}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|822103411|POLICY 822103411}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Changes are necessary in order to more easily clear disputes (including deletion disputes) on self-serving articles, because such edits cannot be entirely eliminated. I am signaling here a case of <b>self-promoting by Wikipedia itself</b>: Whoever made that [[Disruptive_innovation#Practical_example_of_disruption|Disruptive Innovation entry]], placed Wikipedia in the ''academia category'' (which is false) just to put it on top of the list -- and I could iterate 3 more case of self promoting articles I encountered in the last two months only.    
# With certain exceptions, new articles should be allowed a given number of months to mature, before they are proposed for deletion. Better yet, articles (new or old) should be reviewed for deletion periodically, based on their low traffic. 
# Voting in an article-deletion case should NOT be permitted to unregistered users.  
# Users known to have added content to articles of the same categories as the article proposed for deletion <b>should be invited automatically</b> to cast their vote. In this respect the following features should be implemented by Wikipedia developers:  
# The edits of registered users should be metered and used to build a database of users' expertise. An expertise level on a subject should associated with the user's name, with the possibility of displaying such an expertise rank on the respective user's page.
[[User:Simiprof|Simiprof]] ([[User talk:Simiprof|talk]]) 21:06, 16 January 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Southern Transitional Council#rfc_A91E9BB|Talk:Southern Transitional Council]] expired 2018-01-25 19:01 ===
* Id: A91E9BB
* User: NuclearWizard
* Date: 2017-12-26 17:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|817183968|HIST 817183968}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|817183976|POL 817183976}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|822326591|HIST 822326591}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|822326594|POL 822326594}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is currently a content dispute among three editors, including myself. 

These are current major elements of this dispute regarding the existence of the STC: 

:1. Does the Southern Transitional Council exist, as an independent organization from the Hadi-led government of Yemen? 
:2. Is the [[Southern Movement]] in fact affiliated to the Southern Transitional Council? 
:3. Are the Southern Transitional Council's territories on the [[Template:Yemeni Civil War detailed map|YCW war map]] ([[Module:Yemeni Civil War detailed map|module]]) effectively under the control of the Hadi-led government? 
:4. Is the STC at war with the Hadi-led government? 

Please keep in mind that the situation is evolving and keep in mind that the current RfC should generally be limited to these questions, and should not go to questions that cannot be resolved without depending on an answer to one of these four questions. [[User:NuclearWizard|Nuke]] ([[User talk:NuclearWizard|talk]]) 17:39, 26 December 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:The New York Times#rfc_D6E6F28|Talk:The New York Times]] expired 2018-01-28 03:01 ===
* Id: D6E6F28
* User: Richard Arthur Norton (1958- )
* Date: 2017-12-29 02:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|817598817|BIO 817598817}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|822720860|BIO 822720860}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should obituaries in the New York Times NOT be counted toward notability for people that live in the New York Metropolitan area because it is a local paper when tributing local people? Does Wikipedia actually ban local content when accessing notability? We are excluding the paid obituaries that are carried as advertisements in this argument. --[[User:Richard Arthur Norton (1958- )|RAN]] ([[User talk:Richard Arthur Norton (1958- )|talk]]) 02:47, 29 December 2017 (UTC)}}
