=== [[Talk:Bitcoin#rfc_A4E45C5|Talk:Bitcoin]] expired 2018-03-31 10:01 ===
* Id: A4E45C5
* User: Ladislav Mecir
* Date: 2018-03-01 09:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|828233282|ECON 828233282}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|828233285|SCI 828233285}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|833404959|ECON 833404959}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|833404963|SCI 833404963}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Edit [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bitcoin&diff=827910419&oldid=827910174] introduced a reliably sourced claim (see ''The New York Times'' article citation<ref name=nyt-split /> below) that up until July 2017, bitcoin users maintained a common set of rules for the cryptocurrency (i.e. that the Bitcoin Cash split was actually the first one). The wording of the last paragraph of the section was <blockquote>Up until July 2017, bitcoin users maintained a common set of rules for the cryptocurrency.<ref name=nyt-split>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/25/business/dealbook/bitcoin-cash-split.html|title=Some Bitcoin Backers Are Defecting to Create a Rival Currency|last=Popper|first=Nathaniel|date=25 July 2017|work=The New York Times|access-date=1 March 2018|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> On 1 August 2017, a change of rules was introduced. Since the new rules are not recognized as valid by the old software, the change is referred to as a ''[[Fork (blockchain)#Hard fork|hard fork]]''. The cryptocurrency following the updated rules is called [[Bitcoin Cash]]. Bitcoin Cash has a larger block size limit and had an identical blockchain at the time of fork.<ref>{{cite web |last1 = Radcliffe |first1 = Brent |title = Bitcoin Cash |url = https://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/bitcoin-cash.asp |website = Investopedia |accessdate = 8 December 2017 |date = 20 September 2017 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20171209100013/https://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/bitcoin-cash.asp |archivedate = 9 December 2017 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Tepper|first1=Fitz|title=WTF is bitcoin cash and is it worth anything?|url=https://techcrunch.com/2017/08/02/wtf-is-bitcoin-cash-and-is-it-worth-anything/|website=TechCrunch|accessdate=5 December 2017|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171210223807/https://techcrunch.com/2017/08/02/wtf-is-bitcoin-cash-and-is-it-worth-anything/|archivedate=10 December 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> On 12 November another hard fork, [[Bitcoin Gold]], was created. Bitcoin Gold changes the proof-of-work algorithm used in mining.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Reiff|first1=Nathan|title=Bitcoin Gold Is Now Live|url=https://www.investopedia.com/news/bitcoin-gold-now-live/|website=Investopedia|accessdate=29 December 2017|date=13 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171229231608/https://www.investopedia.com/news/bitcoin-gold-now-live/|archivedate=29 December 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Bitcoin Gold, the latest Bitcoin fork, explained|url=https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2017/11/bitcoin-gold-the-latest-bitcoin-fork-explained/|website=Ars Technica|accessdate=29 December 2017|language=en-us|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171229172206/https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2017/11/bitcoin-gold-the-latest-bitcoin-fork-explained/|archivedate=29 December 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref></blockquote>
{{reflist-talk}}

Should the information be reinstated? [[User:Ladislav Mecir|Ladislav Mecir]] ([[User talk:Ladislav Mecir|talk]]) 09:10, 1 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Star Wars: The Last Jedi#rfc_01B0BAA|Talk:Star Wars: The Last Jedi]] expired 2018-03-31 20:01 ===
* Id: 01B0BAA
* User: Toa Nidhiki05
* Date: 2018-03-01 19:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|828306029|MEDIA 828306029}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|833477073|MEDIA 833477073}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We've now [[Talk:Star Wars: The Last Jedi#RfC: Which version of the Audience response section should we go with?|reached consensus on the base version to use for the audience response section]]. It's now time to discuss potential changes. Modifications were suggested to the base text in the RfC; most of these revolved around versions of the text included in version 2. The two options in the RfC were:

'''Version 1/3:'''
<blockquote>Particularly divisive was the reveal that Rey's parents are insignificant;[7][13][15] '''many fans had expected her to be Luke's daughter or to share a lineage with another character from the original trilogy.'''[16][17] There was also sentiment that Snoke's character was underdeveloped '''and that Luke's actions contrasted his previous heroic portrayal'''.[15][18][19] Reviewers stated that fan theories were held so strongly among some viewers that it was difficult for them to accept different stories.[13][15][19] However, other viewers appreciated the film's action, tone and deviation from Star Wars tradition.[13][15]</blockquote>

'''Version 2:'''
<blockquote>Particularly divisive was the reveal that Rey's parents are insignificant;[7][13][15] '''many fans had expected her to share a lineage with another character from the original trilogy'''.[17] There was also sentiment that Snoke's character was underdeveloped '''and disagreement with Luke's portrayal and character arc in whether he was heroic enough'''.[15][18][15][19] Reviewers stated that fan theories were held so strongly among some viewers that it was difficult for them to accept different stories.[13][15][19] However, other viewers appreciated the film's action, tone and deviation from Star Wars tradition.[13][15]</blockquote>

Specifically, the question was whether or not the "Rey is Luke's daughter" fan theory should be mentioned and how to characterize Luke's portrayal. This issue was not decided upon in the RfC; the closer specifically said that .

The question in this RfC, then, is to decide this. '''Should the third paragraph in the audience reception section use the text from Versions 1/3, or the text from version 2'''? '''[[User:Toa Nidhiki05|<i style="color: green; font-family: Mistral;">Toa</i>]] [[User talk:Toa Nidhiki05|<i style="color: green; font-family: Mistral;">Nidhiki05</i>]]''' 19:25, 1 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Military history#rfc_0F9DAC8|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Military history]] expired 2018-04-03 17:01 ===
* Id: 0F9DAC8
* User: Nilfanion
* Date: 2018-03-04 16:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|828764687|STYLE 828764687}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|834042701|STYLE 834042701}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Per [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Military history#Use of decisive|discussion]] at [[WP:MILHIST]], around issues caused by the use of the terms described below which have led to several disputes and edit warring, I propose the following is added to this page (as a subsection of Usage and style):
<blockquote>
'''Results'''

When describing the outcome of a military event, care needs to be taken to avoid [[Wikipedia:original research|original research]]. Terms like "decisive victory", "marginal victory", "tactical victory" can have different meanings in different sources. For instance, a battle described as decisive may have directly led to the conclusion of the conflict, led to a change in direction of the broader conflict, had a clear tactical outcome on the battlefield with no lasting strategic implications, or a number of other possibilities.

These terms should only be used when they reflect a consensus in relevant [[Wikipedia:reliable sources|reliable sources]]. When these terms are used in articles they should have sufficient context from the surrounding text to make their meaning clear. They may also be used as part of a direct quotation from a specific person. They should not be used in an infobox, as there is no ability to give a broader explanation in that location.
</blockquote>

I believe this draft supports editors in dealing with broader issues around these terms (that different sources can and will use them in different ways), and directly addresses the most problematic uses (in infoboxes).--[[User:Nilfanion|Nilf]][[commons:User:Nilfanion|anion]] ([[User talk:Nilfanion|talk]]) 16:10, 4 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ariana Grande discography#rfc_027E103|Talk:Ariana Grande discography]] expired 2018-04-04 15:01 ===
* Id: 027E103
* User: Fan4Life
* Date: 2018-03-10 17:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|830065834|MEDIA 830065834}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|834217640|MEDIA 834217640}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Previous consensus is that "Jason's Song (Gave It Away)" is a single, based on a Billboard article referring to it as "the lastest single" and it having "- Single" on iTunes. The argument against this and for it being a promotional single is that a later Billboard article, other media sources and Ariana Grande herself all refer to "Everyday" as the fourth single, along with "Jason's Song (Gave It Away)" not meeting the criteria for a single set out in Wikipedia guidelines. Should "Jason's Song (Gave It Away)" be listed as a promotional single? [[User:Fan4Life|Fan4Life]] ([[User talk:Fan4Life|talk]]) 17:14, 10 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_1EEC607|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2018-04-06 10:01 ===
* Id: 1EEC607
* User: Lojbanist
* Date: 2018-04-06 01:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|834504064|UNSORTED 834504064}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|834551442|UNSORTED 834551442}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting}}
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Proposals}}
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Criteria}}
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Naming conventions}}
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Discoveries}} - used to point out BOLD editors who choose to apply IAR to the WSS process
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Stub types}} - '''move''' to [[Wikipedia:Template messages/Stubs]]
:{{pagelinks|Template:Stubsort}} - used to bug people who use the generic [[Template:Stub]]
:{{pagelinks|Template:Stub sort}} - same as stubsort
:{{pagelinks|Template:WPSS-cat}}
:{{pagelinks|Template:WPSS-new}}
:redundant over-specific templates - {{tl|underpopulated stub category}}, {{tl|very large stub category}}, {{tl|deprecated stub}}

Do we '''really''' need all this bureaucracy for stub templates? I don't think so. You want to create a new stub template? You have to go through WSS first. What's that, you've decided to just be bold and create the template? Too bad; it's going to TFD, where the 5 active TFDers will ignore it, causing it to be automaticallly deleted. I propose that WSS be shut down and the stub template process be made much less process-y, per the Esperanza precedent. (This was originally on MFD, but I was told to go here, despite MFD being where the dissolution of Esperanza was discussed.) '''[[User:Lojbanist|Lojbanist]]''' <sup>[[User talk:Lojbanist|remove cattle from stage]]</sup> 01:15, 6 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Mujahedin of Iran#rfc_7688326|Talk:People's Mujahedin of Iran]] expired 2018-04-06 14:01 ===
* Id: 7688326
* User: London Hall
* Date: 2018-03-24 11:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|832193256|POL 832193256}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|832425047|POL 832425047}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article comes across as having some obvious [[WP:NPOV]] and [[Weasel word]] issues. I've tried to clean up a couple of sections, but this seems to upset [[user:Pahlevun]], who appears to have monopolized the article. I've tried to take the debate to the article's Talk page, but consensus hasn't been reached with user Pahlevun (though [[user:Icewhiz]] did support proposed changes). I think that at this point we need another neutral editor to have a look at this. What I've found, basically, is that:

1) Biased references are being used to support biased statements (these biased references often seem to be connected to the Iranian regime. As Icewhiz pointed out: Note the Iranian regime (and regime controlled media in Iran) views MEK in a highly negative fashion (MEK being on of the regular "bogeymen" in coverage, regularly assigned blame for various woes). This sometimes seeps into non-Iranian coverage (in proper sources - attributed back to the Iranian regime) - however we should be careful to attribute such negative statements here

2) Other references are being used to support negative statements that are not in the references themselves (see discussion above).

I've tried to discuss this with [[user:Pahlevun]] (see above), but he/she has opted to open an [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Sockpuppet_investigations/Atlantic12 SPI case] against me instead. [[User:London Hall|London Hall]] ([[User talk:London Hall|talk]]) 11:25, 24 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Lists of earthquakes#rfc_044A855|Talk:Lists of earthquakes]] expired 2018-04-06 22:01 ===
* Id: 044A855

{{rfcquote|text=
Are ''lists'' of earthquake [[aftershock]]s ever notable? While, on rare occasions, ''individual'' aftershocks (or foreshocks) might be notable, for various reasons raised in the preceeding discussion it appears that ''lists'' of aftershocks (and foreshocks), whether stand-alone or within an article, are not notable. Further comment is requested. ~ [[User:J. Johnson|J.&nbsp;Johnson (JJ)]] ([[User_talk:J. Johnson#top|talk]]) 21:35, 7 March 2018 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|831157493|SOC 831157493}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|836990231|HIST 836990231}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|836990233|POL 836990233}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|836990234|SOC 836990234}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The following material noting the NRA operates gun safety and training courses was removed from the NRA article's section entitled, "Safety and sporting programs".
:''The NRA sponsors a range of programs about firearm safety for children and adults, including a program for school-age children, the NRA's "[[Eddie Eagle]]". The organization issues credentials and trains firearm instructors.<ref name=NRAtraining>{{cite web |url=http://www.nrahq.org/EDUCATION/Training/trainingcounselors/workshops.asp |title=Education & Training |year=2012|publisher=National Rifle Association HQ|accessdate=January 25, 2013}}</ref>''
As quoted above the material self cites the NRA.  

*Should the material be included in the article (No=Oppose/Yes=Support/Yes with modification)?
Material removal here [[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=National_Rifle_Association&diff=830964510&oldid=830959566]] (also includes removal of material not related to this RfC).  

[[User:Springee|Springee]] ([[User talk:Springee|talk]]) 01:48, 19 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Matthew Island and Hunter Island#rfc_964BF1A|Talk:Matthew Island and Hunter Island]] expired 2018-04-08 00:02 ===
* Id: 964BF1A
* User: Escargoten
* Date: 2018-03-08 23:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|829495187|HIST 829495187}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|829502276|POL 829502276}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|835321594|HIST 835321594}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|835321597|POL 835321597}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The Hunter Island is claimed by the [[Federal Republic of Lostisland]], a [[micronation]], which in 2012 undertook an expedition to the island. Over the last 6 years a discussion on whether this merits an inclusion to the article has been sporadically going on but no real consensus was ever reached. The independent sources mentioning the claim and/or the micronation are as following:
*{{Cite news|url=http://cimsec.org/south-pacific/9356|title=Flashpoint: South Pacific - Vanuatu and New Caledonia|date=2014-01-16|work=Center for International Maritime Security|access-date=2017-12-13|language=en-US}}
*{{Cite news|url=http://hawaiipublicradio.org/post/pacific-news-minute-france-vanuatu-discuss-disputed-matthew-and-hunter-islands|title=Pacific News Minute: France, Vanuatu To Discuss Disputed Matthew and Hunter Islands|last=Conan|first=Neal|access-date=2017-12-13|language=en}}
*{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/989753471|title=Histoires insolites des îles désertes françaises.|date=2017|publisher=Editions Jourdan|isbn=9782874664526|location=Bruxelles|oclc=989753471}}
*{{Cite news|url=http://asiarussia.ru/news/19071/|title=Лостайленд выпустил почтовые марки, посвященные Чингисхану|last=Maidar|first=Sosorbaram|date=|work=Asia Russia Daily|access-date=2018-03-08|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=ru}}
*{{Cite news|url=http://dailypost.vu/news/internet-eccentrics-on-expedition-to-hunter-island/article_858168a8-a03b-5364-ada9-9e44a2d35cde.html|title=Internet Eccentrics On Expedition To Hunter Island|last=Cortbus|first=Colin|work=Vanuatu Daily Post|access-date=2017-12-13|language=en}}
*{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/929658248|title=You rule! : create your own country|last=Scott,|first=Forbes,|others=Jones, Emma (Emma Laura),|isbn=174360968X|location=Footscray, Victoria|oclc=929658248}}
Are those sources sufficient to include the micronation reference to the article? [[User:Escargoten|Escargoten]] ([[User talk:Escargoten|talk]]) 23:14, 8 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:David Ogden Stiers#rfc_3FE3656|Talk:David Ogden Stiers]] expired 2018-04-08 22:01 ===
* Id: 3FE3656
* User: ResultingConstant
* Date: 2018-03-09 21:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|829644087|BIO 829644087}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|829644090|MEDIA 829644090}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|829644098|SOC 829644098}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|829644101|POLICY 829644101}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|835469094|BIO 835469094}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|835469097|MEDIA 835469097}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|835469165|SOC 835469165}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|835469167|POLICY 835469167}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A brief history of this story : 
* In 1997 "Philedelphia Citypaper" published an interview which said that stiers  was asked if he was gay, and replied  that he was not. {{tq|Are you gay? No, I'm not. But, I believe that we're all the same person differently expressed}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20151014062015/http://citypaper.net/articles/021397/article001.shtml]
* In 2009, the  blog "gossip boy" published an interview which purports to be with Stiers, in which Stiers came out. {{tq|GB: You are gay. Right, David? DOS: Yes, I am. Very proud to be so.}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20090604020126/http://www.gossip-boy.com/DOS.html]
* The gossip boy story was subsequently picked up by '''many''' other sources, which cited the blog . ABC story here :  [http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/Movies/story?id=7518323&page=1]
* A prior informal RFC was closed without consensus to include [[Talk:David_Ogden_Stiers/Archives/2014]]
* After Stiers death, the story made the rounds again (many sources again), including the NYT obit  (explicitly citing the ABC story above, which cites gossip boy) [https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/04/obituaries/david-ogden-stiers-mash-dies.html] Or see the TimesUK story which uses direct quotes from the blog, but does not cite any sources and uses their own voice. [https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/david-ogden-stiers-p6kx0dn9k]

{{collapsetop|unreliable info which may or may not shed light on the reliability of the blog}}
* In 2009 wikipedia Accounts ''claiming'' to be PR reps of stiers made comments indicating the interview was fake [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=David_Ogden_Stiers&diff=prev&oldid=287891697][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=David_Ogden_Stiers&diff=prev&oldid=288088181] (Account was subsequently banned due to not complying with username policy as "group" name)
* During prior discussions of this content, wiki editor {{u|Red Act}} claim to have called Stier's PR firm where they told him the story was false [[Talk:David_Ogden_Stiers/Archives/2013#Gay?]]
* On internet forums, those who claim to be in the know argue that Stiers is in fact gay, but that the interview was false [https://www.datalounge.com/thread/8924141-david-ogden-stiers-n]
{{collapsebottom}}


# '''Does the gossip boy interview (bolstered by otherwise reliable sources which have copied the story) comply with policy ([[WP:BLP]]  (in particular [[WP:GRAPEVINE]]) [[WP:RS]]) sufficient to ''allow'' inclusion of this story in this [[WP:BDP]]'''
# '''If the information meets policy, How should this information be presented''' :
## A. Not included
## B. Describe conflicting interviews, and possible sourcing issues
## C. Describe conflicting interviews, do not mention gossip boy reliability
## D. Include only coming out, attributed to sources/gossip boy
## E. Include only coming out, in wiki voice. 
## F. Include in some other way

Note : I have neutrally notified several noticeboards and wikiprojects regarding this RFC [[User:ResultingConstant|ResultingConstant]] ([[User talk:ResultingConstant|talk]]) 21:48, 9 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jorge I. Domínguez#rfc_6E2FFD7|Talk:Jorge I. Domínguez]] expired 2018-04-10 04:01 ===
* Id: 6E2FFD7
* User: HouseOfChange
* Date: 2018-03-11 04:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|829846776|BIO 829846776}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|835682041|BIO 835682041}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The subject of this article has been accused of sexual harassment, first in 1983 (after which Harvard disciplined but retained and later promoted him) and very recently, with stories emerging going back for decades alleging inappropriate behavior. Of course some of this material should be in the bio, but I have a disagreement with another editor (or possibly five, although the IP addresses are very similar) about WP:WEIGHT. On the talk page, they are sharply critical of my edits to the article.

The IPs ([[Special:Contributions/2604:2000:E016:A700:8853:2F07:A72D:96A2]], [[Special:Contributions/2604:2000:E016:A700:F81C:D427:6CB1:E49F]], [[Special:Contributions/2604:2000:E016:A700:14D7:F45B:2E06:DDDC]], [[Special:Contributions/2604:2000:E016:A700:E1FD:CB3E:641B:795B]], [[Special:Contributions/2604:2000:E016:A700:FDB2:3234:2AAA:AB32]]) have been editing this article aggressively to add all possible references for the sex scandal, including transforming one Harvard Crimson article into 3, and citing both one Newsweek article and its absolute duplicate in Yahoo. 

I think that the number of overlapping references, the paragraph they added to the header, and the accusatory tone of the Sexual harassment section, are inappropriate to WP:WEIGHT and BLP. It will be better to have one sentence at most in the header, with maybe three paragraphs in the body, including links to articles where interested people can read the detailed salacious claims against the subject. 

I am not trying to whitewash the subject. What he is accused of is reprehensible and claims against him are news. But unless I am wrong, the amount of space and detail spent describing these claims should have some balance with the amount of space the article spends describing his notability. What do others think? Thanks! [[User:HouseOfChange|HouseOfChange]] ([[User talk:HouseOfChange|talk]]) 04:00, 11 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mikhail Bulgakov#rfc_A3C1B29|Talk:Mikhail Bulgakov]] expired 2018-04-10 20:01 ===
* Id: A3C1B29
* User: Piznajko
* Date: 2018-03-11 19:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|829948197|BIO 829948197}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
&#x20;
#Should the information about Bulgakov's views on Ukraine be included in the leading seciton? I stand by the claim that it is perfectly within [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Lead section]] given the importance of this topic. In particular, I stand by my claim that including an overview of Bulgakov's controversial view of Ukraine is perfectly within [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Lead section]]'s guidance, namely a statement encouraging "including any prominent controversies" in the leading section..
#Should the section [[Mikhail Bulgakov#Views on Ukraine]] be written in a more generic way (e.g., my version that talks about his personal views on Ukraine in a summary format) or trying to picture Bulgakov's anti-Ukrainian sentiment as views expressed only by one scholar, Myroslav Shkandrij (e.g., version from AveTory, where he has paraphrased the section entitled 'Views on Ukraine' to make it sound as if Bulgakov's denial of Ukraine's rights to independence is a one-off statement by a rogue academic, Myroslav Shkandrij, as opposed to a claim supported by various academics and [[Wikipedia:reliable sources]]).--[[User:Piznajko|Piznajko]] ([[User talk:Piznajko|talk]]) 19:28, 11 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:New York Life Insurance Company#rfc_ED95B13|Talk:New York Life Insurance Company]] expired 2018-04-10 21:01 ===
* Id: ED95B13
* User: 16912_Rhiannon
* Date: 2018-03-21 15:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|832807012|ECON 832807012}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|835799716|ECON 835799716}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article contain a subsection on a 2009 market conduct examination undertaken by a New Jersey state government office, sourced entirely to the investigation report? The current section is as follows:

:In 2009, examiners from the New Jersey Department of Banking and Insurance, in full cooperation with NYLIC, worked to identify areas where improvements could be made in policyholder services. In other areas such as complaints, replacement file review, [[underwriting]], claims review, and advertising and forms, the Department examiners found no errors in the NYLIC reviewed files.<ref name=njlife>{{cite web|last1=Considine|first1=Thomas B.|title=Market Conduct Examination of New York Life Insurance Company and New York Life Insurance and Annuities and New York Life Insurance Company of Arizona located in New York, NY|url=http://www.nj.gov/dobi/division_consumers/insurance/mcexams/adoptrptnylife.pdf|website=New Jersey State Government Portal (NJ.gov)|publisher=State of New Jersey, Department of Banking and Insurance, Office of Consumer Protection Services, Market Conduct Examination Unit & Anti-Fraud Compliance|date=14 September 2010}}</ref>{{rp|3,6,9-12}} The complete findings were as follows:

:* Claims, Marketing and Sales: 0% error ratio<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|3}}
:* Policyholder services: 13% error ratio<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|3}}
:** According to the report, "The examiners found four complaints where New York Life failed to provide a written response to the complainant within a reasonable period of 10 working days."<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|3}}
:* Replacement file review: No problems<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|6,9}}
:* Underwriting: 0% error ratio<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|10}}
:* Claims review: 0% error ratio<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|11}}
:* Advertising and forms: 0% error ratio<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|12}}

:In addition to those areas, a review was also conducted regarding the disciplinary actions performed on agents of the company. The review found that of 11 agents disciplined, none were for "activities related to the replacement of annuities or life insurance policies".<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|13}} With regards to improving policyholder services, the examiners noted they were "satisfied that the Companies (NYLIC) have taken or will take corrective measures pursuant to the recommendations of the Report."<ref name=njlife/>{{rp|i}}
{{reflist-talk}}
Is this appropriate? [[User:16912_Rhiannon|16912 Rhiannon]] ([[User talk:16912_Rhiannon|Talk]] &middot; [[User:16912_Rhiannon|COI]])  15:10, 21 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bitcoin Cash#rfc_A8292AE|Talk:Bitcoin Cash]] expired 2018-04-10 23:01 ===
* Id: A8292AE
* User: Jtbobwaysf
* Date: 2018-04-10 04:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|834369959|ECON 834369959}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|834369960|SCI 834369960}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|835687440|SCI 835687440}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|835732941|UNSORTED 835732941}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|835799716|ECON 835799716}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|835821237|UNSORTED 835821237}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The lede should contain the often used altname Bcash and read: 

'''Bitcoin Cash''' (also known as '''Bcash''') is a [[cryptocurrency]].<ref name="fortunebcash">{{Cite news|url=http://fortune.com/2017/08/08/bitcoin-price-bitcoin-cash-bcash/|title=Bitcoin Just Surged to Yet Another All-Time High|last=Shen|first=Lucinda|publisher=Fortune Magazine|date=08 August 2017}}</ref><ref name="forbes">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/pamelaambler/2017/08/09/the-rapid-rise-and-fall-of-bitcoin-cash/|title=The Rapid Rise And Fall Of Bitcoin Cash|last=Ambler|first=Pamela|publisher=Forbes|date=09 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Oli|title=Bitcoin price RIVAL: Cryptocurrency 'faster than bitcoin' will CHALLENGE market leaders|url=https://www.express.co.uk/finance/city/907536/cryptocurrency-bitcoin-market-leader-cash-ripple-ethereum|accessdate=1 March 2018|work=Express|date=21 January 2018}}</ref> 

[[MOS:LEADALT]] applies the following test: "significant alternative names for the topic should be mentioned in the article, usually in the first sentence or paragraph." [[WP:SOAP]] applies the following test: "An article can report objectively about such things, as long as an attempt is made to describe the topic from a neutral point of view." The following mainstream [[WP:RS]] have used the term bcash:

 “the new Bitcoin spinoff, Bitcoin Cash or “Bcash,”<ref name="fortunebcash">{{Cite news|url=http://fortune.com/2017/08/08/bitcoin-price-bitcoin-cash-bcash/|title=Bitcoin Just Surged to Yet Another All-Time High|last=Shen|first=Lucinda|publisher=Fortune Magazine|date=08 August 2017}}</ref> [[Fortune (magazine)]]

 "Bitcoin Cash, now also known as "Bcash"<ref name="forbes">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/pamelaambler/2017/08/09/the-rapid-rise-and-fall-of-bitcoin-cash/|title=The Rapid Rise And Fall Of Bitcoin Cash|last=Ambler|first=Pamela|publisher=Forbes|date=09 August 2017}}</ref> [[Forbes]]

 “Aurélien Menant, founder and CEO of [[Gatecoin]], a regulated bitcoin and ethereum token exchange based in Hong Kong, says parts of the community are referring to the new token as Bcash.”<ref name="cnbc">{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/07/31/blockchain-fork-will-create-new-digital-crypto-currency-bitcoin-cash.html|title=A new digital currency is about to be created as the bitcoin blockchain is forced to split in two|last=Graham|first=Luke|publisher=CNBC|date=31 July 2017}}</ref>  [[CNBC]] 

The following industry [[WP:RS]] have used the term bcash
 "Throughout the past month, several major Bitcoin exchanges such as Bitstamp and Bitfinex have either listed or referred to Bitcoin Cash as Bcash in several instances."<ref name="CoinTelegraph">{{Cite news|url=https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitstamp-criticized-for-listing-bitcoin-cash-as-bcash-despite-community-outrage|title=Bitstamp Criticized For Listing Bitcoin Cash as Bcash, Despite Community Outrage|last=Young|first=Joseph|publisher=CoinTelegraph|date=6 December 2017}}</ref> CoinTelegraph

 "For the past couple of days, Bitcoin Cash (Bcash or BCH) was more profitable to mine than Bitcoin (BTC)."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://bitcoinmagazine.com/articles/why-bcash-mining-shouldnt-affect-bitcoin-much-bitcoin-mining-could-ruin-bcash/|title=Why Bcash Mining Shouldn’t Affect Bitcoin Much (But Bitcoin Mining Could Ruin Bcash)|last=van Wirdum|first=Aaron|publisher=BitcoinMagazine|date=22 August 2017}}</ref> [[Bitcoin Magazine]]

The above sources demonstrate a pattern of usage of the term Bcash in both mainstream and industry publications. 

'''Survey'''

'''Threaded Discussion'''

{{reflist-talk}}

'''Revised RfC on altname Bcash'''

This proposal is to add altname ([[MOS:LEADALT]]) "Bcash" to the [[Bitcoin Cash]] article with ammended text to read:  

'''Bitcoin Cash''' (also known as '''Bcash''').<ref name="fortunebcash">{{Cite news|url=http://fortune.com/2017/08/08/bitcoin-price-bitcoin-cash-bcash/|title=Bitcoin Just Surged to Yet Another All-Time High|last=Shen|first=Lucinda|publisher=Fortune Magazine|date=08 August 2017}}</ref><ref name="forbes">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/pamelaambler/2017/08/09/the-rapid-rise-and-fall-of-bitcoin-cash/|title=The Rapid Rise And Fall Of Bitcoin Cash|last=Ambler|first=Pamela|publisher=Forbes|date=09 August 2017}}</ref><ref name="cnbc">{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/07/31/blockchain-fork-will-create-new-digital-crypto-currency-bitcoin-cash.html|title=A new digital currency is about to be created as the bitcoin blockchain is forced to split in two|last=Graham|first=Luke|publisher=CNBC|date=31 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="CoinTelegraph">{{Cite news|url=https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitstamp-criticized-for-listing-bitcoin-cash-as-bcash-despite-community-outrage|title=Bitstamp Criticized For Listing Bitcoin Cash as Bcash, Despite Community Outrage|last=Young|first=Joseph|publisher=CoinTelegraph|date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://bitcoinmagazine.com/articles/why-bcash-mining-shouldnt-affect-bitcoin-much-bitcoin-mining-could-ruin-bcash/|title=Why Bcash Mining Shouldn’t Affect Bitcoin Much (But Bitcoin Mining Could Ruin Bcash)|last=van Wirdum|first=Aaron|publisher=BitcoinMagazine|date=22 August 2017}}</ref>

Thank you! [[User:Jtbobwaysf|Jtbobwaysf]] ([[User talk:Jtbobwaysf|talk]]) 04:22, 10 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox officeholder#rfc_5C96B2A|Template talk:Infobox officeholder]] expired 2018-04-14 07:01 ===
* Id: 5C96B2A
* User: Inowen
* Date: 2018-03-15 06:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|830678618|POLICY 830678618}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|836349549|POLICY 836349549}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Preamble: The majoritarian idea of governance often has the provision that certain majoritarian actions might be infringing on minority groups, which is to say the actions are persecutory, and therefore statutes have to be put in place to either limit majoritarian rampages, or else protect minority interests specifically. 

The RFC to remove the religion= tag from the main infobox might have come about without fair treatment of the minority opinion, and so I propose two things, that the religion= tag be restored and a guideline for its usage be written. In addition, I make the suggestion that Arbcom review the RFC in order to form guidelines to protect minority interests from majoritarian sweeps, such that as in this case, other solutions were not sought or taken. 

On the matter of the RFC and its claimed validity, the validity naturally rests entirely on the idea of it being majoritarian, and a "snow close" issue. But then atheist majoritarianism would have the problem that it would wipe away religion as a topical element from articles project wide, and that has to be prevented, by statute and guideline. 

The internet seems to have a strong showing of atheists and science-culturists, but if science culture is taking the form of an irrational cult religion, and atheism is not really a personal view but an increasingly more organized anti-religion movement, then these things need to be countered with some common sense that rejects POV movements and does honorable treatment of the human condition and the role religion has played in it. -[[User:Inowen|Inowen]] ([[User talk:Inowen|talk]]) 06:15, 15 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of Presidents of the United States#rfc_B1DF507|Talk:List of Presidents of the United States]] expired 2018-04-15 17:01 ===
* Id: B1DF507
* Date: 2018-03-16 16:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|830737294|BIO 830737294}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|830737301|HIST 830737301}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|830737304|POL 830737304}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|836577679|BIO 836577679}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|836577680|HIST 836577680}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|836577687|POL 836577687}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 There has been an ongoing dispute over which images should be used in this list, involving experienced editors and newer editors, registered and IP users, those acting with good intentions and with those with more dubious reasons. The page was temporarily protected a few times, but has now been protected for a full year. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_Presidents_of_the_United_States&oldid=830687047 This] is the current version of the article as of the posting of this RfC. There are 44 men representing 45 presidencies, Grover Cleveland is listed twice, using the same image. The purpose of this RfC is to establish consensus, for the images that should be included as if it's closing, and to establish that changes to images must be proposed on the talk page first and only implemented with consensus, or are otherwise immediately reverted. 
*Question 1: Do you support the current 44 images [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_Presidents_of_the_United_States&oldid=830687047 currently] listed?
**If you oppose, please indicate which image(s) you want to see changed, including a link to the replacement image(s) you are proposing and your reasoning. We'll have a straw poll for each image. 
*Question 2: Do you support that any changes to images must first be proposed on the talk page and only implemented with consensus?  
At the conclusion of this RfC, we should have a set list of 44 (or 45) images and going forward, (hopefully) have a mechanism in place to prevent any further disruption to the page. [[User:Thewolfchild|wolf]] 16:50, 16 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Consultation on the future of portals#rfc_6745CF8|Wikipedia:Consultation on the future of portals]] expired 2018-04-16 06:01 ===
* Id: 6745CF8
* Date: 2018-04-08 14:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|836672859|POLICY 836672859}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|836672861|PROJ 836672861}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|836672863|PROP 836672863}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|836677747|POLICY 836677747}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|836677748|PROJ 836677748}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|836677750|PROP 836677750}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{shortcut|WP:FPORTALS}}
On 8 April 2018, a '''[[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)|village pump proposal]]''' was submitted that proposed '''deleting Wikipedia's various [[Wikipedia:Portals|portals]]'''. The discussion quickly became very complex, involving a number of counter-proposals, and many points were repeated several times in the discussion thread. The discussion was therefore [[WP:BOLD|boldly]] closed and sequestered out to this page by [[User:Newbiepedian|Newbiepedian]] at the original suggestion of [[User:John Cline|John Cline]] in order to restructure it and provide an accessible overview to the discussion that has already taken place. This will help encourage discussion of the individual proposals.

The original discussion has been archived '''[[/RFC|here]]'''.

{{toclimit|3}}

= Background =
:''This section is not gospel, please feel free to amend if you feel anything is inaccurate or insufficiently comprehensive.''

The original proposal suggested deleting all portals.

The main arguments in '''support''' of the proposal were:
# Very few Wikipedians use portals, and therefore very few Wikipedians maintain them.
# As very few Wikipedians maintain portals, they often contain out-of-date and/or irrelevant information.
# Many portals on certain subjects are less useful as an introduction to their subject than the main article(s).
# The time Wikipedians ''do'' spend on maintaining portals would (thus) be better spent on maintaining articles.

The main arguments in '''opposition''' to the proposal were:
# Although few Wikipedians use portals, many visitors do. (See table below to that effect.)
# Blanket deletion of an entire namespace, containing a total of 185,578 pages, may have many unintended consequences &ndash; as mass deletions have done in the past.
# There are clearly some portals that ''are'' well-maintained, such as [[Portal:Current events]], and there is little reason to delete them.
# Some value would (thus) be lost by deleting all portals. An overhaul, by contrast, could potentially create value.

''' Data '''

Some users collated useful data; this is reproduced here. Please feel free to add any further relevant data to this section.

''' Number of pages in affected namespaces '''

Count of portal pages from [[Wikipedia:Database reports/Page count by namespace]] originally supplied by [[User:Renata3|Renata3]], supplemented with a total.

| 135,680
|-

| 36,710
| 2,701
| 34,009
|- 
!colspan=2| '''TOTAL'''
| 185,578
| 15,889
| 169,689
|}

= Original proposals =
These proposals appeared in the original discussion. If you feel anything is missing, please [[WP:BOLD|be bold]] and add it.

{{notavote}}

''' Proposal 1a: Delete all portals (original proposal) '''

{{talkquote|Should the system of [[WP:PORTAL|portals]] be ended? This would include the deletion of all portal pages and the removal of the portal namespace. 14:23, 8 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Muslim conquests of the Indian subcontinent#rfc_B98CCEA|Talk:Muslim conquests of the Indian subcontinent]] expired 2018-04-16 14:01 ===
* Id: B98CCEA
* User: 202.156.182.84
* Date: 2018-03-17 13:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|831292696|HIST 831292696}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|831292698|POL 831292698}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|831292699|RELI 831292699}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|836724915|HIST 836724915}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|836724921|POL 836724921}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|836724923|RELI 836724923}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A large amount of the text already included shows that the numerous invasions were either defeated, repelled or they were just short opportunistic raids. Wikipedia guidelines on neutrality, POV, bias, due balance, etc are clear. Calling those the "conquests" is POV bias, which lends undue balance to some "wins" against the "numerous" defeats / repulsions /expulsions of muslim invaders by the native hindus/sikhs/buddhists. The contentious namespace, such as the [[Muslim conquests of the Indian subcontinent]], creates a muslim-supremacist bias. Move the article to a more non-contentious, balanced, fairer, and more accurate non-supremacist namespace, such as the [[Attempted muslim invasions of the Indian subcontinent]] or the [[Muslim invasions of the Indian subcontinent]], etc. [[Special:Contributions/202.156.182.84|202.156.182.84]] ([[User talk:202.156.182.84|talk]]) 13:55, 17 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Autoconfirmed article creation trial/Request for comment on permanent implementation#rfc_E945E64|Wikipedia:Autoconfirmed article creation trial/Request for comment on permanent implementation]] expired 2018-04-18 14:01 ===
* Id: E945E64
* User: TonyBallioni
* Date: 2018-03-19 13:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|831228494|POLICY 831228494}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|837061966|POLICY 837061966}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In  April 2011, the community  reached  a [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)/Proposal to require autoconfirmed status in order to create articles|large consensus by  RfC]] for a 6  month  trial limiting  the creation  of articles in  mainspace by  non-[[WP:Autoconfirmed|autoconfirmed]] users. In June 2017 after discussions with the English Wikipedia community, the Wikimedia Foundation agreed that such a trial would be implemented. On 14 September 2017, the Wikimedia Foundation implemented the [[Wikipedia:Autoconfirmed article creation trial|Autoconfirmed article creation trial]] (commonly referred to as ACTRIAL) and it ended on 14 March 2018 after 6 months. The results of the research can be found at '''[[meta:Research:Autoconfirmed article creation trial]]''' and '''[[Wikipedia:Autoconfirmed article creation trial/Post-trial Research Report]]'''. Three of the major themes of the report were that:
#New user activity and retention is largely unaffected
#Creation of pages by new users shifted to draft space from article space
#Fewer low-quality and inappropriate  pages have been created in article space

The [[meta:Research:Autoconfirmed article creation trial|independent consultant's research]] generally shows that the concerns (hypotheses) that were raised before the trial about the restrictions having a negative impact on retention of new editors did not occur, the trial and the research conducted has received generally positive feedback. 

Following the trial, and in view of the promise to the community that the rule will not be permanently installed without a further discussion, it is proposed that as from 3 May 2018, (or sooner if a consensus is reached): 

'''Creation of new articles in the main space is restricted to accounts that have reached autoconfirmed status (four days registered and at least ten edits).'''
[[User:TonyBallioni|TonyBallioni]] ([[User talk:TonyBallioni|talk]]) 13:39, 19 March 2018 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
While I am aware that "ore" and "knut" happen to be Norwegian names, it seems very unlikely that a person who "happens" to be named "knut m ore" who has only a single reference of a news article I cannot track down really exists. Could any editors with experience in BLP's and can read Norwegian assist? <span style="font-family:Garamond;font-variant:small-caps;color: maroon;">Jcmcc</span> ([[User Talk:Jcmcc450|Talk]]) 18:31, 16 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Buckingham Palace#rfc_2155F29|Talk:Buckingham Palace]] expired 2018-04-19 00:01 ===
* Id: 2155F29
* User: Firebrace
* Date: 2018-03-19 23:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|831320658|HIST 831320658}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|831320666|MEDIA 831320666}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|837140417|HIST 837140417}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|837140422|MEDIA 837140422}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Talk:People's Mujahedin of Iran#rfc_DF92047|Talk:People's Mujahedin of Iran]] expired 2018-04-21 10:01 ===
* Id: DF92047
* User: London Hall
* Date: 2018-04-06 13:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|835154671|POL 835154671}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|837518169|POL 837518169}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The article has NPOV issues. A lot of it seems to be coming from manipulation of references, for instance:

{{tq| * “In a 2004 public release, Amnesty International stated it continues to receive reports of human rights violations carried out by the MEK against its own members.[194]” }}

The Amnesty International statement actual says the contrary, that the Iranian regime tortured a suspected MEK member.

In other instances, sources [http://thehill.com/blogs/pundits-blog/international/319141-americans-must-be-wary-of-irans-influence-over-us-media funded by the Iranian Regime] are being used. This creates NPOV issues as the Iranian Regime considers this group one of its [https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/tehrans-futile-attempts-at-discrediting-the-cause-for-regime-change-in-iran/article/2641728 main political threats]. The following was published by the Brookings Institution, who receives funds to [https://www.theguardian.com/media/2016/may/21/npr-funding-iran-nuclear-deal-ploughshares publish on behalf of the Iranian Regime]:

{{tq| * “Members who defected from the MEK and some experts say that these Mao-style self-criticism sessions are intended to enforce control over sex and marriage in the organization as a total institution.[184]” }}

Proposing cleaning up the article and removing references funded by the Iranian Regime as these will have an inevitable bias against this group. One particular editor has monopolized the article and won’t anyone edit it, so requesting feedback from neutral editors. Support / Oppose ? [[User:London Hall|London Hall]] ([[User talk:London Hall|talk]]) 13:18, 6 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Windows Server 2016#rfc_CD70E13|Talk:Windows Server 2016]] expired 2018-04-22 00:01 ===
* Id: CD70E13
* User: NazmusLabs
* Date: 2018-03-22 23:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|830204979|SCI 830204979}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|837622272|SCI 837622272}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the past, Windows Server was not included in the list becasue it wasn't updated as a continuous release as was Windows 10 & Windows 10 mobile.

There was only Windows Server 2016, and it was akin to Windows 7, Windows Vista, Server 2008 RT, etc. But now, it's different.

Server has now adopted the Software as a service model and has aligned itself with Windows 10 client. There's now RS3, RS4, and RS5 releases either public or scheduled.

There needs to be a consensus on whether server should be included.

There's mobile version history. Why not server.

Thoughts, please.

[[User:NazmusLabs|NazmusLabs (A small part of a bigger movement to better the world!)]] ([[User talk:NazmusLabs|talk]]) 23:56, 22 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Vladimir Peftiev#rfc_5569C23|Talk:Vladimir Peftiev]] expired 2018-04-23 20:01 ===
* Id: 5569C23
* User: 46.56.226.159
* Date: 2018-03-24 19:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|832251754|BIO 832251754}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|837914883|BIO 837914883}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article contains coverage of EU sanctions that were brought against the article's subject, Vladimir Peftiev, and enforced from portions of 2011 through 2014. Peftiev brought legal challenge against the sanctions and in Decemeber 2014, the Council of the European Union (the same body which imposed the sanctions) voided them.  While some discussion of these facts has been present in the article since 2016, there is now a dispute as to how much coverage these events should receive in the article; recent edits have considerably expanded the coverage of the criticisms section--not just with regard to the sanctions, but also additional related allegations which have been made against Peftiev. Other editors have advocated against this additional content. The span of perspectives is reasonably captured by the following two drafts: [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vladimir_Peftiev&oldid=829311329 fleshed-out criticism section], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vladimir_Peftiev&oldid=828504540 a more conservative criticism section].

Advocates for the minimalist approach have argued that recently added content is based on sourcing which is either unreliable or insufficient to support the new content, given the increased burden which must be met for [[WP:EXCEPTIONAL]] claims.  They further argue that, even putting the source reliability aside, some of this content may over-emphasize accusations which are [[WP:UNDUE]] under our weight policies, given the circumstances and the fact that the EU has explicitly annulled the sanctions against Peftiev.  Advocates for the inclusionist perspective disagree and find the sources both reliable and appropriate to the claims they support, and argue that the coverage of additional allegations against Peftiev (some related to the sanctions, some not) is both [[WP:DUE]] and [[WP:PROPORTION]]AL. Your input is requested on the following questions:

1) Which of the following sources are appropriate or inappropriate for use in the context they would be utilized for in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vladimir_Peftiev&oldid=831067416 the current version of the article]? 
*[https://www.nv-online.info/2010/08/06/vladimir-peftiev-milliarder.html Narodnaja Volya]
*[https://gazetaby.com/cont/art.php?sn_nid=42797 gazetaby.com]
*[https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/1896992 Ogoniok]
*[https://charter97.org/en/news/2013/9/4/75078/ Charter97]
*[https://nn.by/?c=ar&i=61552 Nasha Niva] 
*[[Malta Today]] ([https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/business/business_news/30726/citizenship-individual-investor-programme-20131016 one], [https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/16293/foreign-ministry-issues-penalties-on-trade-with-belarus-tycoon-20120223#.WgLDYNhRWUk two], [https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/world/69839/belarus_dictators_bagman_vladimir_peftiev_once_a_malta_resident_named_in_bahamas_offshore_leaks#.WgLBWthRWUk three], [https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/12485/us-embassy-cables-belarus-money-man-channelled-funds-from-malta-to-dictator#.WgLDrthRWUk four], [https://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/65287/panama_papers__wife_of_belarus_oligarch_in_malta_used_bvi_companies_during_eu_sanctions five])
*[http://webdoc.france24.com/inside_belarus_networks/ France24]

2) Given your perspective on question #1, which statements do you feel are unsupported and should be removed?

We apologize that this RfC does not give respondents a clearer question to !vote up or down, but your input as to the underlying issue of which sources are or are not reliable for the claims they currently support could be very useful in breaking this deadlock, thank you!

[[Special:Contributions/46.56.226.159|46.56.226.159]] ([[User talk:46.56.226.159|talk]]) 19:23, 24 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jan Grabowski (historian)#rfc_72724CB|Talk:Jan Grabowski (historian)]] expired 2018-04-24 04:01 ===
* Id: 72724CB
* Date: 2018-03-27 02:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|832628163|HIST 832628163}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|832628167|POL 832628167}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|832628172|SOC 832628172}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|832675557|BIO 832675557}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|837972386|BIO 837972386}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|837972387|HIST 837972387}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|837972389|POL 837972389}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|837972390|SOC 837972390}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is currently a prolonged dispute between various editors about the neutrality (or lack thereof) of this article. Given the [[Impasse|impasse]] the conversation has reached presently, and the fact it's limited to a relatively small group of editors, this RfC seeks to get the opinion of more, ideally not previously involved, editors on the following matters:<br>
Question 1: Does the article in it's current state violate WP:NPOV?<br>
Question 2: If there is indeed a neutrality problem, how should it be adressed? 02:19, 27 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:In the news#rfc_92E5CA0|Wikipedia talk:In the news]] expired 2018-04-24 12:01 ===
* Id: 92E5CA0
* User: WTKitty
* Date: 2018-04-24 10:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|838007757|PROJ 838007757}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|838014093|PROJ 838014093}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What are the parameters, purpose, and scope of in the news? and what do users want in the news to be?

This discussion is intended to be a completely open discussion where there are no "starting points". It is for everyone to give a view of what they see for In The nNews. Please do not fall back and state "this already known" or "this is obvious" or "this has already been decided" or similar that will not help with the discussions and has the potential to be seen as hostile and unconstructive. 

There are no right or wrong answers here and everything from complete reworking, to retaining the status quo, to scrapping ITN, are welcome to be discussed. These are mere suggestions and are not a list of must be discussed issues. 

Please remain civil at all times.

[[User:WTKitty|WTKitty]] ([[User talk:WTKitty|talk]]) 10:27, 24 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Islam-related articles#rfc_995EF89|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Islam-related articles]] expired 2018-04-26 03:01 ===
* Id: 995EF89
* User: Eperoton
* Date: 2018-03-27 02:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|832628168|RELI 832628168}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|838290830|RELI 838290830}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following paragraph be added to [[MOS:ISLAM]]? [[User:Eperoton|Eperoton]] ([[User talk:Eperoton|talk]]) 02:05, 27 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_8C7D5BE|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2018-04-26 03:01 ===
* Id: 8C7D5BE
* User: Lojbanist
* Date: 2018-04-06 01:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|834551441|PROJ 834551441}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|838290832|PROJ 838290832}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting}}
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Proposals}}
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Criteria}}
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Naming conventions}}
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Discoveries}} - used to point out BOLD editors who choose to apply IAR to the WSS process
:{{pagelinks|Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Stub types}} - '''move''' to [[Wikipedia:Template messages/Stubs]]
:{{pagelinks|Template:Stubsort}} - used to bug people who use the generic [[Template:Stub]]
:{{pagelinks|Template:Stub sort}} - same as stubsort
:{{pagelinks|Template:WPSS-cat}}
:{{pagelinks|Template:WPSS-new}}
:redundant over-specific templates - {{tl|underpopulated stub category}}, {{tl|very large stub category}}, {{tl|deprecated stub}}

Do we '''really''' need all this bureaucracy for stub templates? I don't think so. You want to create a new stub template? You have to go through WSS first. What's that, you've decided to just be bold and create the template? Too bad; it's going to TFD, where the 5 active TFDers will ignore it, causing it to be automaticallly deleted. I propose that WSS be shut down and the stub template process be made much less process-y, per the Esperanza precedent. (This was originally on MFD, but I was told to go here, despite MFD being where the dissolution of Esperanza was discussed.) '''[[User:Lojbanist|Lojbanist]]''' <sup>[[User talk:Lojbanist|remove cattle from stage]]</sup> 01:15, 6 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fauxcest#rfc_5055E78|Talk:Fauxcest]] expired 2018-04-26 15:01 ===
* Id: 5055E78
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2018-04-03 21:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|834092268|MEDIA 834092268}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|834092270|SOC 834092270}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|838363239|MEDIA 838363239}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|838363242|SOC 838363242}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Sometime ago, {{Article|Fauxcest}} was merged with {{Article|Incest pornography}}. The rationale behind this was [[WP:NEO]], [[WP:POVFORK]] and that the Fauxcest article was not much bigger than the section on Fauxcest at the Incest pornography article. An IP has challenged this. The IP somewhat expanded the article, and has argued that "stepfamily is non-consanguineous" and that "we could rename [the article] to pseudo-incest." A counterargument is that that "fauxcest" mainly concerns pornography, sexual activity between step-siblings is still referred to as [[incest]], and the current version of the article contains some [[WP:Synthesis]].   

Thoughts? [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 21:50, 3 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_19E8D28|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2018-04-27 22:01 ===
* Id: 19E8D28
* User: Eggishorn
* Date: 2018-03-28 21:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|832958007|POLICY 832958007}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|838572931|POLICY 838572931}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In closing the [[ Wikipedia:Arbitration/Requests/Case/Civility in infobox discussions|Civility in infobox discussions]] arbitration case, the Arbitration committee [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Requests/Case/Civility_in_infobox_discussions#Community_discussion_recommended|recommended]] {{tq|...well-publicized community discussions be held to address whether to adopt a policy or guideline addressing what factors should weigh in favor of or against including an infobox in a given article and how those factors should be weighted.}} As an editor who has not previously been involved in favor or against infobox usage and therefore a (hopefully) neutral party, I'm opening this discussion here. [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Requests/Case/Infoboxes#Community_discussion_recommended|A prior call for discussion]] did not clarify standards for infobox usage. That leaves two policy questions in this latest recommendation: 
#Are infoboxes necessary for articles generally
#How editors decide if infoboxes are necessary on particular articles
It seems logical to decide the first before the second. 

The spectrum of options for the first question logically runs from "infoboxes everywhere" to "infoboxes nowhere". [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Requests/Case/Infoboxes#Use_of_infoboxes|The previous infobox Arbitration decision]], however, found that: {{tq|[t]he use of infoboxes is neither required nor prohibited for any article by site policies or guidelines.}} The extreme policy options of "every article should have an infobox" and "no article should have an infobox" are therefore not offered as options here. The spectrum of remaining options is:
*Infoboxes are used by default on most articles – removing one from an article with one requires talk page consensus
*Infoboxes are used by default on broad class(es) of articles (e.g., biographies, biological species, etc.) – removing one from an article with one requires talk page consensus (Note: the obverse is therefore also true, articles not in the defined class(es) by default omit infoboxes.) 
<s>*Infoboxes are used by default on some more-restricted subset(s) of articles (e.g., music biographies, invertebrate species, etc.) – removing one from an article with one requires talk page consensus (Note: the obverse is therefore also true, articles not in the defined subset(s) by default omit infoboxes.)</s>
*Infoboxes are neither used by default nor omitted by default – adding one to an article without one or removing one from an article with one requires talk page consensus
*<s>Infoboxes are omitted by default on some more-restricted subset(s) of articles (e.g., music biographies, invertebrate species, etc.) – adding one to an article without one requires talk page consensus (Note: the obverse is therefore also true, articles not in the defined subset(s) by default include infoboxes.)</s>
*<s>Infoboxes are omitted by default on broad class(es) of articles (e.g., biographies, biological species, etc.) – adding one to an article without one requires talk page consensus (Note: the obverse is therefore also true, articles not in the defined class(es) by default include infoboxes.)</s>
*Infoboxes are omitted by default on most articles – adding one to an article without one requires talk page consensus 
Wikiprojects would be the most logical place to determine which articles come under the "broad classes" and "some more-restricted subset" options, where active projects exist.

'''''Request to !voters:''''' To assist the future closers of this RfC in assessing consensus on so many options, it is requested that editors ''only'' place a '''support''' !vote in the subsection below that most closely aligns with their preferred option.  '''Oppose''' !votes are ''not necessary'' and should be assumed for the remaining other options. I recognize that this "support only one option" request eliminates nuanced views but this is by design.  Previous discussions have not yielded much clarity, so clarity is preferred here over nuance.  Discussions to determine the exact parameters of the selected option, as well as question #2 listed above, will be presented later. Thank you in advance for your help. [[User:Eggishorn|Eggishorn]] [[User talk:Eggishorn|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Eggishorn|(contrib)]] 21:13, 28 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Husan#rfc_949661C|Talk:Husan]] expired 2018-04-28 05:01 ===
* Id: 949661C
* User: Davidbena
* Date: 2018-04-04 22:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

There seems to be some dispute whether or not this article should contain a reference to security incidents involving Husan residents. It has been suggested that the following edit be made in a sub-section following the section: "Post-1967":

''' Security incidents involving Husan residents '''

* In 2014, 23 year-old Muhammed Zaul, suicide bomber, blew himself up at a bus-stop in Jerusalem, killing 8 and wounding 59.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A62360-2004Feb22.html |title=Jerusalem Bus Bombing Kills 8, Wounds 59 (washingtonpost.com) |access-date=14 December 2014}}</ref>
* In 2015, 22 year-old Halva Aliyan attempted to stab a security guard at the entrance to [[Beitar Ilit]] and was shot.<ref>[http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Israeli-stabbed-outside-Betar-Illit-in-second-terror-attack-of-the-day-432374 The Jerusalem Post (8 November 2015)]</ref>

=== [[Talk:Family of Donald Trump#rfc_1F3D8CE|Talk:Family of Donald Trump]] expired 2018-04-29 02:01 ===
* Id: 1F3D8CE
* Date: 2018-03-30 01:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|833173625|BIO 833173625}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|833173627|POL 833173627}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|838748305|BIO 838748305}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|838748308|POL 838748308}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The question is: what should and should not be included in the infobox? The infobox apparently should be a condensed form of all the important information in the article. As there was recently an edit war over whether the extended family members are notable enough to be mentioned in the infobox or not, I decided to open an RfC and ask for the opinions of other users. The ones that are currently listed under that parameter are the president's parents, grandparents and uncle (who are deceased), his former wives (whom Donald Trump obviously is not married to anymore), and his siblings who are not as prominent as his wife and children. Adding their names also makes the infobox look oversized. I would like to see what the other users think about it. <span style="font:'Pristina'">[[user:Keivan.f|<span style="color: #1E7HDC">Keivan.f</span>]]</span><span style="font:'Pristina'"><sup>[[user_talk:Keivan.f|<span style="color: purple">Talk</span>]]</sup></span> 01:18, 30 March 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Apache OpenOffice#rfc_E65C227|Talk:Apache OpenOffice]] expired 2018-05-03 18:01 ===
* Id: E65C227
* User: Walter Görlitz
* Date: 2018-04-03 17:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|834170505|SCI 834170505}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|839478522|SCI 839478522}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Request for comments. What should the 'development status' parameter be set to in the article's infobox.
:'''A''' - Moribund
:'''B''' - Low activity
:'''C''' - Stalled
:'''D''' - Slowed
:'''E''' - <empty> (indicating the project is Active per [[Template:Infobox software]])
:'''F''' - <something else>

The discussion was getting long and it needed a vertical break. While doing this, I think it would be an appropriate time to ask about suggested options.

To summarize, the documentation seems to only offer the option of "stalled" for us, since the other options (planned, unmaintained, discontinued, abandonware) are not appropriate. It is by definition, not under active development. Two additional options are "low activity" and keeping at "Moribund". I prefer the current option and my next choice would be low activity, and then stalled, but that doesn't accurately represent its development status. [[User:Walter Görlitz|Walter Görlitz]] ([[User talk:Walter Görlitz|talk]]) 17:39, 3 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Neo-Nazism#rfc_6E1E58D|Talk:Neo-Nazism]] expired 2018-05-04 02:01 ===
* Id: 6E1E58D
* User: Beyond My Ken
* Date: 2018-04-04 01:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|834124796|HIST 834124796}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|834124797|POL 834124797}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|839532685|HIST 839532685}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|839532687|POL 839532687}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The opening sentence of this article used to read<blockquote>Neo-Nazism consists of post-World War II militant social or political movements seeking to revive the ideology of Nazism.</blockquote> On 24 March, [[User:LightandDark2000]] added the words "and implement" to the sentence, so that it read<blockquote>Neo-Nazism consists of post-World War II militant social or political movements seeking to revive and implement the ideology of Nazism.</blockquote>The purpose of this RfC is to determine whether "and implement" &ndash; or other equivalent or near-equivalent phrases, such as "and establish" or "and put into effect" &ndash; should be kept in the opening sentence, or if it should be reverted to the original version. [[User:Beyond My Ken|Beyond My Ken]] ([[User talk:Beyond My Ken|talk]]) 01:42, 4 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Trump–Russia dossier#rfc_AEB6FCD|Talk:Trump–Russia dossier]] expired 2018-05-04 05:01 ===
* Id: AEB6FCD
* Date: 2018-04-17 14:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|839532687|POL 839532687}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|839553255|POL 839553255}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I really thought we had consensus, but I would like to formalize it in light of {{u|Atsme}}'s challenge of the material. 

{{tq2|Cohen's office, home, and hotel were raided by FBI agents acting under a federal search warrant in mid-April 2018. A few days later, [[The McClatchy Company|McClatchy]] reported that [[Special Counsel investigation (2017–present)|Mueller investigation]] was in possession of evidence that Cohen travelled to [[Prague]] in August or September 2016. If true, the report bolsters similar claims in 3 of the dossier's 17 reports. According to McClatchy's confidential sources, Cohen travelled to Prague via Germany, a passage which would not have required use of a passport.<ref name="Stone_Gordon_4/13/2018">{{cite web | url=http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/politics-government/white-house/article208870264.html | title=Sources: Mueller has evidence Cohen was in Prague in 2016, confirming part of dossier | work=[[The McClatchy Company|McClatchy DC Bureau]] | date=April 13, 2018 | accessdate=April 16, 2018 | last=Stone | first=Peter | last2=Gordon | first2=Greg}}</ref><ref name=Bump>{{cite web | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/politics/wp/2018/04/14/michael-cohen-visiting-prague-would-be-a-huge-development-in-the-russia-investigation/ | title=Michael Cohen’s visiting Prague would be a huge development in the Russia investigation | work=[[The Washington Post]] | date=April 14, 2018 | accessdate=April 16, 2018 | last=Bump | first=Philip}}</ref><ref name=Reuters-180414>{{cite web | url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-russia-prague/special-counsel-has-evidence-michael-cohen-traveled-to-prague-mcclatchy-idUSKBN1HL00J | title=Special counsel has evidence Michael Cohen traveled to Prague: McClatchy | work=[[Reuters]] | date=April 14, 2018 | accessdate=April 16, 2018}}</ref> In reaction, Cohen denied having ever been to Prague, as he had done in his January 2017 denial following the dossier's release.<ref name=Porter>{{cite web | url=http://www.newsweek.com/mueller-has-evidence-back-russia-dossiers-claims-about-trump-attorney-cohen-886152 | title=Trump Attorney Lied About Prague Trip, Mueller Investigation Reveals, As New Evidence Comes To Light | work=[[Newsweek]] | date=April 14, 2018 | accessdate=April 16, 2018 | last=Porter | first=Tom}}</ref><ref name="CBS_News_4/14/2018">{{cite web | author=[[CBS News]] | title=Trump lawyer Michael Cohen denies traveling to Prague | website=[[CBS News]] | date=April 14, 2018 | url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-lawyer-michael-cohen-denies-traveling-to-prague/ | access-date=April 15, 2018}}</ref><ref name="Cohen_Twitter_4/14/2018">{{cite web | last=Cohen | first=Michael | url=https://twitter.com/MichaelCohen212/status/985184355382431744 | date=April 14, 2018 | title=Michael Cohen on Twitter | publisher=[[Twitter]] | accessdate=April 14, 2018}}</ref>}}
{{sources-talk}}


{{Question}} Should this content be in the article? Pinging recent editors {{u|BullRangifer}}, {{u|Sławomir Biały}}, {{u|Volunteer Marek}}, {{u|Emir of Wikipedia}}, {{u|Objective3000}}, and {{u|Casprings}}. - [[user:MrX|Mr]][[user talk:MrX|X]] 🖋 14:29, 17 April 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tattoo#rfc_FA7EEC5|Talk:Tattoo]] expired 2018-05-04 15:01 ===
* Id: FA7EEC5
* User: Ohnoitsjamie
* Date: 2018-04-04 14:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|834217638|LANG 834217638}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|834217644|SOC 834217644}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|839611055|LANG 839611055}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|839611061|SOC 839611061}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Should word variants not in common usage be added to an article? '''An editor has added [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tattoo&type=revision&diff=834211972&oldid=834073230 tattooage] to the article several times after being reverted by myself and another editor.  One source is [[Wiktionary]], which is not considered to be a reliable source, and the other is the [[Oxford English Dictionary]], which is behind a paywall and can't be independently verified as of now [http://www.oed.com/viewdictionaryentry/Entry/198125].  A web search makes it clear that "tattooage" is not used with any degree of regularity; if it is listed in the OED, it's likely that it's tagged as obscure or archaic. One of the few usages I found was from a [https://books.google.com/books?id=wGFpLsEa9LUC&pg=PA399&lpg=PA399&dq=%22tattooage%22&source=bl&ots=HA9G5_EKGc&sig=N4L3GhhZ_mz5yZ4ira57nPi0wdQ&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwj13bmc8KDaAhVh4IMKHU0qCNA4ChDoATADegQIABA1#v=onepage&q=%22tattooage%22&f=false medical textbook published in 1910]. <b>[[User:Ohnoitsjamie|OhNo<span style="color: #D47C14;">itsJamie</span>]] [[User talk:Ohnoitsjamie|<sup>Talk</sup>]]</b> 14:49, 4 April 2018 (UTC)}}
