** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|848164800|BIO 848164800}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
1. Should people with, for example, one African-American parent be added to [[:Category:African-American people]] (and subcategories)<br>
(a) on the basis of (i) reliable sources saying that the person in question is African-American ''themselves'', (ii) self-identification, or (iii) both<br>
OR (b) is the identification of one parent being African-American sufficient?<br>
2. Should a statement of this be included in the guideline?

This has arisen in discussions at [[Talk:Kris Humphries#African-American?]] and [[Talk:Meghan Markle#Nationality/ethnicity categories]]. Note also the 2016 RfC at [[Talk:Mariah Carey/Archive 13#RfC: Are "African American" categories supported by sources and policy?]] [[User:StAnselm|<b>St</b>]][[Special:Contributions/StAnselm|Anselm]] ([[User talk:StAnselm|talk]]) 04:25, 31 May 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Liberty University#rfc_18CAE7C|Talk:Liberty University]] expired 2018-07-01 01:01 ===
* Id: 18CAE7C
* User: Snooganssnoogans
* Date: 2018-06-01 00:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|844097897|POL 844097897}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|844097901|RELI 844097901}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|844097903|SOC 844097903}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|848291233|POL 848291233}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|848291234|RELI 848291234}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|848291237|SOC 848291237}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This text is currently under dispute, with some editors arguing that it does not belong on Liberty University's Wikipedia page or that it should be trimmed (the formatting for the following three sources in the first sentence got screwed up[https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2016/10/trump-evangelical-falwell-liberty-university-christian-conservatives-214394][https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2017/08/25/jerry-falwell-miami-hostel-liberty-university-trey-falwell-215528][https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2017/11/01/jerry-falwell-jr-relishes-new-fight-donald-trump-liberty-university-peaks]):

* ''In 2016, a student editor said that an opinion column critical of presidential candidate Donald Trump was censored by LU's president Jerry Falwell Jr.<ref name=":7">{{Cite news|url=https://www.politico.com/story/2016/10/jerry-falwell-donald-trump-liberty-229964|title=Falwell censored anti-Trump column, Liberty U student  editor says|work=POLITICO|access-date=2018-04-24}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2016/10/trump-evangelical-falwell-liberty-university-christian-conservatives-214394|title=How Trump Is Dividing Jerry Falwell’s University|work=POLITICO Magazine|access-date=2018-04-24}}</ref><ref name=":6">{{Cite news|url=https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2017/08/25/jerry-falwell-miami-hostel-liberty-university-trey-falwell-215528|title=My Weekend at the Falwells’ South Beach Flophouse|work=POLITICO Magazine|access-date=2018-04-24}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite news|url=https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2017/11/01/jerry-falwell-jr-relishes-new-fight-donald-trump-liberty-university-peaks|title=Jerry Falwell Jr. relishes new fight for Donald Trump as Liberty University peaks|access-date=2018-04-24|language=en}}</ref> The column was written after a video was released showing Trump boasting about sexually assaulting women.<ref name=":7" /> Trump's candidacy caused fractures at the university, as a number of students disagreed with Trump, protested the university's ties with Trump, and were critical of Falwell Jr.'s staunch support of Trump.<ref name=":3" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/grade-point/wp/2016/10/12/liberty-is-not-trump-u-students-protest-donald-trump/|title=Liberty University students protest association with Trump|last=Shapiro|first=T. Rees|date=2016-10-13|work=Washington Post|access-date=2018-04-24|last2=Bailey|first2=Sarah Pulliam|language=en-US|issn=0190-8286|last3=Svrluga|first3=Susan|last4=Clement|first4=Scott}}</ref> Mark DeMoss, chief of staff of Falwell Sr., was forced to resign from Liberty’s board of trustees after criticizing the university's close affiliation with Trump.<ref name=":8">{{Cite news|url=https://www.vox.com/identities/2017/11/4/16597988/liberty-university-anti-trump-author-falwell-jonathan-martin-evangelical|title=Liberty University booted an anti-Trump Christian author from campus|work=Vox|access-date=2018-04-24}}</ref> Liberty University rescinded a speaking invitation of Jonathan Merritt, an alumnus of the school, after he criticized Liberty University, and expelled Christian author Jonathan Martin from campus due to his repeated criticisms of the university's affiliation with Trump.<ref name=":8" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2017/11/why-liberty-university-banned-an-anti-trump-christian-author-from-campus/544571/|title=Why Liberty University Kicked an Anti-Trump Christian Author Off Campus|last=Merritt|first=Jonathan|work=The Atlantic|access-date=2018-04-24|language=en-US}}</ref>''

* ''Some students protested again when President Trump equated white supremacists with counter-protesters at a white supremacist march in Charlotesville, Virginia.<ref name=":9">{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2017/08/21/liberty-university-graduates-return-diplomas-because-of-support-for-trump-by-jerry-falwell-jr/|title=Jerry Falwell Jr. keeps defending Trump as Liberty University grads return diplomas|last=Schmidt|first=Samantha|date=2017-08-21|work=Washington Post|access-date=2018-04-24|last2=Wang|first2=Amy B.|language=en-US|issn=0190-8286}}</ref> After Trump's remarks, Liberty University president Falwell Jr. said that he was “so proud” of Trump for his “bold truthful” statement on the tragedy.<ref name=":9" /> A number of students returned their diplomas to Liberty University and called on the university to disavow Trump's remarks.<ref name=":9" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.npr.org/2017/08/20/544776964/some-liberty-university-grads-are-returning-their-diplomas-to-protest-trump|title=Some Liberty University Grads Are Returning Their Diplomas To Protest Trump|work=NPR.org|access-date=2018-04-24|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/08/21/us/jerry-falwell-liberty-university-trump.html|title=Liberty University Alumni Return Diplomas in Protest of Trump Remarks|date=2017-08-21|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-04-24|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> The students argued that Trump's remarks were "incompatible with Liberty University’s stated values, and incompatible with a Christian witness."<ref name=":9" />''

Does this belong? If something should be trimmed, what precisely should be trimmed? Note that the content is extremely well-sourced, covers a number of notable events (student protests, senior staff resigning, speakers being disinvited) and covers events that are of obvious importance to a university that plays a prominent role in Republican politics. Consider for example if LU was "fractured" in the early 2000s over the university's relationship to George W. Bush (or Ronald Reagan in the 80s) during his presidency with prominent student protests, students returning diplomas, senior staff resigning and alumni speakers being disinvited, and that all of this was reported by 9 reliable sources. Would anyone seriously argue that such content would not have encyclopedic value (an interesting notable episode in the history of this university) and easily fulfill Wiki policy requirements? [[User:Snooganssnoogans|Snooganssnoogans]] ([[User talk:Snooganssnoogans|talk]]) 00:51, 1 June 2018 (UTC)}}

The supplementary [[Template:Promising draft]] was [[SPecial:Diff/843844917|updated]] to reflect the editing policy on which it is based today, which is what sparked this controversy. Hello everyone! I'm opening this RfC to seek outside opinons on whether opinions about Goliath's [[acromegaly]] should be included in the article. {{rfcquote|text=
As listed above, [[User:RAF910|RAF910]] deleted an entire page with several years of work attached to it and replaced it with a straight copy of a more recent report whose contents have been questioned and corrected in the past due to inaccuracies. This was done without any attempt to consult on the talk page of the prior page. While the data being proposed is from a more recent publication, there appear to still be serious issues with its accuracy on precisely the same grounds as for earlier version of this publication. Attempts to discuss this have been confrontational in nature from the beginning and external opinions would be of use for a constructive outcome. === [[Wikipedia talk:Did you know#rfc_0E23E3F|Wikipedia talk:Did you know]] expired 2018-07-02 07:01 ===
* Id: 0E23E3F
* User: Yoninah
* Date: 2018-06-11 14:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|845609269|POLICY 845609269}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|848489771|POLICY 848489771}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[WP:ERRORS#DYK current|A discussion <del>is going on</del> <ins>was previously</ins> at ERRORS]] ([[Special:Permalink/845492490#DYK current|permalink to final version]]) about whether hooks reporting murders, riots, etc., should be featured on the main page. The hook in question, which was pulled, was:
*... that a newlywed man was killed and his wife seriously injured in February after opening a '''[[Patnagarh bombing|parcel bomb]]''' that looked like a wedding gift?
* We need to build consensus on this point, rather than have administrators feel free to pull hooks they don't like. Please add your comments here. Thank you, [[User:Yoninah|Yoninah]] ([[User talk:Yoninah|talk]]) 14:44, 11 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mumbai#rfc_D4AA165|Talk:Mumbai]] expired 2018-07-02 17:01 ===
* Id: D4AA165
* User: A145029
* Date: 2018-06-02 16:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|844104824|HIST 844104824}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|844104834|SOC 844104834}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|848549153|HIST 848549153}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|848549158|SOC 848549158}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Two sources state that Kolis (the first people in Mumbai) originated and migrated from Gujarat.<ref name=munshi1>{{cite book|url=https://archive.org/stream/in.ernet.dli.2015.97812/2015.97812.Gujarat-And-Its-Literature-1852#page/n31/mode/2up/search/Kolis|quote=The next immigrants into the islands of Bombay were the Kolis, who on all authorities continued to be their original inhabitants till Aungier founded the city of Bombay. Kathiawad and Central Gujarāt was the home of the Kolis in pre-historic times.|title=Gujarāt and its literature, from early times to 1852|first=Kanaiyalal M.|last=Munshi|publisher=[[Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan Educational Trust|Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan]]|page=xix|year=1954}}</ref><ref name=oriental1>{{cite journal|title=Journal of the Oriental Institute|volume=33|first1=M. D.|last1=David|quote=The kolis who suceeded the stone-age men on the island brought with them from Gujarat their patron goddess Mummai whom their descendants still worship in Kathiawar. The name of Bombay is derived from this koli goddess.|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=quINAAAAYAAJ&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=koli+goddess|publisher=Oriental Institute|year=1983}}</ref> One of these sources also mentions that the name Mumbai is derived from the Koli goddess Mummai who also originated in Gujarat.<ref name=oriental1></ref> Should we add this information to the article? [[User:A145029|A145029]] ([[User talk:A145029|talk]]) 16:07, 2 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:University of London#rfc_EC398BE|Talk:University of London]] expired 2018-07-02 22:01 ===
* Id: EC398BE
* User: Aloneinthewild
* Date: 2018-06-02 21:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|844142001|SOC 844142001}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|848584758|SOC 848584758}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is not usually an area I would stand my ground over but I feel I really can't edit this article without being in a revert cycle. This is part of a wider issue on this article with behaviour verging on ownership and minor attacks in edit summaries towards multiple users- labelling them and their edits 'vandalism', 'Bias or personal opinions', 'biased and not educated' and the best one 'Wikipedia should not suffer for your trash.' (see the recent [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=University_of_London&action=history history]). 

All the conflicting edits appear to involve IPs addresses in a similar locality. Previously conflicts (over different content) involved a failure to engage the editor in the talk discussion (see [[#Popular culture]], hence I turn to an Rfc this time.

The content under debate is the lead sentence, should it read:
*{{tq|The '''University of London''' (informally '''London University''' and commonly abbreviated as '''Lond. or, more rarely, Londin''')}} or
*{{tq|The '''University of London''' (abbreviated as '''Lond.''' or more rarely '''Londin''' in [[Post-nominal letters|post-nominals]]) }}
I believe the second option is more appropriate, firstly, I see no sources showing it is referred to as '''London University'''. Even so, its unnecessary to tell people that the order of the name can be rearranged and guess what - same place. Second, its name is not ''commonly'' abbreviated as these abbreviations. To say so is misleading, it is only abbreviated like this for [[Post-nominal letters]]. This is why I also favour simply keeping to the sentence that is already at the end of the lead (in my first edit that as reverted). 

Thanks for reading this far, hopefully some extra input can help we can avoid these endless contact disputes
--[[User:Aloneinthewild|Aloneinthewild]] ([[User talk:Aloneinthewild|talk]]) 21:18, 2 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Marketing of electronic cigarettes#rfc_F7167F9|Talk:Marketing of electronic cigarettes]] expired 2018-07-02 23:01 ===
* Id: F7167F9
* User: QuackGuru
* Date: 2018-06-24 21:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|847374239|ECON 847374239}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|847374243|SCI 847374243}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|851831878|ECON 851831878}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|851831881|SCI 851831881}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The RfC above is poorly framed and is asking for permission to use any source on the subject even when those sources do not mention e-cigarette marketing, promotion, or advertising. If the RfC was framed differently would editors give a different response? Can we use a source to address the marketing claims when that source does not specifically state it was in relation to the marketing claims? For example, can we use a source about the safety of e-cigarettes when the source did not indicate the safety information about e-cigarettes being discussed is in relation to the marketing of e-cigarettes? Using a source to address the marketing claims is done on a case-by-case basis. '''Should we try to minimize or avoid using sources that do not indicate the content is in relation to the marketing of e-cigarettes?''' [[User:QuackGuru|<b style="color: #e34234;">QuackGuru</b>]] ([[User talk:QuackGuru|<span style="color: #B02200;">talk</span>]]) 21:19, 24 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Communist Party of China#rfc_92DEB86|Talk:Communist Party of China]] expired 2018-07-04 17:01 ===
* Id: 92DEB86
* User: Helper201
* Date: 2018-06-04 16:05:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|848831760|POL 848831760}}

{{rfcquote|text=
As per the discussions above there was no consensus to use the term left-wing to far-left in the infobox. I along with other editors above advocate keeping the political position section of the infobox blank for the reasons given above. In regards to authoritarian socialism there was discussion as to whether it could be regarded as a term. This has no bearing on whether or not it should be in the political positions section of the infobox, which it shouldn't. If this fits anywhere its in the ideology section. Authoritarian socialism does not fit on the political spectrum, that's a fact, so it has no reason to be in that section of the infobox. Also none of the sources used to support the claim of the party being authoritarian socialist actually directly stated the party is authoritarian socialist, therefore breaking [[WP:SYNTHESIS]], and as such should not be included. [[User:Helper201|Helper201]] ([[User talk:Helper201|talk]]) 16:05, 4 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Deepika Padukone#rfc_E6503B2|Talk:Deepika Padukone]] expired 2018-07-05 11:01 ===
* Id: E6503B2
* User: Tanbircdq
* Date: 2018-06-05 17:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|844561697|BIO 844561697}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|844561699|MEDIA 844561699}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|848939273|BIO 848939273}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|848939277|MEDIA 848939277}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It's useful for an infobox to be included on this article.

The utility of including infoboxes are standard in BLPs and there's clearly enough information here for a well formatted infobox. There doesn't appear to be any compelling reason not to include one as the information provided is helpful for casual readers at a glance (especially for parameters such as date of birth which would include the subject's age which isn't currently included anywhere in the article). Also, most people probably get their answers from the infobox or the filmography rather than visiting the article to read a whole biography.

A proposed infobox (most of this information isn't included in the lead) would include name, image, date of birth, place of birth, age, residence, nationality, alma mater, occupation, years active, filmography, home town, parent and awards. [[User:Tanbircdq|Tanbircdq]] ([[User talk:Tanbircdq|talk]]) 17:45, 5 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Help talk:IPA/English#rfc_DD24768|Help talk:IPA/English]] expired 2018-07-06 00:01 ===
* Id: DD24768
* User: Nardog
* Date: 2018-06-05 23:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|844611632|LANG 844611632}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|849024689|LANG 849024689}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There exist words such as ''[[Foehn wind|föhn]], [[Möbius strip|Möbius]], [[Peugeot]]'', and ''[[pho]]'', in which a vowel is pronounced as non-rhotic /ɜː/ in some accents, <ins>but not known to be pronounced as rhotic /ɜːr/ in rhotic accents</ins>. Currently, however, this key does not recognize /ɜː/ as a diaphoneme distinct from /ɜːr/ and {{tl|IPAc-en}} automatically converts the input <code>ɜː</code> to {{IPAc-en|ɜːr}}.

To accommodate this, should the key and template allow /ɜː/ to appear solely without /r/?

Articles affected by this proposal include, but are not limited to, [[American and British English pronunciation differences]], [[Amuse-bouche]], [[Beef bourguignon]], [[Betelgeuse]], [[Chartreuse (color)]], [[Foehn wind]], [[Loess]], [[Meunière sauce]], [[August Ferdinand Möbius]], [[Möbius strip]], [[Peugeot]], [[Pho]], [[Richelieu]], and <s>[[Arnold Schoenberg]]</s>.

See [[Help talk:IPA/English/Archive 21#Non-rhotic /ɜː/|/Archive 21#Non-rhotic /ɜː/]] for a preliminary discussion. [[User:Nardog|Nardog]] ([[User talk:Nardog|talk]]) 23:50, 5 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Enforceability of logged voluntary editing restrictions#rfc_33B9F34|Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Enforceability of logged voluntary editing restrictions]] expired 2018-07-07 07:01 ===
* Id: 33B9F34
* Date: 2018-06-07 06:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|844978995|POLICY 844978995}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|849196972|POLICY 849196972}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Formal editing restrictions, voluntarily accepted by an editor, have been logged on [[WP:Editing restrictions]] under the heading of ''Voluntary''. The three extant restrictions are:
# A voluntary [[WP:IBAN|interaction ban]] between two editors which is logged as "Indefinite". [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Editing_restrictions/Voluntary&oldid=799233002]
# A [[WP:TBAN|topic ban]] with a specific expiration date. [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Editing_restrictions/Voluntary&diff=831905073&oldid=831904994]
# A [[WP:TBAN|topic ban]] which is noted as both being enforceable by blocks and saying appeals are to be heard at [[WP:AN]]. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Editing_restrictions/Voluntary&diff=840698946&oldid=838282691&diffmode=visual][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Editing_restrictions/Voluntary&diff=841564168&oldid=840698946&diffmode=visual]

Debate has arisen over whether voluntary restrictions such as these are enforceable in the same way a [[WP:CBAN|community based ban]] can be. The question of this RfC is:

<blockquote> ''Are editing restrictions which are accepted voluntarily and logged at [[WP:Editing restrictions]] to be treated in the same way as  the [[WP:CBAN|community placed restrictions]] logged on the same page? This question deals with §4.3 [[WP:Editing restrictions#Voluntary]] and not §5 [[WP:Editing restrictions#Final warnings / Unblock conditions]]. </blockquote> [[User:Jbhunley|<span style="font-family:Monotype Corsiva;font-size:135%;color:#886600">Jbh</span>]][[User_talk:Jbhunley|<span style="color: #00888F"><sup> Talk</sup></span>]] 06:23, 7 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Darbara Singh (murderer)#rfc_CFBDE50|Talk:Darbara Singh (murderer)]] expired 2018-07-07 19:01 ===
* Id: CFBDE50
* User: WWGB
* Date: 2018-07-04 00:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|848744636|BIO 848744636}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|849263712|BIO 849263712}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Can someone help to resolve Singh's date of death? === [[Talk:Quantico (season 3)#rfc_FFF7660|Talk:Quantico (season 3)]] expired 2018-07-09 22:01 ===
* Id: FFF7660
* User: 47.15.236.250
* Date: 2018-06-09 21:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|845167396|MEDIA 845167396}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|845167397|POL 845167397}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|849568567|MEDIA 849568567}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|849568569|POL 849568569}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to draw attention to the depiction in this article of a controversy concerning an episode of this series and the response of the producers of the show. The dispute lies between two different versions of this article's description of the controversy:
# [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Quantico_(season_3)&diff=845105676&oldid=845105518 This one], edited predominantly by myself, which I believe is neutral, concise, and adheres to wikipedia policies concerning [[WP:NPOV|Neutrality]],[[WP:N|Notability]],[[WP:RS|Reliability]] and [[WP:UNDUE|Due Weight]].
# [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Quantico_(season_3)&diff=prev&oldid=845128122 This one], written predominantly by tendentious [[WP:SPA|single-purpose editor]] [[User:Krish!|Krish!]] (see combative edit summaries in [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Contributions/Krish! contribs]), which I believe violate [[WP:NPOV|Neutrality]] (value laden language like 'hateful tweets'), [[Poisoning the well]] fallacy ('criticized by Indians'), wilful disregard for content that provides valuable context (blanking of "This was dismissed as "ridiculous" and unrealistic, given .."), and numerous other unencyclopedic edits.

Clearly, this is a content dispute that's heating up rapidly, and so I have elected to take a step back and invite commentary from uninvolved objective editors so that further edits can proceed by consensus. Thanks [[Special:Contributions/47.15.236.250|47.15.236.250]] ([[User talk:47.15.236.250|talk]]) 21:09, 9 June 2018 (UTC)}}

* User: SMcCandlish

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|848761809|LANG 848761809}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|849083740|STYLE 849083740}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we restore the Arab/Arabic-related advice deemed correct but too narrow for the main MoS page, to this MoS subpage where it's on-topic?

Material recently reverted with "more support required", despite previous discussion of the idea meeting no opposition, on this very page:

{{block indent|1=
{{fake heading|level=3|Easily confusable terms}} 
{{shortcut|MOS:CONFUSE|MOS:ARAB}}
Do not use similar or related words in an incorrect, distorting, or meaning-blurring way.  For example, the adjective ''Arab'' refers to people and things of ethnic Arab origin. The term ''Arabic'' refers to the Arabic language or writing system, and related concepts. ''Arabian'' relates to the Arabian peninsula or historical Arabia. (These terms are all [[Proper noun|capitalized]], e.g. {{xt|Arabic coffee}} and {{xt|Arabian stallion}}, aside from a few conventionalized exceptions that have lost their cultural connection, such as {{xt|gum arabic}}.)  Do not substitute these terms for ''Islamic'', ''Moslem'', ''Islamist'', ''Middle-eastern'', etc.; a Moslem Arab is someone who is in both categories. Similar concerns pertain to many cultural, scientific, and other topics and the terminology used about them.  When in doubt about terminology, consult major modern dictionaries.
}}

<span style="white-space:nowrap;font-family:'Trebuchet MS'"> — [[User:SMcCandlish|'''SMcCandlish''']] [[User talk:SMcCandlish|☏]] [[Special:Contributions/SMcCandlish|¢]] 😼 </span> 03:39, 4 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of Prime Ministers of Pakistan#rfc_253EF78|Talk:List of Prime Ministers of Pakistan]] expired 2018-07-11 21:01 ===
* Id: 253EF78
* User: Jibran1998
* Date: 2018-07-01 13:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|849727424|POL 849727424}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|849854636|POL 849854636}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The 12th PM's govt was dissolved and later reinstated so the number for both terms before dissolution and after restoration should be 12. Now the 11th PM was Benazir Bhutto and she was re-elected in new elections and new voting after 12th PM resigned so she should be the 13th PM. She was not reinstated like 12th PM so the number should not be same for her 2nd term. Now after that 12th PM was re-elected in new elections but his number is still 12 like he's reinstated like before. Isn't this messed up? There's a difference between restoration and re-election. When a PM is restored he is restored to same old office but when he is re-elected it's new election, new voting, new oath and so new number as well. These numbers would probably be okay if these were consecutive terms like Obama was re-elected. There can’t be same number for non-consecutive terms. I've tried to change this but my edits are removed and asked to discuss about it. And another thing is we can't find any source which is focused on numbering. Some newspapers have used Wikipedia's numbering but it can't be used as source here as they are using Wikipedia as source. And this is a common sense thing so I think users should make a decision on this because there are many attempts to change it and many questions/discussion regarding the numbers on PM's talk pages. There’s no need to repeat numbers. If you see official government website for Prime Minsters of Pakistan you’ll see they don’t use same number they even changed number for reinstated term. So current numbering doesn’t make sense at all. It’s just confusing for everyone. Please end this dispute. There’s no reason for using current numbering.

{{ping|Jibran1998|Kashmiri|Vif12vf}} Shouldn't be changed?

No, Because number of Prime Minister is for the person. Express Tribune, Geo are reputable News Agencies you cant just ignore their News. When the new prime minister will be elected you can then see how the news organizations will label him [[User:Jibran1998|Jibran1998]] ([[User talk:Jibran1998|talk]]) 13:04, 1 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kombucha#rfc_A0BCD23|Talk:Kombucha]] expired 2018-07-12 19:01 ===
* Id: A0BCD23
* User: QuackGuru
* Date: 2018-06-15 16:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|846006943|SCI 846006943}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|850023791|SCI 850023791}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Old proposal: <s>"Its biological activities have not been demonstrated in humans for their purported health beneﬁts.</s><ref name=Villarreal-SotoBeaufort2018>{{cite journal|last1=Villarreal-Soto|first1=Silvia Alejandra|last2=Beaufort|first2=Sandra|last3=Bouajila|first3=Jalloul|last4=Souchard|first4=Jean-Pierre|last5=Taillandier|first5=Patricia|title=Understanding Kombucha Tea Fermentation: A Review|journal=Journal of Food Science|volume=83|issue=3|year=2018|pages=580–588|issn=00221147|doi=10.1111/1750-3841.14068|pmid=29508944}}</ref>"

New proposal: The purported health beneﬁts resulting from its biological activities have not been demonstrated in humans.<ref name=Villarreal-SotoBeaufort2018/>

{{reflist-talk}}

This is an alternative proposal to the "RfC on adding current research status". [[User:QuackGuru|<b style="color: #e34234;">QuackGuru</b>]] ([[User talk:QuackGuru|<span style="color: #B02200;">talk</span>]]) 16:41, 15 June 2018 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Kombucha#rfc_F430AE5|Talk:Kombucha]] expired 2018-07-12 19:01 ===
* Id: F430AE5
* User: WikiGJay
* Date: 2018-06-12 18:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|845583930|SCI 845583930}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|849981446|SCI 849981446}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The health claim studies overviewed in the Health Claims section are 15+ years old. The below content is from a 2018 peer-reviewed journal and brings the reader up to date with the current status of kombucha health claim studies. Why would we not add something like the below paragraph to the "Health claims" section?

See "Content deleted" and "Sourced content deleted" talk sections for full details.

A 2018 review stated, several ''[[in vitro]]'' studies have been done for kombucha which were in 1998, 2000, 2011, 2012, 2014, 2016, and 2017 as well as several researchers have done ''[[in vivo]]'' studies using rats from 2013 to 2015 for kombucha in the areas of diabetes, electromagnetic radiation, and liver and kidney toxicities due to diets high in cholesterol.<ref name=Villarreal-SotoBeaufort2018/> However, the results of biological activities have not been conﬁrmed for the purported health beneﬁts in humans.<ref name=Villarreal-SotoBeaufort2018>{{cite journal|last1=Villarreal-Soto|first1=Silvia Alejandra|last2=Beaufort|first2=Sandra|last3=Bouajila|first3=Jalloul|last4=Souchard|first4=Jean-Pierre|last5=Taillandier|first5=Patricia|title=Understanding Kombucha Tea Fermentation: A Review|journal=Journal of Food Science|volume=83|issue=3|year=2018|pages=580–588|issn=00221147|doi=10.1111/1750-3841.14068|pmid=29508944}}</ref>
[[User:WikiGJay|WikiGJay]] ([[User talk:WikiGJay|talk]]) 18:12, 12 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Antisemitism in the UK Labour Party#rfc_B39CC27|Talk:Antisemitism in the UK Labour Party]] expired 2018-07-13 11:01 ===
* Id: B39CC27
* User: Absolutelypuremilk
* Date: 2018-06-13 10:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|845672877|POL 845672877}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|850066081|POL 850066081}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are two tags on this page. I would like to remove them, but as per the above discussion, [[User:Garageland66|Garageland66]] and [[User:Slatersteven|Slatersteven]] disagree. The discussions don't seem to be reaching a conclusion so I have opened this RfC. Should the tags be removed? [[User:Absolutelypuremilk|Absolutelypuremilk]] ([[User talk:Absolutelypuremilk|talk]]) 10:05, 13 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Souliotes#rfc_1458327|Talk:Souliotes]] expired 2018-07-13 13:01 ===
* Id: 1458327
* User: Skylax30
* Date: 2018-07-10 13:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|849661603|HIST 849661603}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|850078263|HIST 850078263}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In this article, a limited number (about half a dozen) of users are contributing recently, plus one who is only deleting.

The point of argument is the origin or national identity of Souliotes. Some users want to emphasize on sources which claim Albanian origin or identity (language etc), and others want to emphasize the local origin and Greek identity. 

The subject (Souliotes) has a peculiarity: Their traditional community and way of living disappeared around 1830's, and there are very few sources who had a real contact with them. The rest (especially sources of the 20th c.) are interpretations of the previous, and some are heavily biased by the late 20th c.  ethnic conflicts in the Balkans.

There is a section covering the 19th century sources in the article. Some (but not all) are already there, but there are more that qualify for this section. These old sources are just mentioned, with no comments. Two or three users are strongly opposing to a couple of these sources. Latest unwanted source, the Austrian Military Gazette of 1830. Another one is not even primary: William Leake [https://books.google.gr/books?id=9XUKAAAAIAAJ&printsec=frontcover&hl=el&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=snippet&q=of%20Mount%20Pindus&f=false Leake W. "Travels in Northern Greece", London, 1835, vol. 1, p. 502]. The "problem" with those sources, as I understand it, is that they refer to Souliotes as Greeks and of local (rather than Albanian) origin. 

My argument is this: a) WP does not exclude the older sources from the articles, and gives certain guidelines on how to use them. b) There are already some early 19th century sources in the article. Therefore, if we are to exclude some, we must agree on the process of exclusion.

Thank you.--[[User:Skylax30|Skylax30]] ([[User talk:Skylax30|talk]]) 13:05, 10 July 2018 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

Does this article have basic issues with [[WP:SYNTH]]? 
[[User:Sturgeontransformer|Sturgeontransformer]] 22:50, 13 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Quantico (season 3)#rfc_8E52DF9|Talk:Quantico (season 3)]] expired 2018-07-14 07:01 ===
* Id: 8E52DF9
* User: Cunard
* Date: 2018-07-14 01:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|850163014|MEDIA 850163014}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|850163018|POL 850163018}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|854678571|MEDIA 854678571}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|854678573|POL 854678573}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to draw attention to the depiction in this article of a controversy concerning an episode of this series and the response of the producers of the show. The dispute lies between two different versions of this article's description of the controversy:
# [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Quantico_(season_3)&diff=845105676&oldid=845105518 This one], edited predominantly by myself, which I believe is neutral, concise, and adheres to wikipedia policies concerning [[WP:NPOV|Neutrality]],[[WP:N|Notability]],[[WP:RS|Reliability]] and [[WP:UNDUE|Due Weight]].
# [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Quantico_(season_3)&diff=prev&oldid=845128122 This one], written predominantly by tendentious [[WP:SPA|single-purpose editor]] [[User:Krish!|Krish!]] (see combative edit summaries in [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Contributions/Krish! contribs]), which I believe violate [[WP:NPOV|Neutrality]] (value laden language like 'hateful tweets'), [[Poisoning the well]] fallacy ('criticized by Indians'), wilful disregard for content that provides valuable context (blanking of "This was dismissed as "ridiculous" and unrealistic, given .."), and numerous other unencyclopedic edits.

Clearly, this is a content dispute that's heating up rapidly, and so I have elected to take a step back and invite commentary from uninvolved objective editors so that further edits can proceed by consensus. Thanks <small>RfC relisted by [[User:Cunard|Cunard]] ([[User talk:Cunard|talk]]) at 01:41, 14 July 2018 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the [[Political views of American academics#Higher Education Research Institute|page section about the HERI survey]] include the following sentence?

::When asked in 2012 about the significance of the findings on political views, the director of HERI, Sylvia Hurtado, said that the numbers on political views attract a lot of attention, but that this attention may be misplaced because there may be trivial reasons for the shifts.<ref name="Moving Further">{{cite news|url=http://www.insidehighered.com/news/2012/10/24/survey-finds-professors-already-liberal-have-moved-further-left|title=Moving Further to the Left|first=Scott|last=Jaschik|journal=Inside Higher Ed|date=October 24, 2012|accessdate=June 9, 2018|quote=Sylvia Hurtado, professor of education at UCLA and director of the Higher Education Research Institute, said that she didn't know what to make of the surge to the left by faculty members. She said that she suspects age may be a factor, as the full-time professoriate is aging, but said that this is just a theory. Hurtado said that these figures always attract a lot of attention, but she thinks that the emphasis may be misplaced because of a series of studies showing no evidence that left-leaning faculty members are somehow shifting the views of their students or enforcing any kind of political requirement.}}</ref>

--[[User:Tryptofish|Tryptofish]] ([[User talk:Tryptofish|talk]]) 17:24, 14 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_7335AF1|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2018-07-16 03:01 ===
* Id: 7335AF1
* Date: 2018-06-28 04:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|847843352|PROP 847843352}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|850474701|PROP 850474701}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{further|mw:Help:Extension:FileImporter|meta:WMDE Technical Wishes/Move files to Commons}}
The FileImporter and FileExporter extensions allow importing files to Wikimedia Commons from other wikis with all the original data intact, while documenting the import in the version history.

FileExporter provides a link to import the file to Wikimedia Commons on the local wiki. FileImporter imports the file, including all data, to Wikimedia Commons.

Should [[:mw:Extension:FileExporter|FileExporter]] be enabled on the English Wikipedia? 04:31, 28 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Placebo#rfc_72A91B2|Talk:Placebo]] expired 2018-07-16 23:01 ===
* Id: 72A91B2
* User: Rtc
* Date: 2018-06-16 22:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|846182650|SCI 846182650}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|850610400|SCI 850610400}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the <u>fourth</u> paragraph in the lede of [[Placebo]]:-- 
*'''Option 1'''-As written in the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Placebo&oldid=846175813 current version], quote from the [https://www.jclinepi.com/article/S0895-4356(97)00203-5/abstract paper's abstract] that:-- 
**{{bq|but a 1997 review of the study found "<u>no evidence [...] of any placebo effect in any of the studies cited</u>".}} 

:::::::::::::'''or''' 
*'''Option 2'''-As written in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Placebo&oldid=846167466 this version], quote from the ''main text'' and the ''conclusion'' of the full-text which says
**{{bq|but a 1997 review of the study found <u>a wide range of "conceptual and methodological mistakes" in the study as well as "a total of 800 articles on placebo". It noted that the reported outcomes could be "fully ... explained without presuming any therapeutic placebo effect" and concluded that "the existence of therapeutic effects of placebo administration seems questionable"</u>.}}

*And in ''general'':- 
**Should the article present it as the ''settled scientific consensus'' that the placebo effect is more or less a <u>myth</u>?'' 

*Initiated by --[[User:Rtc|rtc]] ([[User talk:Rtc|talk]]) 22:08, 16 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2018 in heavy metal music#rfc_9656FC9|Talk:2018 in heavy metal music]] expired 2018-07-19 20:01 ===
* Id: 9656FC9
* User: Sergecross73
* Date: 2018-06-19 19:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|846605058|MEDIA 846605058}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|851060823|MEDIA 851060823}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should an album be listed in a "year in genre" article when there are no sources that verify the album is of that genre, even if there are sources verifying the artist is of that genre?
:'''Example''': Should [[2018 in heavy metal music]] list the ''[[Post Traumatic (EP)]]'' release by [[Mike Shinoda]] in its album list? Sources confirm Shinoda sang in metal band [[Linkin Park]], but none call ''Post Traumatic'' itself a metal album of any variant.
:'''Example''': Should [[2018 in heavy metal music]] list the ''[[Eat the Elephant]]'' album by [[A Perfect Circle]] in its album list? Many sources called the band and their 2000s albums variants of metal, but no sources call ''Eat the Elephant'' itself a metal album of any variant. 
[[User:Sergecross73|<span style="color:green">Sergecross73</span>]] [[User talk:Sergecross73|<span style="color:teal">msg me</span>]] 19:18, 19 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Imran Awan#rfc_EEE644C|Talk:Imran Awan]] expired 2018-07-20 17:01 ===
* Id: EEE644C
* User: Korny O&#39;Near
* Date: 2018-07-12 01:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|849884453|BIO 849884453}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|849884455|POL 849884455}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|851187004|BIO 851187004}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|851187007|POL 851187007}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article state that [[Imran Awan]] was the subject of "conspiracy theories"? If so, what are the theories, and who spread them?

You can see the [[Talk:Imran_Awan#Summary_of_the_facts|section above]] for my attempt at summarizing the facts behind the issue. [[User:Korny O&#39;Near|Korny O&#39;Near]] ([[User talk:Korny O&#39;Near|talk]]) 01:22, 12 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Category talk:Liberalism in the United States#rfc_B5CB165|Category talk:Liberalism in the United States]] expired 2018-07-23 01:01 ===
* Id: B5CB165
* User: Bearcat
* Date: 2018-06-23 00:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|847110784|POL 847110784}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|851541564|POL 851541564}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this category be including individual people who are identified, by themselves or others, as "liberals"? The issue in this instance is that the selection of people so categorized here is incredibly random, partial and highly non-representative: the ''entirety'' of its selection of people consists of Barbara Boxer, Sheryl Crow, Whoopi Goldberg, Kamala Harris, Truc Ho, Hubert Humphrey, Cynthia Nixon, Walter Reuther, Susan Sarandon, Arthur Schlesinger Jr., Barbara Streisand and Elizabeth Warren. Namely, four prominent politicians, a political activist, a writer, five people who are politically irrelevant entertainment industry figures, and one entertainment figure who is technically also a political candidate but is not notable for that per se, but ''not'' the hundreds or thousands of other notable people (Biden? Clooney? Gillibrand? Franken? Obama? The Clintons?) who would also belong here if people were fair game. I distinctly recall that there ''was'' a past consensus against categorizing non-political figures by ideology, and restricting categorization even of political figures to their ''political party'' rather than trying to assign them to liberalism or conservatism in general — but I don't know if that's since been deprecated, or if some editors have just been ignoring it and need a tap on the nose. [[User:Bearcat|Bearcat]] ([[User talk:Bearcat|talk]]) 00:43, 23 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kombucha#rfc_C87088C|Talk:Kombucha]] expired 2018-07-23 16:01 ===
* Id: C87088C
* User: QuackGuru
* Date: 2018-06-15 16:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|850610400|SCI 850610400}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|851633091|SCI 851633091}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Old proposal: <s>"Its biological activities have not been demonstrated in humans for their purported health beneﬁts.</s><ref name=Villarreal-SotoBeaufort2018>{{cite journal|last1=Villarreal-Soto|first1=Silvia Alejandra|last2=Beaufort|first2=Sandra|last3=Bouajila|first3=Jalloul|last4=Souchard|first4=Jean-Pierre|last5=Taillandier|first5=Patricia|title=Understanding Kombucha Tea Fermentation: A Review|journal=Journal of Food Science|volume=83|issue=3|year=2018|pages=580–588|issn=00221147|doi=10.1111/1750-3841.14068|pmid=29508944}}</ref>"

New proposal: The purported health beneﬁts resulting from its biological activities have not been demonstrated in humans.<ref name=Villarreal-SotoBeaufort2018/>

{{reflist-talk}}

This is an alternative proposal to the "RfC on adding current research status". [[User:QuackGuru|<b style="color: #e34234;">QuackGuru</b>]] ([[User talk:QuackGuru|<span style="color: #B02200;">talk</span>]]) 16:41, 15 June 2018 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Kombucha#rfc_D62DA64|Talk:Kombucha]] expired 2018-07-23 16:01 ===
* Id: D62DA64
* User: WikiGJay
* Date: 2018-06-12 18:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|850230945|SCI 850230945}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|851633091|SCI 851633091}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The health claim studies overviewed in the Health Claims section are 15+ years old. The below content is from a 2018 peer-reviewed journal and brings the reader up to date with the current status of kombucha health claim studies. Why would we not add something like the below paragraph to the "Health claims" section?

See "Content deleted" and "Sourced content deleted" talk sections for full details.

A 2018 review stated, several ''[[in vitro]]'' studies have been done for kombucha which were in 1998, 2000, 2011, 2012, 2014, 2016, and 2017 as well as several researchers have done ''[[in vivo]]'' studies using rats from 2013 to 2015 for kombucha in the areas of diabetes, electromagnetic radiation, and liver and kidney toxicities due to diets high in cholesterol.<ref name=Villarreal-SotoBeaufort2018/> However, the results of biological activities have not been conﬁrmed for the purported health beneﬁts in humans.<ref name=Villarreal-SotoBeaufort2018>{{cite journal|last1=Villarreal-Soto|first1=Silvia Alejandra|last2=Beaufort|first2=Sandra|last3=Bouajila|first3=Jalloul|last4=Souchard|first4=Jean-Pierre|last5=Taillandier|first5=Patricia|title=Understanding Kombucha Tea Fermentation: A Review|journal=Journal of Food Science|volume=83|issue=3|year=2018|pages=580–588|issn=00221147|doi=10.1111/1750-3841.14068|pmid=29508944}}</ref>
[[User:WikiGJay|WikiGJay]] ([[User talk:WikiGJay|talk]]) 18:12, 12 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_C37E54C|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2018-07-23 17:01 ===
* Id: C37E54C
* User: Money emoji
* Date: 2018-07-03 17:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|851641508|PROP 851641508}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
While fighting off mass waves of ip/new account vandalism on articles related to the world cup and the NBA drafts, I thought about how it would be easier if I could protect the pages instantly, instead of having to go to [[WP:RPP]], one of the most notoriously backlogged pages on the site. I believe that trusted users should be able to request a user right that would let them '''Semi-protect pages for a finite amount of time (a few months, 6 maybe, at most)'''. This right would have to be requested for and granted, and can be removed like any other right. Having this would massively benefit those more active in anti-vandalism work (like me), and would overall decrease the amount of vandalism/spam on the site by a large amount. I know the primary concern will be weather or not this right will be abused if edit wars happen with unregistered/new accounts, but the request process for the right should be able to filter out those who would abuse it in that way.[[User:Money emoji |<span style="text-shadow:#396 0.2em 0.2em 0.5em; class=texhtml"><b style="color:#060">💵Money💵emoji💵</b></span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Money emoji|💸]]</sup> 17:09, 3 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Swiss sovereign money referendum, 2018#rfc_3ABE560|Talk:Swiss sovereign money referendum, 2018]] expired 2018-07-23 18:01 ===
* Id: 3ABE560
* User: The Gnome
* Date: 2018-06-23 17:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|847211947|ECON 847211947}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|847211949|POL 847211949}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|851649857|ECON 851649857}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|851649862|POL 851649862}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Greetings, all. The article contains the historical context of the June 2018 referendum in Switzerland about "sovereign money," context found in the two sections titled "Background" and "Origin and proposal." There are objections to the material being in the article based on various arguments, such as that it relies too much or even entirely on primary sources, it's irrelevant, it gives undue weight to fringe viewpoints, and perhaps includes original research. There are also objections on the basis of the unreliability of the sources used. On the other hand, there are those who support the inclusion of historical context, and focus the argument on the legitimacy of the sources used. 

Let's begin the process with the section titled "[[Swiss_sovereign_money_referendum,_2018#Background|Background]]". Evidently, the referendum was not born suddenly and out of nowhere; the notions behind it (opposition to [[Fractional-reserve banking|fractional banking]], etc) have been around for a very long time. For instance, there exists information currently in that section about
::The [[Austrian economics|Austrians]]' objections to fractional banking
::The 1933 [[Chicago plan]] to do away with fractional banking criticism of fractional banking
::The introduction in the US Congress of a [[NEED Act|bill]] that included the same measures proposed in the referendum  
::The 2015 report by a gov't-appointed committee in [[Iceland]] that recommended measures similar to the referendum's
::And the basic notions behind the Swiss proposal as put forward by its initiators and ideologues, using sources and direct citations from their work.

Should we '''keep''' or '''delete''' such content? -[[User:The Gnome|The Gnome]] ([[User talk:The Gnome|talk]]) 17:28, 23 June 2018 (UTC)}}

--[[user:Shrike|Shrike]] ([[User talk:Shrike|talk]]) 08:56, 24 June 2018 (UTC)}}

* User: Snooganssnoogans

Should the following text be added to the "Environment and energy" sub-section?:

* In a 2018 analysis, [[David Cutler]] and [[Francesca Dominici]] of [[Harvard University]] found that under the most conservative estimate, the Trump administration's rollbacks and proposed reversals of environmental rules would likely "cost the lives of over 80 000 US residents per decade and lead to respiratory problems for many more than 1 million people."<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Cutler|first=David|last2=Dominici|first2=Francesca|date=2018-06-12|title=A Breath of Bad Air: Cost of the Trump Environmental Agenda May Lead to 80 000 Extra Deaths per Decade|url=https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2684596|journal=JAMA|language=en|volume=319|issue=22|pages=2261|doi=10.1001/jama.2018.7351|issn=0098-7484}}</ref>

=== [[Talk:Indrajit#rfc_CA52F9C|Talk:Indrajit]] expired 2018-07-24 23:01 ===
* Id: CA52F9C
* User: 174.44.177.134
* Date: 2018-07-24 19:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|851816655|LANG 851816655}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|851838541|LANG 851838541}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The name should be changed to Indrajita as this is referring a Sanskritham character from the Ramayana & not the Hindi/Punjabi/etc. name derived into those languages & does not have [[schwa deletion]]. Perhaps a separate page which identifies it as a derivative of the original name can be created, but it is erroneous to represent a historically established character w/ a completely modern name.[[Special:Contributions/174.44.177.134|174.44.177.134]] ([[User talk:174.44.177.134|talk]]) 19:25, 24 July 2018 (UTC)}}

Should [[MOS:US]] ([[WP:Manual of Style#US and U.S.]]):
# Retain its '''current''' wording (after some reverting), arrived at several years ago, and stable until October 2017, and stable since then?
# Use the '''newest''' (recently reverted) version, implemented in [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Archive 196#Bold revision of "US and U.S." section|a lengthy October 2017 consensus discussion]]?
# Revert to its even '''earlier''' wording, which was stable though the early 2010s, despite [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search?search=U.S.+US&prefix=Wikipedia+talk%3AManual+of+Style%2F&fulltext=Search+archives&fulltext=Search&searchToken=dawhlt68loqcqiklig0mseqjd frequent debate]?
# Say something substantively different from any of these?

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_B7B28AE|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2018-07-28 16:01 ===
* Id: B7B28AE
* User: Headbomb
* Date: 2018-06-28 15:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|847906476|POLICY 847906476}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|852381240|POLICY 852381240}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is a follow up to [[User_talk:CitationCleanerBot#Via]]. According to {{User|Nikkimaria}} and {{User|Vanamonde93}}, they put citations like

*{{cite journal|last1=Esmonde|first1=Margaret P.|title=The Good Witch of the West|journal=Children's Literature|date=1981|volume=9|pages=185–190|url=http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/chl/summary/v009/9.esmonde.html|doi=10.1353/chl.0.0112|via=[[Project MUSE]]|subscription=yes}}
by the reasoning "It wasn't used to advertise the service; it was used to acknowledge the access provided by Project Muse to certain Wikipedia users." This is apparently to comply with partnership requirements where they have gained personal access to pay-for-access databases (in this case [[Project MUSE]]) through [[WP:TWL|The Wikipedia Library]], where in return they need to mention ''in our articles'' that they had made use of [[Project MUSE]].

Should the practice be allowed to continue? Or under which condition should {{para|via}} be used? <span style="font-variant:small-caps; whitespace:nowrap;">[[User:Headbomb|Headbomb]] {[[User talk:Headbomb|t]] · [[Special:Contributions/Headbomb|c]] · [[WP:PHYS|p]] · [[WP:WBOOKS|b]]}</span> 15:32, 28 June 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard/Edit warring#rfc_D446645|Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard/Edit warring]] expired 2018-07-28 19:01 ===
* Id: D446645
* Date: 2018-07-28 04:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|852395427|POLICY 852395427}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|852427118|POLICY 852427118}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
−	
::What is wikipedia current policy? power~enwiki? I am thinking of inclusiveness as one of them. Why shouldn't it be a current policy here? It is not consensus that should rule, that is too simplistic. Inclusiveness should also be considered for fuller coverage. It almost sounds like including third or independent parties as something that shouldn't happen? This, as an encyclopedia, should have all of the situation of the elections in Ohio. I have noticed some who have colluded to purposely deny ANY third party access on other Wiki pages. If you look you will find it. It is happening as we speak. To me it is deeply disturbing and should be to every wikipedian. bradv quoted me that wikipedia is not a democracy but I keep getting quoted info about polls as a basis for publishing. Democracy as in hearing people out is what's important. Publish the facts. So and so is running. Good! There are 5 candidates in Ohio. With only two pictures of them seems as though someone is playing favorites. Not a Democracy?, then no polls should be cited as an inclusive principle. Either way the poll argument is a fail, in that full information on THE candidates is not available. Dael4 (talk) 04:05, 28 July 2018 (UTC)}}

RiiConnect24 is still being worked on and now currently supports the News Channel, Weather Channel, Everybody Votes Channel and communication with the Wii's built in Mail. === [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons#rfc_E8AAD89|Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons]] expired 2018-07-30 09:01 ===
* Id: E8AAD89
* User: Coffeeandcrumbs
* Date: 2018-07-29 21:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|852573438|BIO 852573438}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|852573441|POLICY 852573441}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|852629224|BIO 852629224}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|852629225|POLICY 852629225}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [[WP:BLP]] and [[WP:CSD]] be changed in such a manner?
#Add a clause in [[WP:BLP]] deferring the AfD nominations for pages already older than 90 days for at least another 90 days after their deaths. This rule would only apply to pages that have remained in the main space for the aforementioned period, in effect establishing that editors have been accorded ample time to nominate the article before the person's death.
#Create a [[WP:CSD]] category for recently created pages on non-notable subjects that recently died. All other articles on ''possibly'' notable subjects can be moved to draft space and required to be fully realized before publication. Perhaps even require submission to [[WP:AFC]].

<s>This RfC was created here, because it is related to admin behaviour, involves at least two separate policies, and this is a highly trafficked discussion page.</s>---&nbsp;[[User talk:Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:#CC2200">Coffee</span>]]<nowiki/>and[[Special:Contributions/Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:#663366">crumbs</span>]] 21:26, 29 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Israel#rfc_CDD7C30|Talk:Israel]] expired 2018-07-31 12:01 ===
* Id: CDD7C30
* User: ששש.מ.ל
* Date: 2018-07-30 17:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|852687635|POL 852687635}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|852794155|POL 852794155}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Which one of the following statements shall be included in the lead?'''

1. "In its [[Basic Laws of Israel|Basic Laws]], Israel defines itself as a [[Jewish and democratic state]].<ref name=israelbasiclaws>{{Cite web|url=http://knesset.gov.il/description/eng/eng_mimshal_yesod.htm|title=Basic Laws|website=knesset.gov.il|access-date=2018-07-30}}</ref><ref name=freedomhouse2008>{{cite web |url=http://www.freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2008/israel |work=Freedom in the World |title=Israel |publisher=Freedom House |year=2008 |accessdate=20 March 2012}}</ref> Israel is a [[representative democracy]]<ref name=democracyindex2017>{{Cite web|url=http://pages.eiu.com/rs/753-riq-438/images/democracy_index_2017.pdf|title=Democracy Index 2017 — FULL REPORT by the Economist Intelligence Unit|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name=freedomintheworld2018>{{Cite web|url=https://freedomhouse.org/sites/default/files/FH_FITW_Report_2018_Final_SinglePage.pdf|title=Freedom in the World 2018 — FULL REPORT by the Freedom House|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name="Norton2001">{{cite book|author=Augustus Richard Norton|title=Civil society in the Middle East. 2 (2001)|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=k61qG1OlLl4C&pg=PA193|year=2001|publisher=BRILL|isbn=90-04-10469-0|page=193}}</ref> with a [[parliamentary system]], [[proportional representation]] and [[universal suffrage]].<ref name=rummel1997>{{Harvard citation no brackets|Rummel|1997|p=257}}. "A current list of liberal democracies includes: Andorra, Argentina, ..., Cyprus, ..., Israel, ..."</ref><ref name=freedomhouseglobalsurvey2006>{{cite web|url=http://www.freedomhouse.org/article/global-survey-2006-middle-east-progress-amid-global-gains-freedom |title=Global Survey 2006: Middle East Progress Amid Global Gains in Freedom |accessdate=20 March 2012 |date=19 December 2005 |publisher=Freedom House}}</ref>"

2. "In its [[Basic Laws of Israel|Basic Laws]], Israel defines itself as a [[Jewish and democratic state]].<ref name=israelbasiclaws>{{Cite web|url=http://knesset.gov.il/description/eng/eng_mimshal_yesod.htm|title=Basic Laws|website=knesset.gov.il|access-date=2018-07-30}}</ref><ref name=freedomhouse2008>{{cite web |url=http://www.freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2008/israel |work=Freedom in the World |title=Israel |publisher=Freedom House |year=2008 |accessdate=20 March 2012}}</ref> Israel is a [[representative democracy]]{{refn|group=fn|name=democracy|Israel is described as a "[[Political freedom|free country]]" and a "[[democracy]]" by non-governmental organizations including both [[Democracy Index]]<ref name=democracyindex2017>{{Cite web|url=http://pages.eiu.com/rs/753-riq-438/images/democracy_index_2017.pdf|title=Democracy Index 2017 — FULL REPORT by the Economist Intelligence Unit|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> and [[Freedom House]].<ref name=freedomintheworld2018>{{Cite web|url=https://freedomhouse.org/sites/default/files/FH_FITW_Report_2018_Final_SinglePage.pdf|title=Freedom in the World 2018 — FULL REPORT by the Freedom House|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> However, it has been described by Israeli scholars [[Gideon Doron]] as a "[[illiberal|non-liberal]] [[representative democracy]]",<ref name="Norton2001">{{cite book|author=Augustus Richard Norton|title=Civil society in the Middle East. 2 (2001)|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=k61qG1OlLl4C&pg=PA193|year=2001|publisher=BRILL|isbn=90-04-10469-0|page=193}}</ref> and [[Sammy Smooha]] as an "[[ethnic democracy]]", while [[As'ad Ghanem]], [[Nadim Rouhana]], and [[Oren Yiftachel]] have described it as an "[[ethnocracy]]".<ref name=alandowty1999>{{cite journal|title=Is Israel Democratic? Substance and Semantics in the "Ethnic Democracy" Debate|authorlink=Alan Dowty|first=Alan|last=Dowty|journal=Israel Studies|volume=4|issue=2|date=1999|pp=1-15|publisher=Indiana University Press|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/30245508|quote=Sammy Smooha classifies Israel in the historically-rare category of "ethnic democracy"; As'ad Ghanem, Nadim Rouhana, and Oren Yiftachel challenge the "democracy" component of that taxonomy and suggest instead the label of "ethnocracy," a somewhat less rare but still infrequent species; Ruth Gavison argues for moving the debate into explicit rather than submerged normative terms, and concludes that there is no necessary conceptual inconsistency between a state being Jewish and its being a democracy. All, however, describe the actual situation of non-Jews in Israel, in law and in practice, in similar terms. In Smooha's words, "minorities are treated as second-class citizens, feared as a threat, excluded from the national power structure, and placed under some control," while "at the same time [they] are allowed to conduct a democratic and peaceful struggle that yields incremental improvement in their status".}}</ref>}} with a [[parliamentary system]], [[proportional representation]] and [[universal suffrage]].<ref name=rummel1997>{{Harvard citation no brackets|Rummel|1997|p=257}}. "A current list of liberal democracies includes: Andorra, Argentina, ..., Cyprus, ..., Israel, ..."</ref><ref name=freedomhouseglobalsurvey2006>{{cite web|url=http://www.freedomhouse.org/article/global-survey-2006-middle-east-progress-amid-global-gains-freedom |title=Global Survey 2006: Middle East Progress Amid Global Gains in Freedom |accessdate=20 March 2012 |date=19 December 2005 |publisher=Freedom House}}</ref>"

{{reflist|group=fn}}
<references />

[[User:ששש.מ.ל|ששש.מ.ל]] ([[User talk:ששש.מ.ל|talk]]) 17:45, 30 July 2018 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
A [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Natalie_Portman/Archive_3#%22Israeli-born_American_(with_dual_citizenship)_actress%22 discussion in 2015] had a couple of editors agreeing that the opening sentence of the article should be, {{tq|"Natalie Portman [...] is an actress, film producer and director with dual Israeli and American citizenship."}} My preferred version would simply state {{tq|"Natalie Portman [...] is an Israeli-American actress, film producer and director."}} I'm no expert in this matter and would like to have a vote about which version is most appropriate. === [[Talk:Mumbai#rfc_CB01D1F|Talk:Mumbai]] expired 2018-08-01 04:01 ===
* Id: CB01D1F
* User: Cunard

{{rfcquote|text=
Two sources state that Kolis (the first people in Mumbai) originated and migrated from Gujarat.<ref name=munshi1>{{cite book|url=https://archive.org/stream/in.ernet.dli.2015.97812/2015.97812.Gujarat-And-Its-Literature-1852#page/n31/mode/2up/search/Kolis|quote=The next immigrants into the islands of Bombay were the Kolis, who on all authorities continued to be their original inhabitants till Aungier founded the city of Bombay. Kathiawad and Central Gujarāt was the home of the Kolis in pre-historic times.|title=Gujarāt and its literature, from early times to 1852|first=Kanaiyalal M.|last=Munshi|publisher=[[Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan Educational Trust|Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan]]|page=xix|year=1954}}</ref><ref name=hbdmd>{{cite journal|title=History of Bombay, 1661-1708|first1=M. D.|last1=David|quote=The kolis who suceeded the stone-age men on the island brought with them from Gujarat their patron goddess Mummai whom their descendants still worship in Kathiawar. The name of Bombay is derived from this koli goddess.|publisher=University of Bombay|year=1973}}</ref> One of these sources also mentions that the name Mumbai is derived from the Koli goddess Mummai who also originated in Gujarat.<ref name=hbdmd></ref> Should we add this information to the article? <small>RfC relisted by [[User:Cunard|Cunard]] ([[User talk:Cunard|talk]]) at 01:41, 14 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject UK Railways#rfc_4ED15EE|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject UK Railways]] expired 2018-08-02 13:01 ===
* Id: 4ED15EE
* User: Mjroots
* Date: 2018-07-08 19:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|849408552|HIST 849408552}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|849408555|SCI 849408555}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|849408563|STYLE 849408563}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|849408565|POLICY 849408565}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|853103064|HIST 853103064}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|853103065|SCI 853103065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|853103067|STYLE 853103067}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|853103068|POLICY 853103068}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The issue of the use of [[chain (unit)|chains]] has again reared its head. It is now time to put this to bed by having a discussion and reaching consensus on the use of chains in railway articles.

;Articles likely affected:
Articles on railway stations and railway lines in the British Isles.

;Articles possibly affected
Artcles on railway stations and railway lines where the British had strong influence in their construction. Basically the British Empire and other areas, such as Argentina.

;The dispute
Some editors claim that the use of chains should be deprecated as they are a generally archaic measurement. Other editors claim that the use of chains is appropriate as long as external sources use chains, and that chains are a unit of measurement still used by the modern railway in the United Kingdom today.

;Previous discussions
*[[Talk:Darlington railway station#Distance from London]] (January 2018)
*[[Talk:East Croydon station#Chains]] (July 2018)

;Policies affecting this dispute
*[[WP:V]]

;Guidelines affecting this dispute
*[[WP:MOSUNIT]]
*[[WP:JARGON]]

;Enforcement proceedures affecting this dispute
*[[WP:GS/UKU]]

I therefore submit the following two proposals for adoption. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 19:29, 8 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:No original research#rfc_3B832B4|Wikipedia talk:No original research]] expired 2018-08-03 16:01 ===
* Id: 3B832B4
* User: Erictheenquirer
* Date: 2018-07-04 15:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|848825358|HIST 848825358}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|848825360|POL 848825360}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|853275182|HIST 853275182}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|853275183|POL 853275183}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[Please excuse the length ... the topic is complicated] This post concerns the lede sentence:

"To demonstrate that you are not adding OR, you must be able to cite reliable, published sources that are directly related to the topic of the article, and directly support the material being presented."

It arose in Gaza beach explosion (2006) - Talk - section "3. Article Improvement Discussions", with discussions regarding the addressing of events in Gaza prior to beach explosions which all but wiped out an extended Palestinian family and sent shockwaves through the media. As with many of the Israel-Palestine conflicts (perhaps even 'all') the climax event, from which the name of the article is usually derived, hardly ever occurs randomly out of the blue with no prior build-up. Israel does not invade Gaza without militants from the Strip first having fired rockets at the southern Negev. Militants rarely do that out of pure spite, but because Israel has done something to prejudice their lives, like the assassination of a senior official, a crippling blockade, the killing of civilians near the border zone, etc. And those in turn have their antecedents also; the murder of teenagers, etc. This is not a new issue, and one related question goes - "How far back does one go? To the apple in the garden?" A few years ago KingsIndian (talk · contribs), fully aware of this issue, made what was accepted at the time as a very reasonable suggestion. Why not go back to a level playing field when all parties agreed to a cessation of hostilities, or to some informal but significant period of mutual calm - what I think he called a "blank slate". In that way we can avoid having an article "XXX event" and a separate article "Origin of the XXX Event" by including the prequel development of tensions between a cessation of hostilities (e.g. as a result of the ceasefire/truce) and the next bellicose flurry.

The above applies to less than epic "events". The prelude to the Six Day War for instance, would be as long as the rest of the article, which would be cumbersome. A brief flurry of a few days or even weeks might warrant having the prelude included in the main article. [I have no idea how one reasonably chooses how to make that split - a future topic]

So to get to the essence: Many events in the prelude of, say, the Gaza War (2008–09), have sources which never contemplated the future climactic war - Operation Cast Lead (OCL). The source on Arafat's death, that for the details of the understanding of the June 2008 ceasefire terms; the breaking of the ceasefire on 4 November 2008; the subsequent hail of rockets on Israel, many of the authors of the provided sources had no idea that OCL was soon to take place. To apply the WP:OR policy that sources must be directly related to the topic (the 2008/09 war - OCL) therefore usually requires some degree of subjective interpretation ... dangerous!! Yet a sequence of reliable sources may show that one individual event triggered the next. HOWEVER, there are VERY few quality sources that stitch all of these events together, and even more rarely, do so in Wiki-acceptable detail. Alternatively there are almost no sources that deny causal chains. Instead, one may appeal to "the sky is blue" principle that if A led to B, and B led to C, then A and C are part of the same sequence or chain. Sadly this process is usually interrupted by lengthy edit wars.

My proposal is that in the seemingly never-ending series of bellicose events, the preludes - the history of tension building - is encylopedically relevant to the climactic straw, and should be welcomed. But were sources to be disallowed that did not directly link the individual events in the chain to the breaking of the camel's back, (according to the Wiki condition quoted at the start), then this valuable chain of causative information would be excluded from Wiki. I am too much of a n000b to dredge Wiki protocol for a solution, so I look to more experienced peers. Maybe the solution is as simple as changing the article name from "Gaza beach explosion (2006)" to "Gaza beach explosion (2006) and its origin". [[User:Erictheenquirer|Erictheenquirer]] ([[User talk:Erictheenquirer|talk]]) 15:19, 4 July 2018 (UTC)}}

#Include support for these categories in the article prose and cite sources for them.

*[[:Category:Persecution of Eastern Orthodox Christians]] - no mention of "Orthodox"
*[[:Category:Anti-Armenianism]] - no mention of "Armenia"
*[[:Category:Anti-Ukrainian sentiment]] - mentions that he invaded there, and "sentiment" could easily be described/sourced, but this should actually be [[:Category:Anti-Ukrainian sentiment in Europe]].
*[[:Category:Anti-Catholicism]] - no indication of hatred for the Church.
*[[:Category:Anti-Masonry]] - no mention of "Mason" etc.
*[[:Category:Anti-Americanism]]

=== [[Talk:Khalistan movement#rfc_5C4DAE6|Talk:Khalistan movement]] expired 2018-08-06 11:01 ===
* Id: 5C4DAE6
* User: DBigXray
* Date: 2018-07-07 10:46:00
