=== [[Talk:Israel#rfc_0073271|Talk:Israel]] expired 2018-08-08 08:01 ===
* Id: 0073271
* User: Duoble 07
* Date: 2018-08-07 21:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|853934138|POL 853934138}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|853996969|POL 853996969}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Final discussion for the points made about the last 4 options.

I've also added a fifth option, which includes [[Encyclopedia Britannica]] as source for the phrase "multi-party", a short & concise summary of the findings of [[Democracy Index]] and [[Freedom House]], as well as a sentence and footnote for [[User:Onceinawhile|Onceinawhile]]'s full summaries, of a number of scholars' opinions.

'''Option 5:'''
"In its [[Basic Laws of Israel|Basic Laws]], Israel defines itself as a [[Jewish and democratic state]].<ref name=israelbasiclaws>{{Cite web|url=http://knesset.gov.il/description/eng/eng_mimshal_yesod.htm|title=Basic Laws|website=knesset.gov.il|access-date=2018-07-30}}</ref><ref name=freedomhouse2008>{{cite web |url=http://www.freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2008/israel |work=Freedom in the World |title=Israel |publisher=Freedom House |year=2008 |accessdate=20 March 2012}}</ref> Israel is a [[Multi-party system|multi-party]] [[parliamentary republic]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.britannica.com/place/Israel/Government|title=Israel - Government|work=Encyclopedia Britannica|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}}</ref> with [[proportional representation]] and [[universal suffrage]].<ref name=rummel1997>{{Harvard citation no brackets|Rummel|1997|p=257}}. "A current list of liberal democracies includes: Andorra, Argentina, ..., Cyprus, ..., Israel, ..."</ref><ref name=freedomhouseglobalsurvey2006>{{cite web|url=http://www.freedomhouse.org/article/global-survey-2006-middle-east-progress-amid-global-gains-freedom |title=Global Survey 2006: Middle East Progress Amid Global Gains in Freedom |accessdate=20 March 2012 |date=19 December 2005 |publisher=Freedom House}}</ref> Both [[Democracy Index]] and [[Freedom House]] describe Israel as a "[[Political freedom|free country]]" and a "[[democracy]]", ranking it among the world's top countries in the areas of [[political rights]] and [[freedom of speech]], but criticize the record of some of its other [[civil liberties]].<ref name=democracyindex2017>Israel ranks within the top 30 in the world out of 167 countries. {{Cite web|url=http://pages.eiu.com/rs/753-riq-438/images/democracy_index_2017.pdf|title=Democracy Index 2017 — FULL REPORT by the Economist Intelligence Unit|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name=freedomintheworld2018>Israel ranks the [https://freedomhouse.org/country/israel aggregate score of 79 points] out of 100. {{Cite web|url=https://freedomhouse.org/sites/default/files/FH_FITW_Report_2018_Final_SinglePage.pdf|title=Freedom in the World 2018 — FULL REPORT by the Freedom House|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Some scholars also use different descriptions for Israel's [[List of forms of government|form of government]].{{refn|group=fn|name=democracy|*{{cite book|author=Augustus Richard Norton|title=Civil society in the Middle East. 2 (2001)|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=k61qG1OlLl4C&pg=PA193|year=2001|publisher=BRILL|isbn=90-04-10469-0|page=193|quote=Israel has been described by Israeli scholar [[Gideon Doron]] as a "[[illiberal|non-liberal]] [[representative democracy]]".}}<br>*{{cite journal|title=Is Israel Democratic? Substance and Semantics in the "Ethnic Democracy" Debate|authorlink=Alan Dowty|first=Alan|last=Dowty|journal=Israel Studies|volume=4|issue=2|date=1999|pp=1-15|publisher=Indiana University Press|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/30245508|quote=Israeli scholars [[Sammy Smooha]] classifies Israel in the historically-rare category of "ethnic democracy"; and [[As'ad Ghanem]], [[Nadim Rouhana]], and [[Oren Yiftachel]] challenge the "democracy" component of that taxonomy and suggest instead the label of "ethnocracy," a somewhat less rare but still infrequent species; [[Ruth Gavison]] argues for moving the debate into explicit rather than submerged normative terms, and concludes that there is no necessary conceptual inconsistency between a state being Jewish and its being a democracy. All, however, describe the actual situation of non-Jews in Israel, in law and in practice, in similar terms. In Smooha's words, "minorities are treated as second-class citizens, feared as a threat, excluded from the national power structure, and placed under some control," while "at the same time [they] are allowed to conduct a democratic and peaceful struggle that yields incremental improvement in their status"}}<br>*{{cite journal|title=Ethnic Democracy Revisited: On the State of Democracy in the Jewish State|authors=Yoav Peled and Doron Navot|journal=Israel Studies Forum|volume=20|issue=1|date= 2005|pp=3-27|publisher=Berghahn Books|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/41805192|quote=Abstract: The current state of the debate over Israeli democracy and the state of Israeli democracy itself are analyzed through the citizenship status of Israel's Palestinian citizens. The two main theoretical models featured in this debate - Smooha's "ethnic democracy" and Yiftachel's "ethnocracy" - are discussed, focusing on the 'framework decisions' that inform their arguments. After demonstrating that the question of Israeli democracy should be viewed dynamically and historically, it will be clear that the Israeli state has been evolving from non-democratic ethnocracy, though ethnic democracy, toward non-democratic majoritarianism.}}<br>*{{cite book|last=Peled|first=Yoav|title=The Challenge of Ethnic Democracy: The State and Minority Groups in Israel, Poland and Northern Ireland|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=AfEhAQAAQBAJ&pg=PA180|date=1 October 2013|publisher=Routledge|isbn=978-1-134-44893-7|quote=As it has unfolded up to this point, then, the debate over whether Israel should be characterized as an ethnic democracy or an ethnocracy has been largely semantic, because it turned mostly on definitional issues: whether "democracy" should be defined thinly or thickly, and whether "Israel" itself should be defined broadly or narrowly.}}<br>*{{cite book|editor=Jeenah Na'eem|first=Ran|last=Greenstein|chapter=Israel as an Ethnic State|title=Pretending Democracy: Israel, and Ethnocratic State|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_1JjDwAAQBAJ&pg=PA88|date=14 June 2018|p=88|publisher=Afro-Middle East Centre|isbn=978-0-620-54042-1|quote=The debate over the meaning of Israel as an ethnic state, an ethnocracy as its critics call it, or an 'ethnic democracy' as it is referred to by some of its supporters, continues. An editorial in the December 2009 edition of Mada al-Carmel's journal addressed these debates by expressing regret over the global spread of the 'political discourse of two states for two peoples - a Palestinian state and a Jewish state'. In their view, 'the ethnic state is a recipe for continued injustice and for resistance to it, and thus for the continuation of the conflict. It is the democratic state that will guarantee equality among all citizens'. Whether the democratic state would be merely 'a state of all its citizens', or a state which recognises that its citizens are divided into ethnic groups, to be represented as collectives and not only individually, is an ongoing question."}}<br>*{{cite book|last=Peled-Elhanan|first=Nurit|title=Palestine in Israeli School Books: Ideology and Propaganda in Education|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=TAv4AgAAQBAJ&pg=PT9|date=1 October 2013|publisher=I.B.Tauris|isbn=978-0-85773-069-5|quote=In spite of Israel's success to advertise its regime as a Democracy, it is often defined by researchers as either an 'Ethnocracy' or as an 'ethnic Democracy.' This is because ethnicity and not citizenship is the main determinant for the allocation of rights, power and resources in Israel. Jews who are citizens of other countries and Jewish settlers who live beyond the official border of the state have full citizenship rights while Arab citizens inside the state's borders don't, and Palestinians from the occupied West Bank are listed 'state-less.'}}<br>*{{cite book|last=Koensler|first=Alexander|title=Israeli-Palestinian Activism: Shifting Paradigms|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=S2jVBgAAQBAJ&pg=PA34|date=28 March 2015|publisher=Ashgate Publishing, Ltd.|isbn=978-1-4724-3947-5|page=34}}}}"
{{reflist|group=fn}}
<references />

[[User:Duoble 07|Duoble 07]] ([[User talk:Duoble 07|talk]]) 21:05, 7 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Donald Trump#rfc_076823A|Talk:Donald Trump]] expired 2018-08-08 12:01 ===
* Id: 076823A
* Date: 2018-07-15 18:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|850410930|BIO 850410930}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|850410935|HIST 850410935}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|850410938|POL 850410938}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|854919106|BIO 854919106}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|854919107|HIST 854919107}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|854919114|POL 854919114}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the second paragraph of the lead include a sentence summarizing Trump's history of racially charged comments and racially motivated actions?

Specifically, something like: 

{{tq2|Many of his comments and actions have been perceived by some as racially charged.}}

{{cot|Sources}}
{{tq2|"If it were a one-time comment, an inadvertent insensitivity, it would still have stirred a firestorm. But Mr. Trump has said so many things on so many occasions that have rubbed the raw edges of race in America that they have raised the larger issue. "|source=''[https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/12/us/politics/trump-racism.html The New York Times]''}}
{{tq2|"The president’s approach to race has by many accounts damaged America’s standing in the world and complicated his foreign policy."|source=''[https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/12/us/politics/trump-racism.html The New York Times]''}}
{{tq2|"Mr. Trump’s history of racially inflammatory episodes traces back to his first days in the public eye. "|source=''[https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/12/us/politics/trump-racism.html The New York Times]''}}
{{tq2|"As he became more of a public figure, Mr. Trump waded into racially charged controversies that periodically erupted in New York. "|source=''[https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/12/us/politics/trump-racism.html The New York Times]''}}
{{tq2|"Trump has a long record as a provocateur on matters of race and ethnicity."|source=''[http://fortune.com/2016/06/07/donald-trump-racism-quotes/ Fortune]''}}
{{tq2|"You don’t even have to look into Trump’s heart to see his racism. You only have to look at all the things he’s done and said over the years – from the early Seventies, when he settled with the Justice Department over accusations of housing discrimination, to Monday, when just hours after his speech news broke he is considering pardoning anti-immigrant sheriff Joe Arpaio."|source=''[https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-features/trumps-long-history-of-racism-201446/ Rolling Stone]''}}
{{tq2|"He has built a legacy of race-baiting throughout his career – from his apartment buildings in the outer boroughs right into the White House."|source=''[https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-features/trumps-long-history-of-racism-201446/ Rolling Stone]''}}
{{tq2|"President Donald Trump’s long history with race is complicated."|source=''[https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/every-moment-donald-trumps-long-complicated-history-race PBS]''}}
{{tq2|"While Trump’s actions have landed on both sides of racial currents, his public record depicts a man who most often moves in one direction: overlooking racial sensitivity and concerns in the name of fighting “political correctness.”"|source=''[https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/every-moment-donald-trumps-long-complicated-history-race PBS]''}}
{{tq2|"Most Americans think President Trump is a racist, according to a new poll by the Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research."|source=''[https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/politics/wp/2018/03/01/ap-norc-poll-most-americans-say-trump-is-racist/?noredirect=on The Washington Post]''}}
{{tq2|"From the moment he launched his candidacy by attacking Mexican immigrants as criminals, President Trump has returned time and again to language that is racially charged and, to many, insensitive and highly offensive."|source=''[http://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-trump-racism-remarks-20180111-htmlstory.html Los Angeles Times]''}}
{{tq2|"Trump, who is desperate to distract his base from his myriad failures of policy, from health care to immigration, is perfectly capable of devising his racist rhetoric all on his own."|source=''[https://www.newyorker.com/news/daily-comment/the-racial-demagoguery-of-trumps-assaults-on-colin-kaepernick-and-steph-curry The New Yorker]''}}
{{tq2|"Trump, rather than seeking to end the controversy, worked at length to fan it. Even after Obama released his “long-form” birth certificate, meanwhile, Trump continued to spread birther innuendo. The statement is at once a welcome recognition and also obviously too little, too late, after Trump spent five years fanning the racist conspiracy theory."|source=''[https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2016/09/trump-birther/500327/ The Atlantic]''}}
{{tq2|"World leaders, leading newspapers, and celebrities have used unprecedented language to describe a possible future president: "Racist", "repellent", "ignorant"."|source=''[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-35050186 BBC]''}}
{{cob}}

Please indicate whether you support or oppose this wording (or very similar) being added to the lead. '''''If you wish to propose different wording, please start a separate RfC.''''' Thank you.- [[user:MrX|Mr]][[user talk:MrX|X]] 🖋 18:00, 15 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_E284487|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2018-08-09 15:01 ===
* Id: E284487
* User: Prefall
* Date: 2018-07-10 14:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|849670127|BIO 849670127}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|849670130|SOC 849670130}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|854187560|BIO 854187560}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|854187564|SOC 854187564}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The "In wrestling" section has been a standard part of professional wrestling biographies for over a decade. It covers mostly character information in a bulleted list format. On May 24, 2018, an editor raised an issue with the section's vague heading to [[WP:PW|WikiProject Professional wrestling]] (see [[WT:PW#In wrestling]]). The next day, renaming the heading to "Professional wrestling highlights" and adjusting "Championships and accomplishments" into a subsection beneath it was proposed. On June 3, it was considered to have reached consensus after the 5 participants agreed unanimously. In the weeks that followed, a few editors disapproved of the new heading, as well as "Championships and accomplishments" being turned into a subsection. On June 24, clarification of which heading to go forward with was requested, where an additional option to remove the section entirely was proposed. On June 28, the discussion was closed after 10 editors participated, with an "overwhelming consensus" to remove the section but rework any content deemed significant into prose, potentially into a "Professional wrestling persona" section (see [[WT:PW#Trying to gain clarity (closed)]]). The changes were immediately enacted into hundreds of articles, causing news of the changes to be spread onto online professional wrestling communities. Many new editors voiced frustration over the removal, with some reverting the changes.

Below is the style recommendations for this section, taken from WikiProject Professional wrestling [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:WikiProject_Professional_wrestling/Style_guide&oldid=847654515 prior to its removal]:
{{Collapse top|"In wrestling" recommendations per WP:PW/SG}}
An overview of notable character information is compiled in a [[WP:BULLET|bulleted list format]]. This initial section should be limited to '''finishing moves''', '''signature moves''', '''managers''' (and/or '''wrestlers managed'''), '''nicknames''', '''entrance themes''', and '''wrestlers trained'''. Any taunts, gestures, or other descriptions are better suited for the article prose.

{{Collapse top|Example of highlights list}}
* '''Finishing moves'''
** [[Moonsault]]
** ''Western Lariat'' ([[Professional wrestling attacks#Lariat|Lariat]])
* '''Signature moves'''
** [[Dropkick]], sometimes from the [[Missile dropkick|top rope]]
** Multiple [[suplex]] variations
*** [[Suplex#Belly-to-belly suplex|Belly-to-belly]]
*** [[Suplex#Nortern Lights suplex|Northern Lights]]
*** [[Suplex#Tiger suplex|Tiger]]
** ''Orange Crush'' ([[Powerbomb#Vertical suplex powerbomb|Vertical suplex powerbomb]])
** [[Shining wizard]]
* '''[[Manager (professional wrestling)|Managers]]'''
** [[Miss Elizabeth]]
** [[Paul Heyman]]
* '''Nicknames'''
** "Best in the World"
** "The Legend Killer"
* '''[[Music in professional wrestling|Entrance themes]]'''
** "[[Cult of Personality (song)|Cult of Personality]]" by [[Living Colour]]
** "Here to Show the World" by [[Jim Johnston (composer)|Jim Johnston]] featuring Downstait
* '''Wrestlers trained'''
{{Div col|3}}
:*[[Bret Hart]]
:*[[Brian Pillman]]
:*[[Chris Jericho]]
:*[[Christian Cage|Christian]]
:*[[Davey Boy Smith]]
*[[Edge (wrestler)|Edge]]
*[[Jake Roberts]]
*[[Jim Neidhart]]
*[[Lance Storm]]
*[[Mark Henry]]
*[[Natalya Neidhart]]
*[[Owen Hart]]
*[[Roddy Piper]]
*[[Steve Blackman]]
*[[Tyson Kidd]]
{{Div col end}}
{{Collapse bottom}}

* All items should be sorted alphabetically. An exception is with entrance themes, which can be sorted chronologically if date ranges are sourced.
* For signature and finishing moves, there must be one reliable source explicitly mentioning that it is a signature move of the wrestler. One reliable source merely mentioning that the wrestler ''performed'' the move is not enough.
* A specially named move should be italicized, with the regular name following in parentheses and wiki-linked.
* {{tl|Cite episode}} should not be used for citing moves as commentators often call moves wrong or do not give full technical names, leading to speculation.
* Track names in entrance themes should not be wiki-linked to articles about the compilation albums on which they are sold, unless the article contains further information on the track itself (not just name, number, and wrestler who used it).
{{Collapse bottom}}

This proposal seeks to remove the "In wrestling" section, with the possibility of any of its content that is deemed significant to be contextualized in prose. Much of the information contained within this section would be lost. The content most likely to be reworked is certain Finishing moves, Nicknames and Wrestlers trained. As it stands, Managers are already expected to be covered in prose, primarily in the "Professional wrestling career" section. If necessary, reworked content can be placed within the existing "Professional wrestling persona" section (see [[WP:PW/SG#Professional wrestling persona]]).

Below are diffs from various articles, showing before the section's removal, after the removal, and some with content reworked to prose:
* [[Daniel Bryan]] — [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Daniel_Bryan&oldid=847871529 Before] / [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Daniel_Bryan&type=revision&diff=847989656&oldid=847871529 After] / [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Daniel_Bryan&type=revision&diff=848724996&oldid=848298307 Reworked content]
* [[Máscara Dorada]] — [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=M%C3%A1scara_Dorada&oldid=846913387 Before] / [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=M%C3%A1scara_Dorada&type=revision&diff=848000070&oldid=846913387 After] / [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=M%C3%A1scara_Dorada&type=revision&diff=848731744&oldid=848000070 Reworked content]
* [[A.J. Styles]] — [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=A.J._Styles&oldid=847965684 Before] / [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=A.J._Styles&type=revision&diff=847992219&oldid=847965684 After]

'''Proposal:''' Should we adopt a default approach of omitting the bulleted list "In wrestling" section, in favor of its notable content being contextualized in prose when appropriate? [[User:Prefall|<span style="color: #990000">Pre</span>]]'''[[User talk:Prefall|<span style="color: #990000">fall</span>]]''' 14:53, 10 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sean Hannity#rfc_8234A67|Talk:Sean Hannity]] expired 2018-08-10 06:01 ===
* Id: 8234A67
* User: Markbassett
* Date: 2018-07-11 05:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|849766315|POL 849766315}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|854282817|POL 854282817}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the section Immigration be removed from this BLP ?

The section was criticized as trivial in amount or portion of his positions, and just not biographically significant. 
It was a single line: Hannity opposed amnesty, then he favored a "path to citizenship" before he opposed that idea.[7] 

Since then the line has been been stated a bit more verbosely, and then another remark added: Hannity opposed amnesty, then he said in 2012 that he had evolved on the issue and favored a "pathway to citizenship".[118][7] Later, he opposed that idea.[7] By 2018, he was described as an "immigration hardliner".[119][120][121] 

Please indicate whether to '''Delete''' or '''Keep''' this as a section of the article, along with your reasoning.   Cheers [[User:Markbassett|Markbassett]] ([[User talk:Markbassett|talk]]) 05:49, 11 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Tree of Life#rfc_8D0965A|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Tree of Life]] expired 2018-08-10 15:01 ===
* Id: 8D0965A
* User: NessieVL
* Date: 2018-07-11 14:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|849890535|SCI 849890535}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|854331164|SCI 854331164}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is continuing discussions elsewhere, such as [[Wikipedia talk:Automated taxobox system#Reverting to 'manual' Taxoboxes]].  Sorry if I'm not posting this correctly, I just want to get this discussion started.

It seems there has not been a good clear discussion in the ToL and its related projects on the adoption of [[Wikipedia:Automated taxobox system]] over 'manual' taxoboxes like {{tl|taxobox}}.  Not all taxa can be converted to automatic (there isn't an automatic version of {{tl|Paraphyletic group}}, for example, and viruses need a new box too).  However, the overwhelming majority can use the automated taxobox system.

Should we officially adopt the automated taxobox system as the standard over the previous manual taxobox system? --[[User:NessieVL|Nessie]] ([[User talk:NessieVL|talk]]) 14:18, 11 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Viruses#rfc_74BE210|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Viruses]] expired 2018-08-12 15:01 ===
* Id: 74BE210
* User: NessieVL
* Date: 2018-07-13 15:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|850091428|SCI 850091428}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|850647526|TECH 850647526}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|854604762|SCI 854604762}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|854604766|TECH 854604766}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As {{ping|Peter coxhead}} noted [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Viruses#Automated taxobox system and viruses|above]], we need more voices here.  

Viruses are sadly not compatible with the automated taxobox system involving {{tl|Automatic taxobox}}, {{tl|Speciesbox}}, and so forth.  In addition, the old 'manual' system involves taxonomy predating the current [[International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses|ICTV]] system, especially with regards to formatting (italics, etc.).  The taxonomy template hierarchy is compatible with viruses and other non-cellular life.  

# Should effort be made to create a virusbox template compatible with the automated taxobox system?
# What should the specifications of the new template be, if made?
# Should [[viroid]]s, [[prion]]s, [[Satellite (biology)|satellites]] and other virus-dependent nucleic acids be included in the same template, as they are [https://talk.ictvonline.org/ictv-reports/ictv_9th_report/sub-viral-agents-2011/w/sub_viruses addressed by ICTV], even if [https://talk.ictvonline.org/ictv-reports/ictv_9th_report/sub-viral-agents-2011/w/sub_viruses/165/1-fungal-prions the formal taxonomy of viruses does not extend to unconventional agents like prions and prion “species” are not included in the ICTV Master Species List]?

Thank you for your polite consideration. --[[User:NessieVL|Nessie]] ([[User talk:NessieVL|talk]]) 15:00, 13 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of military occupations#rfc_95F764B|Talk:List of military occupations]] expired 2018-08-13 03:01 ===
* Id: 95F764B
* User: Serialjoepsycho
* Date: 2018-07-14 02:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|850168572|HIST 850168572}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|850168576|POL 850168576}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|850168577|SOC 850168577}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|854686074|HIST 854686074}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|854686078|POL 854686078}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|854686082|SOC 854686082}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The lead says, "Military occupation is distinguished from annexation by its intended temporary nature (i.e. no claim for permanent sovereignty), by its military nature, and by citizenship rights of the controlling power not being conferred upon the subjugated population." East Jerusalem was annexed by Israel. Available sources on the subject show that the majority of all international bodies and the majority of all international actors view this annexation as Illegal and further view that East Jerusalem is under Military occupation. For the sake of consistency with the Lead do we remove the listing for East Jerusalem?

Israel disengaged from the land of Gaza in 2005. Israel no long views Gaza being under Military occupation them. Their control of the borders, sea, and air of Gaza the sources show is the reason the international community views Gaza to still be under Military occupation. The Sources show that the majority of all international actors and the majority of all international bodies consider Gaza to still be under Military occupation. For the sake of consistency with the lead do we remove Gaza?[[User:Serialjoepsycho|-Serialjoepsycho-]] ([[User talk:Serialjoepsycho|talk]]) 02:56, 14 July 2018 (UTC)}}

* A self-described democratic socialist and a New Deal-era American progressive, Sanders is pro-labor and emphasizes reversing economic inequality. '''Some political observers consider his views more in line with social democracy.'''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2016/03/bernie-sanders-democratic-socialism/471630/|title=Bernie Is Not a Socialist and America Is Not Capitalist|last=Tupy|first=Marian|access-date=June 24, 2016}}</ref><ref name="Chomsky2">{{cite interview|last=Chomsky|first=Noam|subject-link=Noam Chomsky|interviewer=[[Mehdi Hasan]]|title=Noam Chomsky on Clinton vs Sanders|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=btJfkPBLULg|work=UpFront|publisher=[[Al Jazeera]] English|location=Boston, MA|date=January 29, 2016|quote=He's basically a New Dealer. Now, in the current American political spectrum, to be a New Dealer is to be way out on the left. [[Eisenhower]], for example, who said anyone who questions the New Deal doesn't belong in the political system, would be regarded as a raving leftist. So Bernie Sanders is a decent, honest New Dealer. I agree with him on a lot of things, not on other things. I think in our system of mainly bought elections he doesn't have much of a chance, but if he were elected, I think that, of the current candidates, I think he'd be the one who would have, from my point of view, the best policies.|access-date=March 17, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/121680/bernie-sanders-democratic-socialist-not-just-socialist|title=Stop Calling Bernie Sanders a Socialist|work=The New Republic|access-date=2018-06-04|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://theweek.com/articles/726093/bernie-sanders-rise-american-social-democracy|title=Bernie Sanders and the rise of American social democracy|date=2018-01-10|access-date=2018-06-04}}</ref>

=== [[Talk:Mike Chang (fitness trainer)#rfc_49617A8|Talk:Mike Chang (fitness trainer)]] expired 2018-08-14 05:01 ===
* Id: 49617A8
* User: Zingarese#top
* Date: 2018-08-06 23:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|853786105|BIO 853786105}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|854842916|BIO 854842916}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Both {{u|Master-Of-America}} and an anonymous editor (who I assume are the same human being) introduce Chang’s nationality as “Chinese” and change his birthplace from “Taipei, Taiwan” to “Taipei, Taiwan, China” or “Taiwan, China” in this article of a BLP. Multiple editors have challenged this editor’s additions, two of whom (including myself) have explained why they disagree with them. “Chinese” is intended to be used to refer to persons who were born in mainland China and carry a Chinese passport (ex. [[Xi Jinping]]) as opposed to “Taiwanese” for persons born in the Republic of China ([[Tsai Ing-wen]]). In addition, “Taipei, Taiwan” is the most neutral and almost exclusively used term for Taipei; “Taipei, Taiwan, China”, I strongly feel ,goes against [[WP:POVNAMING]]. Sadly, this human instead chooses to engage in personal attacks, and since they are clearly not interested in engaging in constructive conversation to reach a consensus, I am starting this RfC to try to settle this matter. Thank you so much for your time. [[User:Zingarese|Zingarese]] [[User talk:Zingarese#top|<small>talk</small>]] · [[Special:Contributions/Zingarese|<small>contribs</small>]] 23:17, 6 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Donald Trump#rfc_60A64B6|Talk:Donald Trump]] expired 2018-08-14 18:01 ===
* Id: 60A64B6
* Date: 2018-07-15 18:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|850418981|BIO 850418981}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|850418983|HIST 850418983}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|850418986|POL 850418986}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|854919106|BIO 854919106}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|854919107|HIST 854919107}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|854919114|POL 854919114}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the second paragraph of the lead be updated as follows?

;From
<blockquote class="talkquote" style="background-color:#eee; border-left:3px solid #777; padding:0 .8em; margin:0;"><p>Trump entered the 2016 presidential race as a Republican and defeated sixteen opponents in the primaries. Commentators described his political positions as populist, protectionist, and nationalist. His campaign received extensive free media coverage; many of his public statements were controversial or false. Trump was elected president in a surprise victory over Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton. He became the oldest and wealthiest person ever to assume the presidency, the first without prior military or government service, and the fifth to have won the election while losing the popular vote. His election and policies have sparked numerous protests.</p></blockquote>

;To
{{tq2|Trump received extensive free media coverage during his 2016 presidential campaign, defeating sixteen Republican opponents in the primaries.  He was elected president in a surprise victory over Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton. He became the oldest and wealthiest person ever to assume the presidency, the first without prior military or government service, and the fifth to have won the election while losing the popular vote. Many of his public remarks have been controversial or false. Commentators have described his political positions as populist, protectionist, and nationalist. His election and policies have sparked numerous protests.}} 

This streamlines some wording, updates the ongoing nature of the false and controversial remarks, and keeps the material in chronological order.

<small>(Note: The above proposal does not preclude the additional wording proposed in the above RfC.)</small>

Please indicate whether you support or oppose the proposed change to the wording (or very similar). If you wish to propose different wording, please start a separate RfC. Thank you. - [[user:MrX|Mr]][[user talk:MrX|X]] 🖋 18:26, 15 July 2018 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:InfoWars#rfc_9C4F782|Talk:InfoWars]] expired 2018-08-14 22:01 ===
* Id: 9C4F782
* User: Justinkunimune
* Date: 2018-07-15 21:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|850440719|POL 850440719}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|850440721|POLICY 850440721}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|854951063|POL 854951063}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|854951068|POLICY 854951068}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Just scrolling through here, I noticed that there was a debate a few months ago about whether the phrase "far right" could be used in the intro to describe InfoWars like so:

:InfoWars (stylized as INFOWARS) is a '''far right''' American conspiracy theorist and fake news website and media platform owned by Alex Jones's Free Speech Systems LLC.

based on the [[WP:RS|WP:RSes]]:

* https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/infowars-leading-brands-youtube-pull-alex-jones-a8239371.html

* https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation-now/2018/05/24/sandy-hook-families-sue-infowars-alex-jones-over-conspiracy-theory/641159002/

* http://money.cnn.com/2018/03/03/technology/youtube-ads-infowars-alex-jones/index.html

* https://www.politico.com/story/2018/03/13/alex-jones-sued-charlottesville-claims-459244

It seemed like most editors in that discussion agreed with the descriptor, but because of historical objection decided to hold off until it could be properly decided by an Rfc. Then no one started an Rfc. I hate unfinished things, so here.

Should the first sentence of this article describe InfoWars as "far right"?

[[User:Justinkunimune|Justin Kunimune]] ([[User talk:Justinkunimune|talk]]) 21:07, 15 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fountain (Duchamp)#rfc_1F8A89A|Talk:Fountain (Duchamp)]] expired 2018-08-15 22:01 ===
* Id: 1F8A89A
* User: David Eppstein
* Date: 2018-07-16 21:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|850604607|MEDIA 850604607}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|855093023|MEDIA 855093023}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We keep having discussions on this that peter out without reaching a clear consensus, so it is my hope that a formal RFC will bring in a broader set of editors and improve the state of affairs.

Historically this artwork has been credited as being by Marcel Duchamp. But, it was originally signed under a pseudonym and in the 1980s a letter was discovered in which Duchamp credited an unnamed female friend for the work. Many recent sources, including both popular press, academic journal articles, and the Tate Museum (see discussion), have felt it necessary to at least mention this issue. Several of these sources outline alternative theories for its authorship and the identity of this friend, including Elsa von Freytag-Loringhoven, Louise Norton, or a female alter ego of Duchamp himself. Our article, too, describes these alternative theories in its body, but the lead (which by [[MOS:LEAD]] should accurately summarize the body) instead flatly says "produced by Marcel Duchamp") and the lead image (redundantly) also says "by Marcel Duchamp" without qualification. We have had multiple past discussions on this issue but they have tended to peter out inconclusively, and then their lack of conclusion has been used repeatedly by editors {{u|Coldcreation}} and {{u|Modernist}} as a reason for keeping the status quo, with any changes to the lead being reverted with edit summaries like "needs to be settled at talk page" or "per talk". In the meantime, another editor {{u|Trishcan}} has entered the debate with an [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fountain_(Duchamp)&oldid=850592822 alternative lead] that in my mind goes too far in another direction, going into excessive detail in the lead about the authorship question and choosing sides in favor of Elsa.

So, can we have a wider discussion, please, on the following five questions:
#Should the alternative authorship theories be described in the body of the article, as they now are?
#Should the lead summarize that part of the article?
#Should the authorship of the artwork be mentioned at all in the caption of the lead image?
#If the answers to parts (1) and (2) are yes, is the proposed summary in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fountain_(Duchamp)&oldid=848582678 this old version of the lead] accurate or, if not, what changes are needed to make it conform to [[MOS:LEAD]]?
#Alternatively, is Trishcan's lead, crediting EvFL rather than Duchamp, a better starting point for a new lead?
We have also had discussions here about whether "(Duchamp)" is an accurate disambiguator for the article title but I would prefer to keep that out of the RFC for now.
For the record, my own answers to these questions are (1) yes, with no additional changes needed; (2) yes, (3) no, (4) yes, (5) no. (In more detail re 4 vs 5: We should teach the controversy rather than picking sides, per [[WP:NPOV]]. And I don't think it is currently the consensus of art scholarship that EvFL created it. Rather, there are still many scholars who hold to the Duchamp theory, and others who would more likely say that it's unclear rather than picking any alternative theory. So until such a consensus is formed I think saying so here is premature.) —[[User:David Eppstein|David Eppstein]] ([[User talk:David Eppstein|talk]]) 21:41, 16 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tham Luang cave rescue#rfc_7021EAA|Talk:Tham Luang cave rescue]] expired 2018-08-15 23:01 ===
* Id: 7021EAA
* User: Coretheapple
* Date: 2018-07-29 14:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|852518338|BIO 852518338}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|852518341|SCI 852518341}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|852518343|POL 852518343}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|852518345|SOC 852518345}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|855099144|BIO 855099144}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|855099145|SCI 855099145}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|855099149|POL 855099149}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|855099153|SOC 855099153}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
At the present time [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tham_Luang_cave_rescue&oldid=852432173] we have a subsection consisting of two lengthy paragraphs, titled "Elon Musk," describing his work on a child-sized submarine to rescue the boys and how it was not used. There is also a description of the controversy it engendered, which included a war of words between Musk and one of the rescuers that raises BLP issues. Currently the amount of space devoted to the Musk controversy is significantly longer than the "Recovery" subsection devoted to the actual removal of the boys from the cave. The question is how much space should be devoted to this matter. I think reasonable choices are.

#''' The current amount of space.'''
#'''Far less space, just a few sentences, and no subsection.'''
#'''More space'''
#'''Other'''

--- [[User:Coretheapple|Coretheapple]] ([[User talk:Coretheapple|talk]]) 14:02, 29 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Elon Musk#rfc_C1EBDD6|Talk:Elon Musk]] expired 2018-08-18 00:01 ===
* Id: C1EBDD6
* User: TomasTomasTomas
* Date: 2018-07-30 20:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|852709012|BIO 852709012}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|857144426|BIO 857144426}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC was made to discuss whenever the subsection regarding Musk's false accusations of Unsworth should be kept or removed. See [[Talk:Elon_Musk#Pedo_Accusations]] for previous discussion and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elon_Musk&diff=852141275&oldid=852136527 the edit before the edit war began] as reference. [[User:TomasTomasTomas|TomasTomasTomas]] ([[User talk:TomasTomasTomas|talk]]) 20:38, 30 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Songs#rfc_244E381|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Songs]] expired 2018-08-19 18:01 ===
* Id: 244E381
* User: Ojorojo
* Date: 2018-08-09 17:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|854209570|MEDIA 854209570}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|855626789|MEDIA 855626789}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Consensus during a [[Template talk:Infobox song#Make it go away -- partial track listing|recent discussion]] was to remove partial track listings from song infoboxes.  Some editors also felt that all track listings (full album track lists) should also be removed ([[Template:Infobox song#Track listing examples]] addresses their use).  Since the album is linked in the infobox, are these needed?  Many have already been replaced with album navboxes outside of the infoboxes. Please indicate '''Keep''' or '''Remove''' followed by your reasons. —[[User:Ojorojo|Ojorojo]] ([[User talk:Ojorojo|talk]]) 17:19, 9 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Trypophobia#rfc_00C2BF3|Talk:Trypophobia]] expired 2018-08-19 20:01 ===
* Id: 00C2BF3
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2018-07-20 19:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|851209086|SCI 851209086}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|851209088|MEDIA 851209088}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|851209094|SOC 851209094}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|855639889|SCI 855639889}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|855639892|MEDIA 855639892}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|855639897|SOC 855639897}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As seen above at [[Talk:Trypophobia#Latest changes]], there is disagreement on whether or not we should limit text to a source's exact words. In this regard, the question of whether it's [[WP:Original research]] to use our own wording as opposed to a source's exact words, and whether summarizing/paraphrasing material by using the word "some" needs to be tagged as [[WP:Weasel]], has come up. The disagreement additionally concerns extensively quoting from a source, free or not, and [[WP:YESPOV|stating things in Wikipedia's voice]] when sources disagree, the research is new, and/or there is no consensus in the literature on the matter.

Should we only use a source's exact wording? Is it WP:Original research to summarize/paraphrase a source without using the source's exact words? Should we quote extensively from a source, whether it's free or not? [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 19:16, 20 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_F3724F0|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2018-08-19 20:01 ===

Should a policy or guideline be developed/formalized relating to the cross-namespace wiki linking of drafts within articles (ie article A contains a wikilink to Draft B, which itself does not have a mainspace article)? To clarify: I dont mean redirects, I am talking of links to drafts within articles. --[[User:TheSandDoctor|<span style="color:#FF9933; font-weight:bold; font-family:monotype;">The</span><span style="color:#009933; font-weight:bold;">SandDoctor</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:TheSandDoctor|<span style="color:#009933;">Talk</span>]]</sup> 18:34, 15 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Domestic violence#rfc_3FEFD4D|Talk:Domestic violence]] expired 2018-08-20 12:01 ===
* Id: 3FEFD4D
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2018-07-21 11:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|851307571|MEDIA 851307571}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|851307573|POL 851307573}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|851307575|SOC 851307575}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|855725861|MEDIA 855725861}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|855725867|POL 855725867}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|855725869|SOC 855725869}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As seen in [[Talk:Domestic violence#NPOV discussion on Domestic violence#Gender differences|a section]] above this one, one view is that the article lends [[WP:Undue weight|undue weight]] to women as victims and/or their use of [[self-defense]] as a reason for domestic violence. This view argues that the prevalence of violence perpetrated by women is downplayed, and that quality sources support this. This view says that there should be more in the article about domestic violence against men and certain related debates. The other view is that the article reflects the general literature on this matter and is therefore WP:Due weight. The literature on domestic violence/[[intimate partner violence]] focuses significantly more on women than it does on men and states that domestic violence disproportionately affects women or that domestic violence victims are overwhelmingly women and that they suffer more severe consequences. It also significantly highlights self-defense as the main, or one of the main, reasons that women engage in domestic violence/intimate partner violence. Quality sources support this. Not every debate should be be included or get as much weight.  

So, for this RfC, the question is...does the article lend undue weight to women as victims and/or their use of self-defense as a reason for domestic violence? I'll alert [[WP:Women]], [[WP:Men]], [[WP:Sociology]] and [[WP:Med]] to this RfC. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 11:45, 21 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jordan Peterson#rfc_51FC6D9|Talk:Jordan Peterson]] expired 2018-08-22 12:01 ===
* Id: 51FC6D9
* User: Markworthen
* Date: 2018-08-22 01:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|856031724|UNSORTED 856031724}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
</nowiki> template when the dispute has been resolved, or when discussion has ended.</blockquote>

:::<blockquote>Anyone who wants an uninvolved editor to write a closing summary of the discussion (ideally with a determination of consensus) can formally request closure by posting at Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard/Requests for closure. If the matter under discussion is not contentious and the consensus is obvious to the participants, then formal closure is neither necessary nor advisable. Written closing statements are not required. Editors are expected to be able to evaluate and agree upon the results of most RfCs without outside assistance.</blockquote>

:::<blockquote>An RfC should last until enough comment has been received that consensus is reached, or until it is apparent it won't be. </blockquote>
:::The last sentence is the crucial one: "An RfC should last until enough comment has been received that consensus is reached, or until it is apparent it won't be." I said a while back that I doubted we could reach consensus. I changed my mind. Thus, a new section, [[Talk:Jordan Peterson#Let's do our best to reach consensus]] (below). [[User:Markworthen|<span style="color:#539; font-family:copperplate gothic">&nbsp; - Mark D Worthen PsyD</span>]] [[User talk:Markworthen|<span style="color:#64B; font-family:times new roman">(talk)</span>]] 01:17, 22 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2018 Westminster car crash#rfc_05A486A|Talk:2018 Westminster car crash]] expired 2018-08-23 00:01 ===
* Id: 05A486A
* User: WWGB
* Date: 2018-08-19 08:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|855710478|POLICY 855710478}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|857646866|POLICY 857646866}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The alleged perpetrator, Salih Khater, has now been charged with attempted murder. His name is published in reliable sources around the world. He no longer passes the test of being "relatively unknown". Wikipedia will look foolish and out of touch if it continues to redact his name from the article. [[User:WWGB|WWGB]] ([[User talk:WWGB|talk]]) 08:36, 19 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Millennials#rfc_A5C5FA7|Talk:Millennials]] expired 2018-08-23 08:01 ===
* Id: A5C5FA7
* User: Akhila3151996
* Date: 2018-07-24 07:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|851735363|SOC 851735363}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|856157227|SOC 856157227}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I made a proposal to edit the lead of the "Millennials" article from saying, "There are no precise dates for when this cohort starts or ends; demographers and researchers typically use the early 1980s as starting birth years and the mid-1990s to early 2000s as ending birth years", to "There are no precise dates for when this cohort starts or ends; demographers and researchers typically use the early 1980s to the mid 1990s as the cohort's birth years, with some extending the end of the cohort up to the early 2000s." Recently there has been new research regarding millennial end dates. Obviously this is not an exact science, but I feel that we need to constantly update the page with the most current consensus and new findings. We are currently having a discussion at the bottom of this talk page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Millennials. Please carefully read the discussion before commenting. Another request I have is to only include reliable, well researched sources from reputable people or organizations, and to cut down [[WP:UNDUE]] sources. However editor DynaGirl is claiming that these undue sources are from notable researchers and demographers and that “they have stood the test of time.” She is yet to give proper evidence to back up her claims besides restating the same things she has already said multiple times on different discussions. -[[User:Akhila3151996|Akhila3151996]] ([[User talk:Akhila3151996|talk]]) 07:08, 24 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of housing cooperatives in Canada#rfc_B29575E|Talk:List of housing cooperatives in Canada]] expired 2018-08-23 19:01 ===
* Id: B29575E
* User: Bearcat
* Date: 2018-07-24 18:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|851808885|MEDIA 851808885}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|856226506|MEDIA 856226506}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Please note that per [[WP:NOTDIRECTORY]], Wikipedia does '''not''' use lists to create comprehensive [[WP:PRIMARYSOURCES|primary-sourced]] directories of "every non-notable thing in this class that happens to exist in the world" — Wikipedia lists (especially if they have open-ended inclusion criteria that invite hundreds or thousands of entries instead of a small defined number) are not free-for-all "web directories" of everything that ''exists'', but are finding aids for ''Wikipedia'' content. So the ''only'' appropriate entry on this list is the one that '''has a Wikipedia article to link to''', and padding the list out with non-notables, sourced only to their own [[WP:SELFPUB|self-published]] websites or the CHFC's directory of its member co-ops, is ''not'' an acceptable detour ''around'' the fact that there's no substantive reason to keep a list of just one thing. This was clearly an attempt to undercut an AFD discussion by turning the list into something Wikipedia lists are not supposed to be, and it is not acceptable. [[User:Bearcat|Bearcat]] ([[User talk:Bearcat|talk]]) 18:43, 24 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ohio gubernatorial election, 2018#rfc_7EDAFCE|Talk:Ohio gubernatorial election, 2018]] expired 2018-08-24 09:01 ===
* Id: 7EDAFCE
* User: Dael4
* Date: 2018-07-28 04:05:00

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 What is wikipedia current policy? [[User:power~enwiki|power~enwiki]]? I am thinking of inclusiveness as one of them. Why shouldn't it be a current policy here? It is not consensus that should rule, that is too simplistic. Inclusiveness should also be considered for fuller coverage. It almost sounds like including third or independent parties as something that shouldn't happen? This, as an encyclopedia, should have all of the situation of the elections in Ohio. I have noticed some who have colluded to purposely deny ANY third party access on other Wiki pages. If you look you will find it. It is happening as we speak.  To me it is deeply disturbing and should be to every wikipedian. [[User:bradv|bradv]] quoted me that wikipedia is not a democracy but I keep getting quoted info about polls as a basis for publishing. Democracy as in hearing people out is what's important. Publish the facts. So and so is running. Good! There are 5 candidates in Ohio. With only two pictures of them seems as though someone is playing favorites. Not a Democracy?, then no polls should be cited as an inclusive principle. Either way the poll argument is a fail, in that full information on THE candidates is not available. [[User:Dael4|Dael4]] ([[User talk:Dael4|talk]]) 04:05, 28 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of 7400-series integrated circuits#rfc_937D264|Talk:List of 7400-series integrated circuits]] expired 2018-08-25 16:01 ===
* Id: 937D264
* User: Rings48
* Date: 2018-07-26 15:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|852095472|SCI 852095472}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|856488731|SCI 856488731}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
  Currently this page attempts to differentiate 'legacy' and 'modern' chips. Can we instead combine the section to focus on as list of functions in the 7400s? First, this creates an arbitrary line between of the age of a part and does not denote whether the part is in production. Second, the 7400 is a 2-input NAND gate where all subsequent families used a 74xx00 as a the NAND function in the family. This would remove the need for the 1G-3G tables since 1G-3G parts are their are device families; this is because the LVC1G and the LVC device families are different technologies and can be seen in the voltage ranges of the devices.  [[User:Rings48|Rings48]] ([[User talk:Rings48|talk]]) 15:21, 26 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Flag of NATO#rfc_0C608A9|Talk:Flag of NATO]] expired 2018-08-27 14:01 ===
* Id: 0C608A9
* User: 475847394d347339
* Date: 2018-07-28 13:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|852368669|POL 852368669}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|856781501|POL 856781501}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The official color and ratio of the [[Flag of NATO]] is [[Pantone]] 280 and 3:4. However, an alternate flag with a 3:5 ratio and lighter color is used referring to "NATO flag" in a 2016 Visual Identity Guidelines and "Secretary General’s Annual Report 2014" with a small variation in the size of the star. Use of flag is rare in NATO documents because of a recommendation to use logos instead, and the proper flag doesn't appear in any recent document either. My position is to create a new section titled "Alternative color and ratio" or "Unofficial variants/uses." More information on the [[:Talk:Flag of NATO#Alternate flags of NATO|Talk page]]. [[User:475847394d347339|475847394d347339]] ([[User talk:475847394d347339|talk]]) 13:56, 28 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Israel#rfc_C623694|Talk:Israel]] expired 2018-08-28 04:01 ===
* Id: C623694
* User: 2001:AC8:33:C:307:200:0:10A5
* Date: 2018-08-26 11:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|856813871|POL 856813871}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|861143406|POL 861143406}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Remove the "dispited" template from the lede, and add the following text:
<blockquote> In its [[Basic Laws of Israel|Basic Laws]], Israel defines itself as a [[Jewish and democratic state]].<ref name=israelbasiclaws>{{Cite web|url=http://knesset.gov.il/description/eng/eng_mimshal_yesod.htm|title=Basic Laws|website=knesset.gov.il|access-date=2018-07-30}}</ref><ref name=freedomhouse2008>{{cite web |url=http://www.freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2008/israel |work=Freedom in the World |title=Israel |publisher=Freedom House |year=2008 |accessdate=20 March 2012}}</ref> Israel is a [[Multi-party system|multi-party]]<ref name=encyclopediabritannica>{{Cite news|url=https://www.britannica.com/place/Israel/Government|title=Israel - Government|work=Encyclopedia Britannica|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}}</ref> [[representative democracy]]{{refn|group=fn|name=democracy|Both [[Democracy Index]] and [[Freedom House]] describe Israel as a "[[Political freedom|free country]]" and a "[[democracy]]", ranking it among the world's top countries in the areas of [[political rights]] and [[freedom of speech]], but criticize the record of some of its other [[civil liberties]].<ref name=democracyindex2017>Israel ranks within the top 30 in the world out of 167 countries. {{Cite web|url=http://pages.eiu.com/rs/753-riq-438/images/democracy_index_2017.pdf|title=Democracy Index 2017 — FULL REPORT by the Economist Intelligence Unit|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name=freedomintheworld2018>Israel ranks the [https://freedomhouse.org/country/israel aggregate score of 79 points] out of 100. {{Cite web|url=https://freedomhouse.org/sites/default/files/FH_FITW_Report_2018_Final_SinglePage.pdf|title=Freedom in the World 2018 — FULL REPORT by the Freedom House|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>}} with a [[parliamentary system]], [[proportional representation]] and [[universal suffrage]].<ref name=rummel1997>{{Harvard citation no brackets|Rummel|1997|p=257}}. "A current list of liberal democracies includes: Andorra, Argentina, ..., Cyprus, ..., Israel, ..."</ref><ref name=freedomhouseglobalsurvey2006>{{cite web|url=http://www.freedomhouse.org/article/global-survey-2006-middle-east-progress-amid-global-gains-freedom |title=Global Survey 2006: Middle East Progress Amid Global Gains in Freedom |accessdate=20 March 2012 |date=19 December 2005 |publisher=Freedom House}}</ref> </blockquote>
Several different versions of it were supported by the vast majority of the editors in the RfCs. It's about time to add it to the article now.
{{reflist|group=fn}}
<references /> [[Special:Contributions/2001:AC8:33:C:307:200:0:10A5|2001:AC8:33:C:307:200:0:10A5]] ([[User talk:2001:AC8:33:C:307:200:0:10A5|talk]]) 11:36, 26 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Battle of the Coral Sea#rfc_1BC31BC|Talk:Battle of the Coral Sea]] expired 2018-08-28 05:01 ===
* Id: 1BC31BC
* User: EtherealGate
* Date: 2018-08-28 03:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|856880830|HIST 856880830}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|856885497|HIST 856885497}}
* RFC Text:

Should infoboxes follow a strict interpretation of [[Template:Infobox military conflict/doc]]? Per the discussion above, articles like [[Wars of the Roses]], [[World War II]], [[World War I]], [[Hundred Years' War]], as well as [[War of the Austrian Succession]], [[King George's War]], [[War of the Spanish Succession]], [[Samoan Civil War]], and many more others are violations. Per discussion with [[User:Cinderella157|Cinderella157]] above, we cannot use results like "stalemate", "indecisive", "withdrawal", "status quo ante bellum", "ceasefire", "truce", "compromise", simple "treaty" results, or any other description and bullet points as they are contrary of Template:Infobox military conflict/doc. [[User:EtherealGate|EtherealGate]] ([[User talk:EtherealGate|talk]]) 03:28, 28 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jordan#rfc_7B6C156|Talk:Jordan]] expired 2018-08-28 17:01 ===
* Id: 7B6C156
* User: Makeandtoss
* Date: 2018-07-29 16:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We are trying to decide whether or not to have the origin and meaning of the name "Jordan" in the etymology section. The first party favors removing it and placing it at the etymology of the [[Jordan River]] article, and the other favors keeping it or at least a brief explanation on it. Currently it is the first party's version, and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jordan&diff=851319326&oldid=851298258 this] is the second party's version. [[User:Makeandtoss|Makeandtoss]] ([[User talk:Makeandtoss|talk]]) 16:04, 29 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Dennis Prager#rfc_EBA995F|Talk:Dennis Prager]] expired 2018-08-29 18:01 ===
* Id: EBA995F
* User: Shinealittlelight
* Date: 2018-08-21 01:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|855818910|BIO 855818910}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|857120117|BIO 857120117}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The article currently quotes NPR as saying that Prager "targets multiculturalism, Muslims, and LGBTQ people." The NPR article in question also provides evidence for this claim. I have suggested that this evidence should be included in the piece to make it more informative what the NPR report is getting at. [[User:Ronz|Ronz]] disagrees, and apparently takes the view that while the assertion about Prager targeting these things is of encyclopedic value, the evidence for this claim about targeting is not of encyclopedic value. Ronz also believes that I should not pursue this matter further, as I am a new user. Perhaps he is right, and I apologize if I'm in violation of some policy. But, since I felt I had made a reasonable suggestion in good faith, I was hoping to get some more people to give a perspective on this matter.[[User:Shinealittlelight|Shinealittlelight]] ([[User talk:Shinealittlelight|talk]]) 01:00, 21 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:European political party#rfc_E1AB0E6|Talk:European political party]] expired 2018-08-30 12:01 ===
* Id: E1AB0E6
* User: 213.254.88.156
* Date: 2018-07-31 11:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|853981771|POL 853981771}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|857233070|POL 857233070}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Consider the European Left Party a far left group or the European Green Party a Left wing group and then consider the European People´s Party a centre-right one and ALDE a centre one is politically motivated. Almost all member parties in ALDE are centre-right, sometimes even more in the right than the EPP national counterpart. In the same way, consider the EPP just centre-right is not correct, there ir a more centre-right wing and a more right-wing one inside the party. EPP leaders of Slovenia, Bavaria, Hungary, Spain, France or Austria nowdays are clearly not centre-right.

Let´s be objective about this and don´t try to manipulate. Consider liberalism centre tries to demonize ideologies and parties coming from socialism. A true centrist party would be the one compromising socialism and liberalism, a liberal socialism as would say Norberto Bobbio. The PES and the EPP were centre- right and centre-left in the past because of social-democracy and christian-democracy builduing european welfare state system. since times have changed, new parties have arise, as well as new sociologial times, this has changed a bit, but the idea is the same. Classical liberalism or even neoliberalism is not the centre, because it is not a compromise of liberal socialism, it is a centre-right option that understands freedom only on its negative-freedom approach. In the same way, the more conservative, nationalistic, right-wing posittions of many EPP members cannot be avoided. --[[Special:Contributions/213.254.88.156|213.254.88.156]] ([[User talk:213.254.88.156|talk]]) 11:20, 31 July 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_60EE423|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2018-08-30 18:01 ===
* Id: 60EE423
* User: Newslinger#top
* Date: 2018-08-30 07:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|857209794|MEDIA 857209794}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|857209796|POLICY 857209796}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|857209802|PROP 857209802}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|857276836|MEDIA 857276836}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|857276838|POLICY 857276838}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|857276839|PROP 857276839}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC on the reliability of ''[[InfoWars]]'' asks editors:
# Is ''[[InfoWars]]'' a [[WP:UNRELIABLE|generally unreliable]] source?
# Should the use of ''[[InfoWars]]'' as a reference be generally prohibited, especially when other more [[WP:RS|reliable sources]] exist?
# Should ''[[InfoWars]]'' be used for determining [[WP:N|notability]]?
# Should ''[[InfoWars]]'' be used as a [[WP:SECONDARY|secondary source]] in articles?
# Should an [[WP:EF|edit filter]] be put in place going forward to warn editors attempting to use ''[[InfoWars]]'' as a reference?
—&nbsp;'''''[[User:Newslinger|<span style="color:#536267;">Newslinger</span>]]'''&nbsp;<small>[[User talk:Newslinger#top|<span style="color:#708090;">talk</span>]]</small>'' 07:03, 30 August 2018 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:History of Crayola crayons#rfc_C6F0FDF|Talk:History of Crayola crayons]] expired 2018-08-30 19:01 ===
* Id: C6F0FDF
* User: DanielRigal
* Date: 2018-07-31 18:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|852841781|ECON 852841781}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|857284370|ECON 857284370}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Opinions are requested as to whether the numeric colour values (RGB, HSV and Hexadecimal) in the various tables in this article are appropriate? Is this excessively detailed overcoverage? If such values are deemed potentially appropriate, further opinions are requested as to how they can be validly referenced to provide [[WP:V|verifiability]]. It has become clear (from discussion above) that these values were derived from colour swatches and sampled from websites in what I believe to be an act of [[WP:OR|original research]]. I believe the values to be unverified and also intrinsically unverifiable. As a glance at the discussion above will reveal, this is very strongly disputed with no consensus as the correct way to apply the policies, so opinions on this are requested. I have removed the value columns once and have been reverted. Ultimately, '''I would like to know whether to remove them again?''' If there is a consensus to remove them here, should similar columns of values also be removed from any of the other articles in the Crayola walled garden that survive their AfDs? --[[User:DanielRigal|DanielRigal]] ([[User talk:DanielRigal|talk]]) 18:52, 31 July 2018 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
{{Infobox country
|name = United States of America 
|government_type = [[Federation|Federal]] [[Presidential system|presidential]] [[Constitutionalism|constitutional]] [[Republic|republic]]}}

This technically is correct but is definitely too simplistic and below the standards of the average Wikipedia article on a country. Just look at any article on a country and the government description is similar to the one I'm proposing we return to. ** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|853116821|HIST 853116821}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
* [[Neve Barbur]]
* [[Azorei Hen]]
* [[Migdalei Ne'eman]]
* [[Ramat Aviv HaHadasha]]
* [[Kiryat Atidim]]
* [[Tel Baruch]]
* [[Yisgav]]
* [[Giv'at Amal Bet]]
* [[Menashiya]]

* [[Tzahalon]]
* [[Nahalat Yitzhak]]
* [[Neve Tzahal]]
* [[Yad Eliyahu]]

The articles listed are stubs with little or no content.  Also, many of them are unreferenced or largely relies on a single source.  I can't find specific guidelines regarding neighborhoods in [[WP:GEOLAND]] pertaining to neighborhoods.

I would like to request comment for the following issues:
# What should be done with these articles?  They were attempts by [[User:Shadowowl]] and others to delete some of these article or draftify them (move them back to draft space).  However, the PROD was kept as it was assumed Shadow made them in bad faith without doing any BEFORE work.  Also, Shadow's attempt to move them back to draft was also undone.  That is why I'm opening the RFC to avoid going through nominating the individual articles for AFD, which is seen as disruptive. --[[User:Tyw7|<i style="font-family:'Rock salt','Comic Sans MS'; color: Green;">Tyw7</i>]] ([[User:Tyw7/t|🗣️ Talk]]) — If (reply) then ([[Wikipedia:Notifications#Alerts|ping me]]) 14:11, 2 August 2018 (UTC)}}
